Issuing authorisation

CARDS-55790

Added device name (WSP_DEVNAME), device ID (WSP_DEVID) and last four digits of mobile phone number (WSP_L4DIG) saving in the database as token parameters on MDES / VTS enrolment.
Upgrade Note:
3 parameters must be created for existing MDES/VDEP/MIR(tokenization)"Identification Schemes" (OpenWay\Authentication Module\Identification Types -> [Parms]:

1) 
Name = Mobile Number Last 4 digits
Code = WSP_L4DIG
Is Global = No
Is Mandatory = No
Parm Type = String

2) 
Name = Device ID
Code = WSP_DEVID
Is Global = No
Is Mandatory = No
Parm Type = String

3) 
Name = Device Name
Code = WSP_DEVNAME
Is Global = No
Is Mandatory = No
Parm Type = String
	
and changes to the scheme must be approved by clicking on the [Approve] button.

CARDS-51820 / I1612121917

"No Check" Auth scenario has been removed from forms as obsolete. The additional global parameter ENABLE_NO_CHECK is no longer supported.
Upgrade Note:
The additional global parameter ENABLE_NO_CHECK is no longer supported. It is not possible to create new products/contract with Auth scenario=No Check (existing contracts with Auth Scenario=No Check will be processed as See Main).
Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf]

CARDS-55431 / I1710259099

Fixed issue. Now by default the authorisation process does not apply deferred tasks and the Secondary->Primary Synchronisation process does not create deferred tasks. If you use High Availability solutions, set HA.DEFERRED_DOC_APPLY=Y global parameter to restore the old behaviour and make sure that Object Task Scheduler is always running.
Upgrade Note:
Now by default the authorisation process does not apply deferred tasks and the Secondary->Primary Synchronisation process does not create deferred tasks. If you use High Availability solutions, set HA.DEFERRED_DOC_APPLY=Y global parameter to restore the old behaviour and make sure that Object Task Scheduler is always running.
Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

JCB interface

CARDS-51481

JCB ISO Outward (variable): added the "EXT_CURR_EXP" parameter for changing the currency exponent on transaction export.
Upgrade Note:
JCB ISO Outward (variable): added the "EXT_CURR_EXP" parameter for changing the currency exponent on transaction export. Parameter format: EXT_CURR_EXP = <3_digit_currency><1_digit_exponent_to_be_used>. This parameter can be used if the currency exponent in WAY4 differs from the JCB currency exponent.
For example EXT_CURR_EXP = 7040 (use 0 exponent for VND currency).

CARDS-53336

JCB: Added message codes ("RjP-----","RJP-----","RmP-----","RmR-----") for reject processing.
Upgrade Note:
If the new JCB ISO format is used, the following Message Types must be added (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All):
1.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected Item Fin
Code=RmP-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected Item Fin
2.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected Fixing
Code=RmR-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected Fixing
Msg Details=OUT_ST=C;
3.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected Item
Code=RjP-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected Item
4.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected File
Code=RJP-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected File

Loyalty

CARDS-51461

Added the ability to limit the bonus points amount accrued for a client contract within a loyalty campaign. The limit amount should be set in the "Action Total Limit" field of the tariff action, the ACTION_LIMIT_MODE=LOCAL tag indicates that the action limit should be calculated for each contract. A new strict mode has been added to check the action limit, it prevents total points from exceeding the specified limit with the last transaction; ACTION_LIMIT_MODE=STRICT should be set for the tariff action.
Upgrade Note:
The principle has changed for calculating custom fees with contract redefinition (CONTRACT_FOR tag) and a fee amount (FEE_BASE_FROM=FROM_BALANCE or FEE_BASE_FROM=CUSTOM tag). These tags are set in the Service Details field of the "Custom Fee for..." form. The old behaviour used the original contract with the Service in which the custom fee was was defined. In the new behaviour, the balance of the redefined contract is used in calculation, like in system behaviour during authorisation.

CARDS-51610

Added the ability to limit the bonus points amount accrued for a client contract within a loyalty campaign. The limit amount should be set in the "Action Total Limit" field of the tariff action, the ACTION_LIMIT_MODE=LOCAL tag indicates that the action limit should be calculated for each contract. A new strict mode has been added to check the action limit, it prevents total points from exceeding the specified limit with the last transaction; ACTION_LIMIT_MODE=STRICT should be set for the tariff action.
Upgrade Note:
The principle has changed for calculating custom fees with contract redefinition (CONTRACT_FOR tag) and a fee amount (FEE_BASE_FROM=FROM_BALANCE or FEE_BASE_FROM=CUSTOM tag). These tags are set in the Service Details field of the "Custom Fee for..." form. The old behaviour used the original contract with the Service in which the custom fee was was defined. In the new behaviour, the balance of the redefined contract is used in calculation, like in system behaviour during authorisation.

MasterCard interface

CARDS-48289

MasterCard Debit Switch is supported in the XLS_MC_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf report. The P_CHANNEL parameter added. The default value is 'D', 'E', 'e'. Changes have been made to the standard version of cust_stat_attr_value. Please see Upgrade Notes on Impact changes for details.
Upgrade Note:
The XLS_MC_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf report has been updated: MasterCard Debit Switch transactions are now supported in the report. For these changes to be applied in statistics, do the following 
1. Merge the new standard version of the cust_stat_attr_value procedure with the one used (if it was customized)
2. Drop statistics for the whole reporting period (run the menu items OpenWay\Full\Statistics\Drop Statistics and OpenWay\Full\Statistics\Dictionaries\Purge Obsolete Statistical Groups)
3. Install the XLS_MC_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf report from this version according to doc\reportssetup.html manual.
Updated Manuals: [core\WAY4 Statistical Reports.pdf]

CARDS-55628

Fixed the customized fields processing for MasterCard CDF Export process. If a customized field in the ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters had [null] value, non-customized value was used for export. Now standard value is used only when there is no customized field in the ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters. Otherwise, a customized value is used even if it has [null] value.
Upgrade Note:
The customized fields processing has been fixed for MasterCard CDF Export process. If a customized field in the ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters had [null] value, non-customized value was used for export. Now standard value is used only when there is no customized field in the ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters. Otherwise, a customized value is used even if it has [null] value. Please review ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters to check if [null] value ("<CustomField>=;") is used to export the non-customized fields.

CARDS-56616

Supported database currencies overrides for the MasterCard CDF interface.
Upgrade Note:
If the currency code or currency exponent in the CURRENCY table differs from MasterCard CDF format, currency override must be set up. Refer to the "Redefining Currency Parameters" chapter of the "Currency Conversion" manual for more information.

CARDS-56671

Added the ability to skip export of unchanged corporations for the MasterCard CDF Export interface.
Upgrade Note:
To skip export of the "CorporateEntity" aggregate without any embedded records, the new EXPORT_EMPTY_CORPORATION=N pipe parameter must be set. The new parameter works only when the ORG_REC_CHOICE=U pipe parameter is also set.

CARDS-52360

MasterCard MCBS Import: Supported new format according to Global Operations Bulletin No. 2 - 1 February 2017.
Upgrade Note:
To load old format files, set the pipe parameter LINE_LENGTH=500.

MasterCard MCBS Import: Supported new format according to Global Operations Bulletin No. 2 - 1 February 2017.

CARDS-53033

MasterCard Services: Added services according to Release 17.Q3 article AN 1005.
Upgrade Note:
Acquirers in Asia Pacific region: Use Copy Configuration to synchronize MasterCard service packs from file \home\db\datax\config\MC_IRD_CFG_SP_CC.txt.

(MasterCard Services: Added services according to Release 17.Q3 article AN 1005)

CARDS-53040

MasterCard Services: Added services according to Release 17.Q3 article AN 1004.
Upgrade Note:
Acquirers in Europe region that participate in the Meal Voucher program must use Copy Configuration to synchronize MasterCard service packs from file \home\db\datax\config\MC_IRD_CFG_SP_CC.txt.

(MasterCard Services: Added services according to Release 17.Q3 article AN 1004.)

CARDS-53808

Areas: "South Sudan" (code SSD) is included in "MC: Middle East, Africa (E)" area.
Upgrade Note:
"South Sudan" (code SSD) must be manually included in "MC: Middle East, Africa (E)" area.

CARDS-55960

Switched the MasterCard CDF Export pipe to CDF3 Schema Version 17.01.00.00.
Upgrade Note:
The MasterCard CDF Export pipe has been switched to CDF3 Schema Version 17.01.00.00.

Money transfers

CARDS-53816

B2B and G2B money transfers license validation has been implemented for the following transaction application codes: 
FD,GD,MD,OG,C02,C03,C04,C05,C06,C09,C55,C56,C57.
Upgrade Note:
To allow the system to process B2B (FD) money transfer transactions (application codes: FD,GD,MD,OG,C02,C03,C04,C05,C06,C09,C55,C56,C57), the appropriate license option must be configured. Please contact Customer Support.

CARDS-54224

B2B and G2B money transfers license validation has been implemented for the following transaction application codes: 
FD,GD,MD,OG,C02,C03,C04,C05,C06,C09,C55,C56,C57.
Upgrade Note:
To allow the system to process B2B (FD) money transfer transactions (application codes: FD,GD,MD,OG,C02,C03,C04,C05,C06,C09,C55,C56,C57), the appropriate license option must be configured. Please contact Customer Support.

CARDS-54891

Changed VISA OCT reversal processing. OCT reversals with Target Channel "VISA SMS" are rejected with Return Code "12" and Posting Status "Under Workflow". OCT reversals with Target Channel "VISA" are not sent in the online phase and should be sent in clearing.
Upgrade Note:
In unforeseen situations (sending online reversals of OCT transactions to the VISA channel) a document is assigned the Under Workflow status - for manual analysis.
After reconciliation, documents with this status must be analysed and a decision taken on whether to post or reverse a document.
Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

NSPK interface

CARDS-49206

XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf: Default value of P_IS_TRANSFER_CREDIT_FLT, P_IS_CREDIT_FLT corrected.
P_IS_TRANSFER_FLT parameter deleted.
P_ATTR_TRN_IS_TRANSFER added.
Columns 4-7, 16-21 corrected.

TRN_IS_TRANSFER new statistic attribute added.
Upgrade Note:
To support the requirements of NSPK Operational bulletin #38.2015 of 29.12.2015 updated on 19.01.2016, it is necessary to do the following in the XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf report (per the task CARDS-48998)
1. Load statistic attributes from the configuration file or add the TRN_IS_TRANSFER statistic attribute manually in the OpenWay\Full\Statistics\Dictionaries\Statistic Attributes (custom) form.
2. If WAY4Cards version 03.43.30 is used, install the new version of the cust_stat_attr_value package. The support of this attribute is provided in standard system packages starting from version 03.44.30.
Updated Manuals: [core\WAY4 Statistical Reports.pdf]

CARDS-49766

Fixed DE0165.01 filling. NSPK Collection Only Export.
Upgrade Note:
Processors must set up the NSPK_BANK_ID tag in the "Special Parms" field for the financial institution (menu path "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Financial Institutions"). The tag must have a 5-digit Unique Member ID value assigned by NSPK to this financial institution("NSPK_BANK_ID=<value>;") .

CARDS-56735

Added the ability to run several NSPK Export processes in parallel.
Upgrade Note:
Added the ability to use a sequence generated by DB file numbering, which allows several NSPK Export processes to be run simultaneously.

CARDS-53502

[MIR REL] 2017.2 B-05. NSPK Outward Processing (pipe): EMV tag 84 is filled with the "EMV_AID" document tag value if tag 84 is absent in addendum_doc chip data.
Upgrade Note:
If the "Affiliated BASEII Outward Processing" pipe is used for Host2Host interchange, the "EMV_AID" tag must be added to the pipe's "TAGS_TC50_<Processing BIN>" parameter to support [MIR REL] 2017.2 B-05.
Updated Manuals: NSPK Interface | Release Requirements [UFX_H2H_Interchange.pdf (NDA Specification for vendors)]

Notifications

CARDS-54717

Changed the result of a value returned by the %TRANS_REASON_DETAILS% variable. Now it returns the whole text from the doc.reason_details field instead of text from doc.add_info.
Upgrade Note:
In case the previous %TRANS_REASON_DETAILS% variable behaviour should be kept, it is recommended to find a setup that uses the variable and change %TRANS_REASON_DETAILS% to %DOC_TAGS% and %TRANS_REASON_DETAILS:tag% to %DOC_TAGS:tag%.

The SQL queries from the check script CHECK_v1_CARDS-54717_SMS_template_reason_details.sql can be used to find message templates. The script will be provided by OpenWay.
Updated Manuals: [notifications\transaction_notifications\Transaction_Notifications.pdf]

Product inspector

CARDS-51348 / I1611305656

Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with codes that already exist: a UI dialog is displayed to confirm the script update. If script update is chosen, all the existing test steps will be deleted and the new one rewritten. This dialog window appears only if the pipe's SILENT mode parameter is switched off.
Upgrade Note:
Test script import has been modified. When the file being imported contains scripts with the same codes as those already in the database, and the user confirmed update, the old behaviour was to merge data: script steps from the file being imported whose numbers matched those already in the database were rewritten, and all other steps in the database (if any) remained unchanged. The new behaviour allows users to repeat confirmation of the need to update the script and old steps are totally deleted before writing new data from the file.
Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

CARDS-52474 / I1703160402

Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with the same codes that already exist in the destination WAY4Cards system. 
Previously, all test script steps already present in the destination database were deleted, which led to links being lost in comparing script results with the standard ones. This behaviour cannot be restored.
In the first step of the import procedure, all the existing test steps in the database are marked with the new status "Obsolete". In the second step, the system checks if the step number exists in the file being imported. If not, the step in the database is kept with the "Obsolete" status, otherwise the step gets a status and inherits other parameters from the file being imported. When a Product Inspector script is run, a step with the "Obsolete" status behaves the same way as a step with the "Skip" status.
Upgrade Note:
Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with the same codes that already exist in the destination WAY4Cards system. In the first step of the import procedure, all the existing test steps in the database are marked with the new status "Obsolete" (earlier steps were deleted). In the second step, the system checks if the step exists in the file being imported. If not, the step in the database is kept with the "Obsolete" status, otherwise the step gets a status and inherits other parameters from the file being imported. When a Product Inspector script is run, steps with the "Obsolete" status are processed the same way as  steps with the "Skip" status.
If a step with the "Obsolete" status isn't necessary, it is recommended to delete it from the Product Inspector script.
Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

Product management

CARDS-50064

The ability to calculate the number of days past due has been added. Account schemes should be configured accordingly.
Upgrade Note:
The CUST_INV_SORT_CODE custom function has been changed. Now the macrotransaction date and ID will be also be used in addition to the document date and ID used earlier.
If the new method is used to calculate PD_DATE for the past due date, the CUST_INV_SORT_CODE function should be modified and macrotransaction data should be used instead of document data.
Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf] [product_management\Functional_Dates.pdf]

CARDS-53161

For Transaction Types (TRANS_TYPE table) added Trans_Code unique check:
- in "Transaction Types" and "Transactions - All" forms with the button Actions... -> Check All
- in Message Dictionary generation with the menu OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Generate Message Dictionary.
Upgrade Note:
Added an automatic check of the uniqueness of the value in a transaction type's Trans Code field when generating a transaction dictionary. Generation fails for records with a code that is not unique. Customer Support provides an additional test script for checking the configuration in advance. If records that are not unique are found, they must be corrected so that their codes are unique. Please contact Customer Support in the event of difficulties.
Updated Manuals: [core\Common_References_Books.pdf] [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

CARDS-49650

Fixed incorrect ageing of delinquent amounts when the MIN_DUE or MIN_DUE_AMOUNT tag is set in the "Template Details" field of an account template. A check is required. For more information, see Client Upgrade Notes.
Upgrade Note:
Fixed incorrect ageing of delinquent amounts when the MIN_DUE or MIN_DUE_AMOUNT tags are set in the account template. OpenWay Support provides a check script that should be run on a test environment prior to the upgrade procedure to find account templates with a possible incorrect balance. If the test script finds records with this configuration, contact OpenWay support for additional information.

CARDS-50062

INTEREST_WARNING event generation has been fixed. This event is executed automatically when a financial reversal document is processed if limit normalisation was performed between the registration of the original document's posting and its reversal. This event is only generated with the PATCH_REVERSE_INTEREST=Y global parameter.
Upgrade Note:
System behaviour on financial reversal document posting with the global parameter PATCH_REVERSE_INTEREST=Y (and DIVIDE_ITEMS=N or absent) has changed. Previously, the posting date of the reversed document was the same as the original document's posting date, even when limit normalisation took place at the time of posting the original transaction. 

Now the posting date of the reversed document will be the posting date of the original document if during the time from which the original transaction was registered to its reversal limit normalisation or due normalisation was not performed. If normalisation was performed, the posting date of the reversal document is the same as the current banking date.
Updated Manuals: [product_management\Events.pdf]

CARDS-51878

Upgrade Note:
Contract Type settings will be validated on upgrade due to data changes in the "IPS Products" handbook. Process log and messages should be checked for reported errors and warnings after Contract Types validation, and the configuration should be corrected to eliminate these errors. Contact Customer Support for instructions on correcting errors.

CARDS-50447 / I1609216346

Fixed incorrect processing of parent usage limiter activity depending on document tags.
Upgrade Note:
The procedure for checking tags in the "Spc Parm field" when processing contract usage limiters has changed. In particular, the result of checking limiters with Inverse Conditions="Yes" may change. In the new behaviour, inversion is applied to the entire set of "Conditions" group parameters and tags specified in the "Spc Parm" field.

CARDS-52141 / I1702196631

Fixed amount calculation for standing orders with the BY_BATCH tag; now zero amount orders are not recalculated based on account balance.
Upgrade Note:
Behaviour of standing orders with BY_BATCH tag has changed. Orders with "Order Type" different than "Debit Amount" and "Credit Amount" will not generate any transfers. Earlier these orders generated transfers based on account balance ignoring batch processing.
Configuration should be checked and if such orders are used, reconfiguration should be made. Either the BY_BATCH tag should be removed from the order or the Order Type should be changed to "Debit Amount" or "Credit Amount" depending on business requirements.

Reversal management

CARDS-52675

Fixed changing of the "Is Ready" contract attribute when performing manual reversal management actions using DB Manager.
Upgrade Note:
Forms to fill in reversal management actions parameters have been changed to use the tvf_visualisation table instead of the appl_info table. 
If customized forms were used for reversal management they should be changed the same way.
Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

Risk management

CARDS-52022

Fixed incorrect processing of usage limiters with the SingleSliding period type when the limiter's period was not defined for a particular contract with an application or manually. Without this additional determination, the limiter is not analyzed.
Upgrade Note:
Fixed incorrect processing of usage limiters with the SingleSliding period type when the limiter's period was not defined for a particular contract. 
It is necessary to run the following query to check if this problem ever occurred:

select count(*) from usage_templ where limit_renew_type='s' and amnd_state = 'A';

If this query returns a non-zero value, contact Customer Support for further instructions.

SOA

UFX-305 / I1604051762

UFX backward compatibility transformation has been corrected: StmtItem/DocData/BankingDt element (added in format version 2.3.64) is no longer returned when UFX version specified in request is less than 2.3.64.
Upgrade Note:
If after upgrade the StmtItem/DocData/BankingDt element has disappeared from UFX response, please change UFX request version to 2.3.64 or newer.

Tariff management

CARDS-49357

Priority for attaching tariff sub-domains has been implemented for parent domains with the tag ATTACH_SUBS. The PRIOR tag should be used in sub-domain Apply Rules.
Upgrade Note:
The priority in which tariff sub-domains will be attached for a parent domain with the "ATTACH_SUBS" tag in the Apply Rules field can be set in descending order of priority specified in the "PRIOR" tag of the sub-domain's "Apply Rules" field. In previous system behaviour, tariff sub-domains were attached in random order.

UFX-313

Tariff Import and Tariff Domains Import pipes have been changed to accept only tariffs with dates in the future by default.
Upgrade Note:
Tariff Import and Tariff Domains Import pipes have been changed to accept only tariffs with dates in the future by default. To allow loading of tariffs with dates in the past, additional configuration is needed. Contact support for details.
Updated Manuals: Tariff Management | Tariff Data Export Import UFX

CARDS-51486

Additional validation for global tariff data input has been added. When "Start Date" is not specified, the ability to set the tariff from the current banking date will be validated. When it is prohibited, the error message "Tariff Start Date Missing" will be returned.
Upgrade Note:
When importing global tariffs with an empty start date through the Tariff Import and Tariff Domains pipes, the error "Global Tariff cannot be applied from current date" will be returned. To import a global tariff with an empty start date and approve it with the current banking date, "ANY_DATE" must be set for the pipes' DATE_CHECK_MODE parameter.

Transaction management

CARDS-50570

New financial matching algorithm has been implemented.
Upgrade Note:
The algorithm for matching financial documents to authorization requests has been improved in Document Processing procedure. Although successful testing was performed by vendor on the standard WAY4 configuration, it is highly recommended for issuers, acquirers and processing centres to perform regression testing thoroughly for the following test cases on customer-specific configurations:
- non-authorized original Financial document processing 
- single authorized original Financial document processing with single Authorization / Transit (Affiliated) Authorization document
- single authorized original Financial document processing with multiple Authorization / Transit (Affiliated) Authorization documents
- multiple authorized original Financial document processing with single Authorization / Transit (Affiliated) Authorization document
- multiple authorized original Financial document processing with multiple Authorization / Transit (Affiliated) Authorization documents
- single and multiple Adjustment and Reversal Financial document processing
- secondary Financial document chain processing
- Reposted original and secondary Financial document processing
- interbank Financial document single and chain processing (Fee Collection and Funds Disbursement) 
- other regression tests for the Financial document matching process.

CARDS-50545

VISA, Affiliated Base II pipes: Removed the difference between Acquirer and Issuer Fee Collections. Standard forms for Fee Collection document creation have been modified. The new forms should be used. Interchange routing settings are required for incoming Fee Collection processing targeted to an affiliated bank. See the "Upgrade Notes on Impact Changes" section for more details.
Upgrade Note:
Fee Collection document processing for affiliated banks has been changed. Now to accept these transactions, an additional row with the parameters category = "Account", transaction type = "Fee Collection Inc", Our Member ID = "affiliated BIN" must be added to the routing setup for the affiliated bank.
Also, Fee Collection documents can be sent through an affiliated interface. If it is not necessary to send these documents, set the "CAN_BE_ONUS;" tag in the BIN Details field of this member's BIN table.
Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Processing_Interbank_Documents.pdf]

CARDS-51960

Country Table: Revised record for Madagascar. Code (3 bytes) must be "MDG", Code (2 bytes) must be "MG", Code (Numeric) must be "450", Curr Name must be "MALAGASY ARIARY", Curr Code must be "MGA", N Curr Code must be "969". No impact on transaction processing.
Upgrade Note:
Open form "Country Table" (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Country Table") and check that the record for Madagascar has the following values: Code (3 bytes) must be "MDG", Code (2 bytes) must be "MG", Code (Numeric) must be "450", Curr Name must be "MALAGASY ARIARY", Curr Code must be "MGA", N Curr Code must be "969".

CARDS-52803

A new global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT_RETAIL has been added. The new parameter is used for all transactions except those with hotel, car rental or airline MCC codes, for which the existing parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT is used. This parameter can set the maximum difference between authorization and financial presentment amounts as a percentage. If the difference is below this value, the whole blocked amount will be unblocked, otherwise only the financial amount will be unblocked.
Upgrade Note:
Starting with version 03.44, the algorithm for unblocking authorization amounts during financial document processing has been changed. A new global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT_RETAIL has been added that sets the maximum difference between authorization and financial presentment amounts as a percentage. If the difference is exceeds this value, when processing a financial document, the corresponding error message will be generated and the difference between the authorization amount and financial presentment amount will be blocked.
The parameter is used for all transactions, with the exception of transactions with several financial documents for one authorization (for example in the case of car rental, hotel reservations). The global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT is used for these exceptions.
The aforementioned behaviour impacts document processing in issuer systems. To restore previous system behaviour when the whole authorization amount was blocked, set the global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT_RETAIL a value allowing a 100% difference between authorization and financial presentment amounts.
Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

CARDS-49655 / I1511033062

Routing procedure for Fee Collection and other Interbank transactions (Funds Disbursement and Settlement) received by a processing centre or bank has been fixed and unified. Manual actions are required.
Upgrade Note:
Account to Account (Fee Collection, Funds Disbursement and Settlement) Interbank document routing and processing procedures have been unified. According to internal requirements, these operations can be processed inside the system (for example, documents for own IPS MemberIDs) or can be sent to an external system (for example, from a processing centre to an affiliated bank working on a Host to Host interface). To show an interbank document in internal entries, an IPS MemberID must be marked with the CAN_BE_ONUS; tag in the "Bin Details" field of the form OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Routing\BIN Table. Additional setup is required to record interbank documents sent to an external affiliated system. These special settings can be obtained in the scope of additional OpenWay services.
Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Interchange_Routing.pdf]

CARDS-54159 / I1610077363,I1702062338

Enhanced the "Lost Authorizations" form to show authorizations with the "Inactive" posting status that remain active due to partial financial clearing. The currently blocked amount is now shown as a separate column.
Upgrade Note:
Changed the "Lost Authorizations" form data source. The form is now based on the ACTIVE_AUTH_DOC view. If custom forms based on "Lost Authorizations" were used, consider reimplementing them using the new view that shows active authorizations with a posting status other than "Posted".
Updated Manuals: Core | Special Contract Utilities

CARDS-54454

Upgrade Note:
To support payment system requirements for VISA Fast Funds and MasterCard MoneySend, and to make payments to MIR payment system cards from Russian state institutions, WAY4 can be configured for fast transfer of funds. The use of these settings is determined by the global parameters VISA_FAST_FUNDS, MC_FAST_FUNDS, and MIR_FAST_FUNDS with the "Y" value in the form OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Additional Global Parameters. 
The mechanism for processing fast transfers has changed. 
Now when a document is imported from a payment system clearing file, as before, a document in WAY4 is generated with the transaction type Notif Prs Credit Item. Further, if the original financial document generated online from an authorization is found when the clearing document is processed by Document Processing, the Notif Prs Credit Item clearing document will be successfully processed with the response code "Successfully completed". 
If the original financial document is not found when processing the clearing document, processing of Notif Prs Credit Item will fail. The warning "Presentment not found for fast funds notification, converting to presentment" will be generated and the clearing document's transaction type will be changed to CH Payment. The next time Document Processing is run to process a clearing document, the updated parameters will be used. 
Issuers offering their cardholders this service are highly recommended to test this functionality online and in clearing. 
In addition, the following checks are required: 
1. Execute the following query and contact Customer Support if the query returns a non-empty result: 
select * from trans_type where amnd_state = 'A' and chain_type = 'X' and prev_trans_type is not null; 
2. Check Our EuroCard/MasterCard and Our Cirrus/Maestro card Service Package settings for trigger conditions in the Service for CH Payment transactions
"DOC_TAG=PTID;DOC_TAG_VALUE=C07,C52,C53,C54,C55,C56,C57,C67;", explicitly identifying express transfer transactions. 
3. Check the settings of menu items for importing VISA and MasterCard clearing information for the presence of the  USE_PAYMENT_TRANSACTION = N parameter. The USE_PAYMENT_TRANSACTION = N parameter is not compatible with  VISA Fast Funds and MasterCard MoneySend, and for payments by Russian state institutions to MIR payment system cards. 
If USE_PAYMENT_TRANSACTION = N is used, contact Customer Support.

UnionPay interface

CARDS-53270

UPI Audit Trailer Import. Supported creating settlement documents for Fee Collection/ Funds Disbursements (FCP file).
Upgrade Note:
1. If message codes S2III1ZF, S2III2ZF, S2IAI1ZF, S2IAI2ZF are configured for the UPI channel (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All"), the bank should delete them.
2. Add the new transaction type "Fee Collection and Funds Disbursement Total" (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Transactions - All").
3. Add new message codes S1--I--F, S2I-I1ZF, S2I-I2ZF, S2O-I2ZF
Contact Customer Support for details.

CARDS-53777

UnionPay Interface: Added the OUT_ST=Y; tag to the "CH Payment" and "CH Payment Rev" message types.
Upgrade Note:
Manually add the "OUT_ST=Y;" tag in the "Msg Details" field of the "Message Types - All" form (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All).

CARDS-51706 / I1611079238

Union Pay Inward Processing: Fixed Settlement S2 level amounts. Union Pay Audit Trailer Import: Added Settlement S2 level for Reimbursement Fees. Manual Action: adding message types for S2 level Reimbursement Fees.
Upgrade Note:
New message types must be added (Full/Configuration Setup/Transaction Types/Message Types - All): 
Acq Reimb Fee Detail Online (Code S2-AF---0, Trans type "Acq Reimb Fee Detail"),
Acq Reimb Fee Detail Batch (Code S2-AF---1, Trans type "Acq Reimb Fee Detail"),
Acq Reimb Fee Detail Total Dispute and manual (Code S2-AF---2, Trans type "Acq Reimb Fee Detail"),
Iss Reimb Fee Detail Online (Code S2-IF---0, Trans type "Iss Reimb Fee Detail"),
Iss Reimb Fee Detail Batch (Code S2-IF---1, Trans type "Iss Reimb Fee Detail"),
Iss Reimb Fee Detail Total Dispute and manual (Code S2-IF---2.Trans type "Iss Reimb Fee Detail").

CARDS-54735

Replaced "CUP Inward Processing.dll" with a new java pipe, "com.openwaygroup.pipe.cup.inward_processing.jar". Removed the pipe parameters CHANNEL, CHANGE_CURR_IN, and EXT_CURR_EXP. Supported loading of Intra-currency Settlement Block File.
Upgrade Note:
For WAY4Cards version from 03.46.20:
The client must check the menu item that is used to run Union Pay Outward Processing and change it according to the new corresponding standard menu item (OpenWay\UPI\UPI. Daily Procedures\UPI. Inward Processing\UPI Inward Processing). If the menu item used the parameters CHANGE_CURR_IN and/or EXT_CURR_EXP, currency/currency exponent overrides must be configured in the database according to the WAY4 "Currency Conversion" document, section "Redefining Currency for clearing documents".
For WAY4Cards version from 03.44.30:
Loading of Intra-currency Settlement Files has been supported. Contact Customer Support for the installation manual.

VISA interface

CARDS-52489

The default value of the P_CEMEA parameter in the "Visa_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" report has been changed, the new value is "Y".
Upgrade Note:
Please check the P_CEMEA parameter value that is used in "Visa_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" report generation.
In generating a report for CEMEA region, set the P_CEMEA parameter to "Y" or use the default value.
In generating a report for EUROPE region, set the P_CEMEA parameter to "N".
Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

CARDS-49507 / I1606172243

Visa BIN Table Import: fixed filling BIN_TABLE.USAGE for PLUS BIN ranges.
Upgrade Note:
Visa BIN Table Import (pipe): BIN_TABLE.USAGE is filled with the "D"  value (was null) for PLUS BIN ranges.

To avoid creating history records in BIN_TABLE it is recommended to run a script before using the modified pipe for the first time.

UPDATE BIN_TABLE t
SET t.USAGE           = 'D'
WHERE t.CARD_BRAND    = 'PLUS'
AND t.DATA_SOURCE     = 'P'
AND t.USAGE          IS NULL
AND t.AMND_STATE      = 'A'
AND t.BIN_STATUS      = 'A'
AND t.BIN_GROUP__OID IN
  (SELECT ID
  FROM BIN_GROUP
  WHERE AMND_STATE='A'
  AND Channel     = 'V'
  AND ((CARD_ORG LIKE 'VRW%E')
  OR (CARD_ORG LIKE 'VCW%E')
  OR (CARD_ORG = 'EP')
  OR (CARD_ORG LIKE 'P%')))

CARDS-50317 / I1609202368

VISA Affiliated Outward: Fixed "VISA_TA is not found" error for H2H channels with the "Is On Us'" = "N" property. The global parameter AFF_CH_LIST must be filled with the codes of these channels.
Upgrade Note:
Added the additional global parameter AFF_CH_LIST. If VISA transactions are processed through H2H channels with IsOnUs="N", these channels must be listed in this new parameter. Format for AFF_CH_LIST is <channel1><channel2>, for example AFF_CH_LIST = qwe, where "q", "w", "e" are the required channels.

CARDS-52171 / I1702213736:B: Visa Croatia: wrong region defined between EEA card & Croatia merchant (ICFEE-164)

VISA Country Table. Now the direct area for Croatia is VISA: European Economic Area Sub-region. Manual Action! No impact on transaction processing.
Upgrade Note:
Open the "Country Table" form (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Country Table") and set Croatia Direct Area "VISA: European Economic Area Sub-region" instead of "VISA: Visa Europe (3)".

CARDS-55432 / I1710136911

Fixed temporary behaviour of the VISA SMS Outward pipe, when DE65 (SRN) was inherited for 2Prs from 1Prs (this could be necessary for initial NSPK connection). Now DE65 (SRN) for 2Prs is inherited from Chbk by default. For legacy behaviour, the new SRN_FROM_PRS = Y pipe parameter must be set.
Upgrade Note:
Temporary behaviour of the VISA SMS Outward pipe, when DE65 (SRN) was inherited for 2Prs from 1Prs, has been fixed (this could be necessary for initial NSPK connection). Now DE65 (SRN) is inherited for 2Prs from Chbk by default. For legacy behaviour, the new SRN_FROM_PRS = Y pipe parameter must be set.

CARDS-50883

VISA BIN Table Import: A new pipe parameter, COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID=<product id1>,<product id2>,... has been added for splitting BIN ranges into consumer/commercial categories.
Upgrade Note:
VISA BIN Table Import: A new pipe parameter, COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID=<product id1>,<product id2>,... has been added. BIN ranges are split into consumer/commercial categories: if a BIN range product is in the COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID list, it is marked as commercial (CARD_PTI=2 tag in bin_table.bin_details), otherwise it is marked as consumer (CARD_PTI=1 tag in bin_table.bin_details). Default parameter value is "G,G1,G3,G4,G5,K,K1,S,S1,S2,S3,S4,S5,S6,". No manual action is required.

CARDS-51662

[VISA REL] Apr17-341 2.2 : Added new Commercial Product ID 'X' to the default value of the 'COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID' pipe parameter.
Upgrade Note:
[VISA REL] Apr17-341 2.2 : The default value of the 'COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID' pipe (VISA BIN Table Import) parameter has been extended. BIN range with the new commercial product ID 'X' will be marked as a commercial category. If a custom value of the 'COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID' pipe parameter is used, it is necessary to add the new commercial product ID (code 'X') to the value.

CARDS-52234

VISA Fee Prediction: Added Fee Program Areas for Visa Gold purchase and credit voucher transactions for Japan issuers.
Upgrade Note:
Visa will implement changes to interregional and AP regional fee structures that apply to Visa Gold transactions issued from Japan. Acquirers must support the changes to the fee programs that will be assessed on Visa Gold purchase and credit voucher transactions for Japan issuers. According to this release requirement acquirers must configure Fee Program Areas in the Standard Handbook manually: Handbook Type is FEE_PREDICTION__FEE_PROGRAM_AREA, for Filter1 values "1","B","C","E","F" Name must be "Interregional" and Code must be "JPN". Furthermore, acquirers in the AP region must add an extra record in the Standard Handbook: Handbook Type is FEE_PREDICTION__FEE_PROGRAM_AREA, for Filter1 value "A" Name must be "Intra-AP" and Code must be "JPN".
Updated Manuals: [visa_interface\20XX_XX_VISA_Requirements.pdf.pdf]

CARDS-54107

VISA Fee Collection/Funds Transfer Reason Codes. Changed description for reason code 0150 to "Recovered card handling fees or rewards and ATM BI acquiring direct fee returns". Also revised all Fee Collection/Funds Transfer Reason Codes.
Upgrade Note:
Changed name for VISA reason code V150 to "Recovered card handling fees or rewards and ATM BI acquiring direct fee returns" (menu item OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Interbank Reason Codes). Contact Customer Support for the Copy Configuration file with the full list of revised VISA Fee Collection/Funds Transfer Reason Codes.
Updated Manuals: [visa_interface\20XX_XX_VISA_Requirements.pdf.pdf]

CARDS-56502 / I1710317086

Changed the VISA_FAST_FUNDS additional global parameter default value from the existing value "Y" to a new value "A". If VISA_FAST_FUNDS is set to "A", all original credit transactions will be converted into notifications regardless of the Fast Funds Indicator value. For all other transactions, the processing logic remains unchanged. The changes affect the VISA Base II Inward Processing and Affiliated Base II Inward Processing pipes. Please see CUN for required additional actions.
Upgrade Note:
A new default value ("A") has been added for the existing global parameter VISA_FAST_FUNDS. If VISA_FAST_FUNDS="A", all Original Credit Transactions being loaded will be converted to NotifItem, regardless of the Fast Funds Indicator value. For other documents, processing logic remains the same as VISA_FAST_FUNDS="Y". To restore the pipe's previous behaviour, the VISA_FAST_FUNDS parameter value must be set to "Y". It's recommended to have VISA_FAST_FUNDS="A" if Fast Funds authoirization request messages are processed as Financial Credit.

WAY4 manager

WM-3093

New option SHOW_ERROR_STACK_TRACE has been supported in OW_WORK\DB.ini. It allows error stack traces to be shown/hidden from Clerk users.
Upgrade Note:
SHOW_ERROR_STACK_TRACE can have the 'yes' or 'no' value. The default value is 'no'. The option disables error stack trace visibility for Clerks: 
- error traces will be visible to Clerks only if the option is precisely set to 'yes' 
- traces are available to Admin roles regardless of the key. 
Setting SHOW_ERROR_STACK_TRACE to 'yes' means switching to the old system behaviour: traces are available for a user of any role.

WM-2944

Upgrade Note:
Rounding is improved for displaying high precision values in forms.

Web services

CARDS-51680

New menu branches have been added: OpenWay\Web Services and OpenWay\Way4Web. The "WS Users & Grants" menu branch has been moved from OpenWay\System\DB Administrator Utilities to these new menu branches; the linked menu OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\WS Users & Grants has been removed. For more details, see the section "Client Upgrade Notes on Impact changes".
Upgrade Note:
The "WS Users & Grants" menu branch has been moved from OpenWay\System\DB Administrator Utilities to the new menu groups OpenWay\Web Services and OpenWay\Way4Web. The link OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\WS Users & Grants has been removed. If a custom menu item with a link to the items that have been moved or deleted is used, it must be replaced with a new one. If you have a Web Services or WAY4Web license and the OpenWay\Web Services or OpenWay\Way4Web menu do not appear after upgrade, please contact OpenWay support.

e-Commerce acquiring

CARDS-54171

Implemented the license for AFT transactions with single debit document and C07,C52,AA, and PP transaction application codes.
Upgrade Note:
For the system to work correctly when transferring funds within AFT transactions (i.e. debiting card with application codes: C07, C52, PP, AA), the appropriate license options must be configured. Please contact Customer Support.

Upgrade Notes on Impact Changes Grouped by Releases

Important! These changes may affect your data, please read carefully!

Cards

  • 03.44.31.08
    • [CARDS-56616]
      • Supported database currencies overrides for the MasterCard CDF interface.
      Upgrade Note:
      If the currency code or currency exponent in the CURRENCY table differs from MasterCard CDF format, currency override must be set up. Refer to the "Redefining Currency Parameters" chapter of the "Currency Conversion" manual for more information.
    • [CARDS-56671]
      • Added the ability to skip export of unchanged corporations for the MasterCard CDF Export interface.
      Upgrade Note:
      To skip export of the "CorporateEntity" aggregate without any embedded records, the new EXPORT_EMPTY_CORPORATION=N pipe parameter must be set. The new parameter works only when the ORG_REC_CHOICE=U pipe parameter is also set.
    • [CARDS-56735]
      • Added the ability to run several NSPK Export processes in parallel.
      Upgrade Note:
      Added the ability to use a sequence generated by DB file numbering, which allows several NSPK Export processes to be run simultaneously.
    • [CARDS-54717]
      • Changed the result of a value returned by the %TRANS_REASON_DETAILS% variable. Now it returns the whole text from the doc.reason_details field instead of text from doc.add_info.
      Upgrade Note:
      In case the previous %TRANS_REASON_DETAILS% variable behaviour should be kept, it is recommended to find a setup that uses the variable and change %TRANS_REASON_DETAILS% to %DOC_TAGS% and %TRANS_REASON_DETAILS:tag% to %DOC_TAGS:tag%.

The SQL queries from the check script CHECK_v1_CARDS-54717_SMS_template_reason_details.sql can be used to find message templates. The script will be provided by OpenWay.
      Updated Manuals: [notifications\transaction_notifications\Transaction_Notifications.pdf]
  • 03.44.31.07
    • [I1801165374]/[CARDS-56538]
      • Corrected behaviour for DCI Clearing Import and DCI Inward Processing. Now ATM Service Fee transactions are processed as special Misc transactions. Previously they were processed as general ATM transactions.
      Upgrade Note:
      Clients who use the DCI Issuing Interface must manually add: 
1. New Trans Type (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Transactions - All) with the following parameters:
Service Class = "Misc"
Source = ""
Target = "Card"
Name = "ATM Service Fee"
DR\CR = "Debit"
Chain Type = "Original"
Is Authorized = "Never"
Is Required = "Yes"
Category = "Individual"
RBS Code = "A1F"
RBS Rev Code = "a1f"
Dispute Class = "ATM Dispute"
Trans Type IDT = "0719F"

2. New SubType for "ATM Service Fee" Trans Type (using the [SubTypes] button in OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Transactions - All):
Source Cat = ""
Target Cat = "Card"
Source Type = ""
Target Type = "Our DCI Cards"
Source Acc Type = "Inc Suspense"
Target Acc Type = "CH Current/Credits" or another appropriate account type which is used as current cardholder account (for example, Cl Deposit)

3. New Message Code for "ATM Service Fee" Trans Type (using the [Msg Types] button in OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Transactions - All):
Channel = "Diners Club"
Name = "ATM Service Fee"
Code = "DfP--01-"
Category = "Advice"
Is Authorization = "Fin"
Trans Type = "ATM Service Fee"

4. Add corresponding Misc- services for Transaction Type "ATM Service Fee" to all DCI card service packages.
  • 03.44.31.05
    • [I1710317086]/[CARDS-56502]
      • Changed the VISA_FAST_FUNDS additional global parameter default value from the existing value "Y" to a new value "A". If VISA_FAST_FUNDS is set to "A", all original credit transactions will be converted into notifications regardless of the Fast Funds Indicator value. For all other transactions, the processing logic remains unchanged. The changes affect the VISA Base II Inward Processing and Affiliated Base II Inward Processing pipes. Please see CUN for required additional actions.
      Upgrade Note:
      A new default value ("A") has been added for the existing global parameter VISA_FAST_FUNDS. If VISA_FAST_FUNDS="A", all Original Credit Transactions being loaded will be converted to NotifItem, regardless of the Fast Funds Indicator value. For other documents, processing logic remains the same as VISA_FAST_FUNDS="Y". To restore the pipe's previous behaviour, the VISA_FAST_FUNDS parameter value must be set to "Y". It's recommended to have VISA_FAST_FUNDS="A" if Fast Funds authoirization request messages are processed as Financial Credit.
  • 03.44.31.01
    • [CARDS-55790]
      • Added device name (WSP_DEVNAME), device ID (WSP_DEVID) and last four digits of mobile phone number (WSP_L4DIG) saving in the database as token parameters on MDES / VTS enrolment.
      Upgrade Note:
      3 parameters must be created for existing MDES/VDEP/MIR(tokenization)"Identification Schemes" (OpenWay\Authentication Module\Identification Types -> [Parms]:

1) 
Name = Mobile Number Last 4 digits
Code = WSP_L4DIG
Is Global = No
Is Mandatory = No
Parm Type = String

2) 
Name = Device ID
Code = WSP_DEVID
Is Global = No
Is Mandatory = No
Parm Type = String

3) 
Name = Device Name
Code = WSP_DEVNAME
Is Global = No
Is Mandatory = No
Parm Type = String
	
and changes to the scheme must be approved by clicking on the [Approve] button.
    • [CARDS-55547]
      • DA R2. Fixed function to check Fraud Counter. Now this is performed only for Issuing contracts.
      Upgrade Note:
      Fixed function to check Fraud Counter. Now it's performed only for Issuing contracts.
    • [CARDS-55727]
      • Deleted some obsolete objects to prevent undesirable use of unsupported functionality. This has been done for future compatibility with the new Contract Parameter approach.
      Upgrade Note:
      For future compatibility with the new approach for the contract parameter handbook, some obsolete objects have been deleted to prevent their undesirable use:
Deleted Menu Items:
- OpenWay\WAY4 Data Warehouse Interface\Configuration Setup\Contract Parameters
- OpenWay\WAY4 Data Warehouse Interface\Runtime\Contract Parm Value Update

Deleted Forms:
- Contract Parameter - Export
- Contract Parameter - Export - Value

Deleted pl/sql procedures and functions:
- scdp.RUN_RENEW_TRF_LINK
- trf_export.RENEW_TARIFF_LINK
- trf_export.VALIDATE_CONTR_PARM

Deleted view:
- CONTR_PARM_VALUE

The Product Inspector option LOG_MODE=CONTR_PARM_EXPORT is no longer supported.

According to CMS Statistics, no one used these objects.
      Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]
    • [I1710242617]/[CARDS-55320]
      • Corrected behaviour of the global parameter TRIVIAL_GL_TRANSFER. For the default value of the additional global parameter TRIVIAL_GL_TRANSFER=N, GL_TRACE/GL_TRANSFER records are not created now when debit and credit accounts are equal. Accounts are equal when their account numbers, gl_numbers and account templates match. Previously only account numbers and account templates were compared.
      Upgrade Note:
      Corrected behaviour of the global parameter TRIVIAL_GL_TRANSFER. For the default value of the additional global parameter TRIVIAL_GL_TRANSFER=N, GL_TRACE/GL_TRANSFER records are not created now when debit and credit accounts are equal. Accounts are equal when their account numbers, gl_numbers and account templates match. Previously only account numbers and account templates were compared.
      Updated Manuals: [accounting\WAY4_Accounting.pdf] [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]
    • [I1710259099]/[CARDS-55431]
      • Fixed issue. Now by default the authorisation process does not apply deferred tasks and the Secondary->Primary Synchronisation process does not create deferred tasks. If you use High Availability solutions, set HA.DEFERRED_DOC_APPLY=Y global parameter to restore the old behaviour and make sure that Object Task Scheduler is always running.
      Upgrade Note:
      Now by default the authorisation process does not apply deferred tasks and the Secondary->Primary Synchronisation process does not create deferred tasks. If you use High Availability solutions, set HA.DEFERRED_DOC_APPLY=Y global parameter to restore the old behaviour and make sure that Object Task Scheduler is always running.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

  • 03.44.30.83
    • [CARDS-55628]
      • Fixed the customized fields processing for MasterCard CDF Export process. If a customized field in the ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters had [null] value, non-customized value was used for export. Now standard value is used only when there is no customized field in the ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters. Otherwise, a customized value is used even if it has [null] value.
      Upgrade Note:
      The customized fields processing has been fixed for MasterCard CDF Export process. If a customized field in the ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters had [null] value, non-customized value was used for export. Now standard value is used only when there is no customized field in the ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters. Otherwise, a customized value is used even if it has [null] value. Please review ADD_FIELDS_XX pipe parameters to check if [null] value ("<CustomField>=;") is used to export the non-customized fields.

      Fixed function to check Fraud Counter. Now it's performed only for Issuing contracts.
  • 03.44.30.80
    • [CARDS-54735]
      • Replaced "CUP Inward Processing.dll" with a new java pipe, "com.openwaygroup.pipe.cup.inward_processing.jar". Removed the pipe parameters CHANNEL, CHANGE_CURR_IN, and EXT_CURR_EXP. Supported loading of Intra-currency Settlement Block File.
      Upgrade Note:
      For WAY4Cards version from 03.46.20:
The client must check the menu item that is used to run Union Pay Outward Processing and change it according to the new corresponding standard menu item (OpenWay\UPI\UPI. Daily Procedures\UPI. Inward Processing\UPI Inward Processing). If the menu item used the parameters CHANGE_CURR_IN and/or EXT_CURR_EXP, currency/currency exponent overrides must be configured in the database according to the WAY4 "Currency Conversion" document, section "Redefining Currency for clearing documents".
For WAY4Cards version from 03.44.30:
Loading of Intra-currency Settlement Files has been supported. Contact Customer Support for the installation manual.
    • [DBK-3021]
      • Migrated DB Manager to a new PowerBuilder version.
      Upgrade Note:
      1) File format of DB Manager forms (forms\*.srd) has changed. Forms synchronized or saved in WAY4 Cards version 03.46.30.00 (or later) can't be used in previous WAY4 Cards versions. 
2) DDDW libraries (dbm\dddw\*.pbl) format has changed. Custom DDDW libraries should be migrated to the new version of PowerBuilder during upgrade to WAY4Cards version 03.46.30.00 (or later). Please contact your Upgrade Manager for details.

If you use High Availability solutions, set HA.DEFERRED_DOC_APPLY=Y global parameter to restore the old behaviour and make sure that Object Task Scheduler is always running.

    • [I1710136911]/[CARDS-55432]
      • Fixed temporary behaviour of the VISA SMS Outward pipe, when DE65 (SRN) was inherited for 2Prs from 1Prs (this could be necessary for initial NSPK connection). Now DE65 (SRN) for 2Prs is inherited from Chbk by default. For legacy behaviour, the new SRN_FROM_PRS = Y pipe parameter must be set.
      Upgrade Note:
      Temporary behaviour of the VISA SMS Outward pipe, when DE65 (SRN) was inherited for 2Prs from 1Prs, has been fixed (this could be necessary for initial NSPK connection). Now DE65 (SRN) is inherited for 2Prs from Chbk by default. For legacy behaviour, the new SRN_FROM_PRS = Y pipe parameter must be set.

For the default value of the additional global parameter TRIVIAL_GL_TRANSFER=N, GL_TRACE/GL_TRANSFER records are not created now when debit and credit accounts are equal. Accounts are equal when their account numbers, gl_numbers and account templates match. Previously only account numbers and account templates were compared.

Accounts are equal when their account numbers, gl_numbers and account templates match. Previously only account numbers and account templates were compared.

  • 03.44.30.71
    • [CARDS-54891]
      • Changed VISA OCT reversal processing. OCT reversals with Target Channel "VISA SMS" are rejected with Return Code "12" and Posting Status "Under Workflow". OCT reversals with Target Channel "VISA" are not sent in the online phase and should be sent in clearing.
      Upgrade Note:
      In unforeseen situations (sending online reversals of OCT transactions to the VISA channel) a document is assigned the Under Workflow status - for manual analysis.
After reconciliation, documents with this status must be analysed and a decision taken on whether to post or reverse a document.
      Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]
  • 03.44.30.69
    • [WM-3093]
      • New option SHOW_ERROR_STACK_TRACE has been supported in OW_WORK\DB.ini. It allows error stack traces to be shown/hidden from Clerk users.
      Upgrade Note:
      SHOW_ERROR_STACK_TRACE can have the 'yes' or 'no' value. The default value is 'no'. The option disables error stack trace visibility for Clerks: 
- error traces will be visible to Clerks only if the option is precisely set to 'yes' 
- traces are available to Admin roles regardless of the key. 
Setting SHOW_ERROR_STACK_TRACE to 'yes' means switching to the old system behaviour: traces are available for a user of any role.
  • 03.44.30.68
    • [CARDS-54454]
      • Upgrade Note:
      To support payment system requirements for VISA Fast Funds and MasterCard MoneySend, and to make payments to MIR payment system cards from Russian state institutions, WAY4 can be configured for fast transfer of funds. The use of these settings is determined by the global parameters VISA_FAST_FUNDS, MC_FAST_FUNDS, and MIR_FAST_FUNDS with the "Y" value in the form OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Additional Global Parameters. 
The mechanism for processing fast transfers has changed. 
Now when a document is imported from a payment system clearing file, as before, a document in WAY4 is generated with the transaction type Notif Prs Credit Item. Further, if the original financial document generated online from an authorization is found when the clearing document is processed by Document Processing, the Notif Prs Credit Item clearing document will be successfully processed with the response code "Successfully completed". 
If the original financial document is not found when processing the clearing document, processing of Notif Prs Credit Item will fail. The warning "Presentment not found for fast funds notification, converting to presentment" will be generated and the clearing document's transaction type will be changed to CH Payment. The next time Document Processing is run to process a clearing document, the updated parameters will be used. 
Issuers offering their cardholders this service are highly recommended to test this functionality online and in clearing. 
In addition, the following checks are required: 
1. Execute the following query and contact Customer Support if the query returns a non-empty result: 
select * from trans_type where amnd_state = 'A' and chain_type = 'X' and prev_trans_type is not null; 
2. Check Our EuroCard/MasterCard and Our Cirrus/Maestro card Service Package settings for trigger conditions in the Service for CH Payment transactions
"DOC_TAG=PTID;DOC_TAG_VALUE=C07,C52,C53,C54,C55,C56,C57,C67;", explicitly identifying express transfer transactions. 
3. Check the settings of menu items for importing VISA and MasterCard clearing information for the presence of the  USE_PAYMENT_TRANSACTION = N parameter. The USE_PAYMENT_TRANSACTION = N parameter is not compatible with  VISA Fast Funds and MasterCard MoneySend, and for payments by Russian state institutions to MIR payment system cards. 
If USE_PAYMENT_TRANSACTION = N is used, contact Customer Support.

      To allow the system to process B2B (FD) money transfer transactions (application codes: FD,GD,MD,OG,C02,C03,C04,C05,C06,C09,C55,C56,C57), the appropriate license option must be configured. Please contact Customer Support.
    • [CARDS-54341]
      • Changed how the "RBS Number" and "MemberID" fields are filled in Advanced Application R2 for contract modification. Field values are now inherited from the parent contract if they are empty.
      Upgrade Note:
      Advanced Application R2 for contract modification now inherits RBS Number and MemberID from the parent contract if they are empty. Previously, this was only the case for new subcontracts.
    • [I1610077363,I1702062338]/[CARDS-54159]
      • Enhanced the "Lost Authorizations" form to show authorizations with the "Inactive" posting status that remain active due to partial financial clearing. The currently blocked amount is now shown as a separate column.
      Upgrade Note:
      Changed the "Lost Authorizations" form data source. The form is now based on the ACTIVE_AUTH_DOC view. If custom forms based on "Lost Authorizations" were used, consider reimplementing them using the new view that shows active authorizations with a posting status other than "Posted".

  • 03.44.30.46
    • [CARDS-53839]
      • The Client Template Details form in the Customer Profile\Operations menu shows sensitive attributes as masked and non-editable. To comply with PA-DSS requirements, a service attribute which can contain PAN should inherit its value from a sensitive dynamic handbook parameter or be directly marked as sensitive by the SENSITIVE=Y tag in the Additional Data field.
      Upgrade Note:
      To comply with PA-DSS requirements, all service attributes which can contain PAN should inherit their values from a sensitive dynamic handbook parameter or be directly marked as sensitive by the SENSITIVE=Y tag in the Additional Data field.
The SENSITIVE=Y tag should be registered in Full\DB Administrator Utilities\System Utilities\Tagged Data Objects for the TD_MSG_ATTR.ADD_DATA object.
      Updated Manuals: [customer_profile\Configuring_WAY4_Customer_Profile.pdf]
  • 03.44.30.45
    • [CARDS-53809]
      • Use of the TOTAL_BAL_TYPE tag for prepaid cards has been changed. See Client Upgrade Notes.
      Upgrade Note:
      The algorithm for using the TOTAL_BAL_TYPE tag in configuration of services, tariffs, etc. has changed.

If the TOTAL_BAL_TYPE tag with the value TOTAL_BAL_TYPE=AVAILABLE; is used for configuration of prepaid cards, the additional tag TOTAL_BAL_TYPE_SIGN=+; must be added. Otherwise, the system calculates the amount available for top-up incorrectly when a card has a negative AVAILABLE balance. A negative balance may be generated for a card due to fees charged for card issuing, etc.

Use of the TOTAL_BAL_TYPE tag is only recommended in configuration of prepaid cards and only in combination with the AVAILABLE balance. If this tag is used with another balance type, or in the configuration of other Product types (not prepaid cards), contact Customer Support.

Customer Support provides separate preliminary scripts that should be run in a copy of the production system before starting upgrade to the new version. 
If tpreliminary scripts find the aforementioned settings in the system, contact Customer Support for additional recommendations.
      Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]
    • [CARDS-53336]
      • JCB: Added message codes ("RjP-----","RJP-----","RmP-----","RmR-----") for reject processing.
      Upgrade Note:
      If the new JCB ISO format is used, the following Message Types must be added (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All):
1.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected Item Fin
Code=RmP-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected Item Fin
2.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected Fixing
Code=RmR-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected Fixing
Msg Details=OUT_ST=C;
3.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected Item
Code=RjP-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected Item
4.
Channel=JCB
Name=Rejected File
Code=RJP-----
Category=Advice
Is Authorization=Fin
Trans Type=Rejected File

      "South Sudan" (code SSD) must be manually included in "MC: Middle East, Africa (E)" area.

    • [CARDS-53270]
      • UPI Audit Trailer Import. Supported creating settlement documents for Fee Collection/ Funds Disbursements (FCP file).

      1. If message codes S2III1ZF, S2III2ZF, S2IAI1ZF, S2IAI2ZF are configured for the UPI channel (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Message Types - All"), the bank should delete them.

  • 03.44.30.38
    • [CARDS-53161]
      • For Transaction Types (TRANS_TYPE table) added Trans_Code unique check:
- in "Transaction Types" and "Transactions - All" forms with the button Actions... -> Check All
- in Message Dictionary generation with the menu OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Generate Message Dictionary.
      Upgrade Note:
      Added an automatic check of the uniqueness of the value in a transaction type's Trans Code field when generating a transaction dictionary. Generation fails for records with a code that is not unique. Customer Support provides an additional test script for checking the configuration in advance. If records that are not unique are found, they must be corrected so that their codes are unique. Please contact Customer Support in the event of difficulties.

In this case, explicit configuration of functional date shifts will be needed - see the manual <OW_HOME>\manuals\english\Product_management\Functional_Dates.pdf

      Upgrade Note:
      The algorithm for calculating the date of generating/charging an annual miscellaneous Service fee has changed. If the following configuration is used, it is strongly recommended to perform thorough functional testing on the new WAY4 Cards version: 
- recurring fee type ("Full/Configuration Setup/Transaction Types/Fee Types") has the parameter value Charge Event="Yearly".

  • 03.44.30.27
    • [CARDS-52803]
      • A new global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT_RETAIL has been added. The new parameter is used for all transactions except those with hotel, car rental or airline MCC codes, for which the existing parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT is used. This parameter can set the maximum difference between authorization and financial presentment amounts as a percentage. If the difference is below this value, the whole blocked amount will be unblocked, otherwise only the financial amount will be unblocked.
      Upgrade Note:
      Starting with version 03.44, the algorithm for unblocking authorization amounts during financial document processing has been changed. A new global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT_RETAIL has been added that sets the maximum difference between authorization and financial presentment amounts as a percentage. If the difference is exceeds this value, when processing a financial document, the corresponding error message will be generated and the difference between the authorization amount and financial presentment amount will be blocked.
The parameter is used for all transactions, with the exception of transactions with several financial documents for one authorization (for example in the case of car rental, hotel reservations). The global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT is used for these exceptions.
The aforementioned behaviour impacts document processing in issuer systems. To restore previous system behaviour when the whole authorization amount was blocked, set the global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT_RETAIL a value allowing a 100% difference between authorization and financial presentment amounts.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]
  • 03.44.30.24
    • [CARDS-52675]
      • Fixed changing of the "Is Ready" contract attribute when performing manual reversal management actions using DB Manager.
      Upgrade Note:
      Forms to fill in reversal management actions parameters have been changed to use the tvf_visualisation table instead of the appl_info table. 
If customized forms were used for reversal management they should be changed the same way.
      Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]
    • [CARDS-52686]
      • Fixed changing of the "Is Ready" contract attribute when performing manual instalment actions using DB Manager.
      Upgrade Note:
      Forms to fill in instalment actions parameters have been changed to use the local_constants table instead of the appl_info table. 
If customized forms were used for instalment management they should be changed the same way.
      Updated Manuals: [instalment_management\WAY4_Instalments.pdf]
  • 03.44.30.17
    • [CARDS-52489]
      • The default value of the P_CEMEA parameter in the "Visa_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" report has been changed, the new value is "Y".
      Upgrade Note:
      Please check the P_CEMEA parameter value that is used in "Visa_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" report generation.
In generating a report for CEMEA region, set the P_CEMEA parameter to "Y" or use the default value.
In generating a report for EUROPE region, set the P_CEMEA parameter to "N".
      Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]
    • [I1703160402]/[CARDS-52474]
      • Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with the same codes that already exist in the destination WAY4Cards system. 
Previously, all test script steps already present in the destination database were deleted, which led to links being lost in comparing script results with the standard ones. This behaviour cannot be restored.
In the first step of the import procedure, all the existing test steps in the database are marked with the new status "Obsolete". In the second step, the system checks if the step number exists in the file being imported. If not, the step in the database is kept with the "Obsolete" status, otherwise the step gets a status and inherits other parameters from the file being imported. When a Product Inspector script is run, a step with the "Obsolete" status behaves the same way as a step with the "Skip" status.
      Upgrade Note:
      Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with the same codes that already exist in the destination WAY4Cards system. In the first step of the import procedure, all the existing test steps in the database are marked with the new status "Obsolete" (earlier steps were deleted). In the second step, the system checks if the step exists in the file being imported. If not, the step in the database is kept with the "Obsolete" status, otherwise the step gets a status and inherits other parameters from the file being imported. When a Product Inspector script is run, steps with the "Obsolete" status are processed the same way as  steps with the "Skip" status.
If a step with the "Obsolete" status isn't necessary, it is recommended to delete it from the Product Inspector script.
      Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]
    • [CARDS-52360]
      • MasterCard MCBS Import: Supported new format according to Global Operations Bulletin No. 2 - 1 February 2017.
      Upgrade Note:
      To load old format files, set the pipe parameter LINE_LENGTH=500.

MasterCard MCBS Import: Supported new format according to Global Operations Bulletin No. 2 - 1 February 2017.
  • 03.44.30.11
    • [CARDS-51495]
      • Reports XLS_CB_f250_1.rdf, XLS_CB_f250_2.rdf, XLS_CB_f250_3.rdf:
- Added count of contactless cards, transactions and devices.
- Supported consolidated report for all financial organization branches.
- Supported counting of cards with only 2 groups: debit/credit.
