      Change in the logic of Reports XLS_CB_f250_1.rdf, XLS_CB_f250_2.rdf, XLS_CB_f250_3.rdf: the "SHOW_IN_250" tag will be automatically deleted from the "Add Info" field of the "DWD_CARD_CATEGORY" classifier in the "DWH_CONF" configuration group (OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Configuration Groups).
      Updated Manuals: [rf_reporting\250\Form_250.pdf]
  • 03.44.30.10
    • [I1612121917]/[CARDS-51820]
      • "No Check" Auth scenario has been removed from forms as obsolete. The additional global parameter ENABLE_NO_CHECK is no longer supported.
      Upgrade Note:
      The additional global parameter ENABLE_NO_CHECK is no longer supported. It is not possible to create new products/contract with Auth scenario=No Check (existing contracts with Auth Scenario=No Check will be processed as See Main).
      Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf]
  • 03.44.30.09
    • [CARDS-52234]
      • VISA Fee Prediction: Added Fee Program Areas for Visa Gold purchase and credit voucher transactions for Japan issuers.
      Upgrade Note:
      Visa will implement changes to interregional and AP regional fee structures that apply to Visa Gold transactions issued from Japan. Acquirers must support the changes to the fee programs that will be assessed on Visa Gold purchase and credit voucher transactions for Japan issuers. According to this release requirement acquirers must configure Fee Program Areas in the Standard Handbook manually: Handbook Type is FEE_PREDICTION__FEE_PROGRAM_AREA, for Filter1 values "1","B","C","E","F" Name must be "Interregional" and Code must be "JPN". Furthermore, acquirers in the AP region must add an extra record in the Standard Handbook: Handbook Type is FEE_PREDICTION__FEE_PROGRAM_AREA, for Filter1 value "A" Name must be "Intra-AP" and Code must be "JPN".
      Updated Manuals: [visa_interface\20XX_XX_VISA_Requirements.pdf.pdf]
  • 03.44.30.07
    • [CARDS-51680]
      • New menu branches have been added: OpenWay\Web Services and OpenWay\Way4Web. The "WS Users & Grants" menu branch has been moved from OpenWay\System\DB Administrator Utilities to these new menu branches; the linked menu OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\WS Users & Grants has been removed. For more details, see the section "Client Upgrade Notes on Impact changes".
      Upgrade Note:
      The "WS Users & Grants" menu branch has been moved from OpenWay\System\DB Administrator Utilities to the new menu groups OpenWay\Web Services and OpenWay\Way4Web. The link OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\WS Users & Grants has been removed. If a custom menu item with a link to the items that have been moved or deleted is used, it must be replaced with a new one. If you have a Web Services or WAY4Web license and the OpenWay\Web Services or OpenWay\Way4Web menu do not appear after upgrade, please contact OpenWay support.
    • [CARDS-52022]
      • Fixed incorrect processing of usage limiters with the SingleSliding period type when the limiter's period was not defined for a particular contract with an application or manually. Without this additional determination, the limiter is not analyzed.
      Upgrade Note:
      Fixed incorrect processing of usage limiters with the SingleSliding period type when the limiter's period was not defined for a particular contract. 
It is necessary to run the following query to check if this problem ever occurred:

select count(*) from usage_templ where limit_renew_type='s' and amnd_state = 'A';

If this query returns a non-zero value, contact Customer Support for further instructions.
    • [I1702196631]/[CARDS-52141]
      • Fixed amount calculation for standing orders with the BY_BATCH tag; now zero amount orders are not recalculated based on account balance.
      Upgrade Note:
      Behaviour of standing orders with BY_BATCH tag has changed. Orders with "Order Type" different than "Debit Amount" and "Credit Amount" will not generate any transfers. Earlier these orders generated transfers based on account balance ignoring batch processing.
Configuration should be checked and if such orders are used, reconfiguration should be made. Either the BY_BATCH tag should be removed from the order or the Order Type should be changed to "Debit Amount" or "Credit Amount" depending on business requirements.
    • [I1702213736:B: Visa Croatia: wrong region defined between EEA card & Croatia merchant (ICFEE-164)]/[CARDS-52171]
      • VISA Country Table. Now the direct area for Croatia is VISA: European Economic Area Sub-region. Manual Action! No impact on transaction processing.
      Upgrade Note:
      Open the "Country Table" form (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Country Table") and set Croatia Direct Area "VISA: European Economic Area Sub-region" instead of "VISA: Visa Europe (3)".
  • 03.44.30.05
    • [I1611079238]/[CARDS-51706]
      • Union Pay Inward Processing: Fixed Settlement S2 level amounts. Union Pay Audit Trailer Import: Added Settlement S2 level for Reimbursement Fees. Manual Action: adding message types for S2 level Reimbursement Fees.
      Upgrade Note:
      New message types must be added (Full/Configuration Setup/Transaction Types/Message Types - All): 
Acq Reimb Fee Detail Online (Code S2-AF---0, Trans type "Acq Reimb Fee Detail"),
Acq Reimb Fee Detail Batch (Code S2-AF---1, Trans type "Acq Reimb Fee Detail"),
Acq Reimb Fee Detail Total Dispute and manual (Code S2-AF---2, Trans type "Acq Reimb Fee Detail"),
Iss Reimb Fee Detail Online (Code S2-IF---0, Trans type "Iss Reimb Fee Detail"),
Iss Reimb Fee Detail Batch (Code S2-IF---1, Trans type "Iss Reimb Fee Detail"),
Iss Reimb Fee Detail Total Dispute and manual (Code S2-IF---2.Trans type "Iss Reimb Fee Detail").
  • 03.44.30.04
    • [CARDS-51960]
      • Country Table: Revised record for Madagascar. Code (3 bytes) must be "MDG", Code (2 bytes) must be "MG", Code (Numeric) must be "450", Curr Name must be "MALAGASY ARIARY", Curr Code must be "MGA", N Curr Code must be "969". No impact on transaction processing.
      Upgrade Note:
      Open form "Country Table" (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Country Table") and check that the record for Madagascar has the following values: Code (3 bytes) must be "MDG", Code (2 bytes) must be "MG", Code (Numeric) must be "450", Curr Name must be "MALAGASY ARIARY", Curr Code must be "MGA", N Curr Code must be "969".
    • [CARDS-51965]
      • Instalment fee code is now taken from an Instalment Scheme even if the fee rate is passed in document tags. Previous system behaviour was to use "FEE" as a fee code value regardless of Instalment Scheme settings.
      Upgrade Note:
      Changed the procedure for generating fee invoice records for instalment plan fees when the fee percentage or amount is passed in document tags. Earlier these records were created with the "FEE" debt code (this value corresponds to the Invoice Events - Fee Code setting). Now the debt code is taken from instalment scheme fee parameters depending on the Calc Scheme.
If an Instalment Scheme contains several fees with the same Calc Scheme, debt code will be taken from the first one. If no fees are configured in the Instalment Scheme, or debt code is not specified for the corresponding fee, the "FEE" value will be used as earlier.
      Updated Manuals: [instalment_management\WAY4_Instalments.pdf]
  • 03.44.30.03
    • [CARDS-51689]
      • MIN_BILLING parameter default behaviour has been changed.
      Upgrade Note:
      The behaviour of the MIN_BILLING parameter has changed. This parameter is set as a tag value in days in an Accounting Scheme or as the Min Billing parameter in Billing Scheme tariffs.
Earlier it was necessary to set value to one day less than the required minimum length of a billing cycle. For example, to limit the minimum length of a cycle to 28 days it was necessary to set MIN_BILLING=27. Now the actual value, MIN_BILLING=28 must be set. Accordingly, the parameter's behaviour now corresponds to documentation.
The change only affects values set as days. Values set in months do not have this problem.
If a client's configuration uses the MIN_BILLING parameter in Accounting Schemes or in Billing Scheme tariffs, the preliminary phase of upgrade will show a message that a problematic configuration exists. Additional details can be found in Process Messages.
In this case, it is necessary to analyse if a shift of minus one day was used in existing settings. If so, the value must be corrected by adding one day.
Values should be corrected after the upgrade process is finished but before the first Contract Daily Update process.
For more information, contact WAY4 support.
    • [CARDS-51878]
      • Upgrade Note:
      Contract Type settings will be validated on upgrade due to data changes in the "IPS Products" handbook. Process log and messages should be checked for reported errors and warnings after Contract Types validation, and the configuration should be corrected to eliminate these errors. Contact Customer Support for instructions on correcting errors.

      The global parameters HA.DEFFERED_DOC_APPLY and HA.DEFFERED_DOC_APPLY_DELAY  must be renamed to HA.DEFERRED_DOC_APPLY and HA.DEFERRED_DOC_APPLY_DELAY, respectively.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [ultimate_ha\distributed processing\Distributed_Processing_setup.pdf]
  • 03.44.29.45
    • [CARDS-51662]
      • [VISA REL] Apr17-341 2.2 : Added new Commercial Product ID 'X' to the default value of the 'COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID' pipe parameter.
      Upgrade Note:
      [VISA REL] Apr17-341 2.2 : The default value of the 'COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID' pipe (VISA BIN Table Import) parameter has been extended. BIN range with the new commercial product ID 'X' will be marked as a commercial category. If a custom value of the 'COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID' pipe parameter is used, it is necessary to add the new commercial product ID (code 'X') to the value.
  • 03.44.29.41
    • [I1607269017]/[CARDS-50154]
      • DA v2: Fixed the procedure to get the last document in a chain. Supported processing reversals that were not generated in the DA interface. The activity "Accepted Presentment Reversal (Iss)" (idt DSP_ACPT_PRS_REV_SYSACT) must be registered in the acquirer strategy.
      Upgrade Note:
      Dispute Assistant R2 (acquiring): Reversal documents that were not created in the DA interface are supported. To apply this functionality, an activity with idt DSP_ACPT_PRS_REV_SYSACT should be registered in the acquirer strategy in the "Processing chargeback" step or according to client dispute workflow. Since the "Accepted Presentment Reversal (Iss)" activity is now supported on both sides (issuer and acquirer), it is recommended to rename it to "Accepted Presentment Reversal".
  • 03.44.29.37
    • [I1611305656]/[CARDS-51348]
      • Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with codes that already exist: a UI dialog is displayed to confirm the script update. If script update is chosen, all the existing test steps will be deleted and the new one rewritten. This dialog window appears only if the pipe's SILENT mode parameter is switched off.
      Upgrade Note:
      Test script import has been modified. When the file being imported contains scripts with the same codes as those already in the database, and the user confirmed update, the old behaviour was to merge data: script steps from the file being imported whose numbers matched those already in the database were rewritten, and all other steps in the database (if any) remained unchanged. The new behaviour allows users to repeat confirmation of the need to update the script and old steps are totally deleted before writing new data from the file.
      Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]
  • 03.44.29.34
    • [CARDS-51486]
      • Additional validation for global tariff data input has been added. When "Start Date" is not specified, the ability to set the tariff from the current banking date will be validated. When it is prohibited, the error message "Tariff Start Date Missing" will be returned.
      Upgrade Note:
      When importing global tariffs with an empty start date through the Tariff Import and Tariff Domains pipes, the error "Global Tariff cannot be applied from current date" will be returned. To import a global tariff with an empty start date and approve it with the current banking date, "ANY_DATE" must be set for the pipes' DATE_CHECK_MODE parameter.
    • [CARDS-51481]
      • JCB ISO Outward (variable): added the "EXT_CURR_EXP" parameter for changing the currency exponent on transaction export.
      Upgrade Note:
      JCB ISO Outward (variable): added the "EXT_CURR_EXP" parameter for changing the currency exponent on transaction export. Parameter format: EXT_CURR_EXP = <3_digit_currency><1_digit_exponent_to_be_used>. This parameter can be used if the currency exponent in WAY4 differs from the JCB currency exponent.
For example EXT_CURR_EXP = 7040 (use 0 exponent for VND currency).
  • 03.44.29.32
    • [CARDS-51461]
      • Added the ability to limit the bonus points amount accrued for a client contract within a loyalty campaign. The limit amount should be set in the "Action Total Limit" field of the tariff action, the ACTION_LIMIT_MODE=LOCAL tag indicates that the action limit should be calculated for each contract. A new strict mode has been added to check the action limit, it prevents total points from exceeding the specified limit with the last transaction; ACTION_LIMIT_MODE=STRICT should be set for the tariff action.
      Upgrade Note:
      The principle has changed for calculating custom fees with contract redefinition (CONTRACT_FOR tag) and a fee amount (FEE_BASE_FROM=FROM_BALANCE or FEE_BASE_FROM=CUSTOM tag). These tags are set in the Service Details field of the "Custom Fee for..." form. The old behaviour used the original contract with the Service in which the custom fee was was defined. In the new behaviour, the balance of the redefined contract is used in calculation, like in system behaviour during authorisation.
  • 03.44.29.31
    • [CARDS-51382]
      • Soft synchronization of sy_conf_group_val records ("DWD_CARD_BRAND" configuration group) is now performed with the menu item "OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\OpenWay Settings\Synchronize DWD_CARD_BRAND with IPS_PRODUCT". If a record with a certain code has to be added to DWD_CARD_BRAND and a deleted record with this code was found, the deleted record is restored and a new record is not created. Synchronization of the PAYMENT SCHEME list ("PAYMENT_SCHEME" configuration group) with sy_std_handbook "PAYMENT_SYSTEM" has been added.
      Upgrade Note:
      For new WAY4 Datamart installations, the "DWD_CARD_BRAND" configuration group is delivered without classifier values. Classifier values have to be added by running the menu item "OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\OpenWay Settings\Synchronize DWD_CARD_BRAND with IPS_PRODUCT".
  • 03.44.29.30
    • [CARDS-50967]
      • A check for main/sub account hierarchy links during the posting process has been added. The fatal error "Disturbed main/sub account hierarchy for contract [contract information]" occurs for broken links. To avoid such fatal errors, a validation script should be run once. See the "Upgrade Notes on Impact Changes" section for more details.
      Upgrade Note:
      As a result of discovering and fixing the problem, a client's installation may contain invalid links between accounts which will lead to the fatal error "Disturbed main/sub account hierarchy for contract [contract information]" in the process of posting documents for the first time after upgrade. To check for this potential problem a special validation script CHECK_CheckSubHierarchy_43-30_CARDS-50967.sql provided by OW Support should be run once. If the configuration is correct, the script should not return any data. If this script returns data, please contact WAY4 Support immediately.
  • 03.44.29.25
    • [CARDS-51270]
      • DA v.2: Added Rule "-> Go to Processing Representment Step" in the "Pre-Arbitration" step of the MasterCard Issuer Standard Strategy and AMEX GNS Issuer Standard Strategy.
      Upgrade Note:
      DA R.2: Added Rule "-> Go to Processing Representment Step" in the "Pre-Arbitration" step of the MasterCard Issuer Standard Strategy and AMEX GNS Issuer Standard Strategy.

In the "Pre-Arbitration" step in MasterCard Issuer Standard Strategy and AMEX GNS Issuer Standard Strategy strategies it is necessary to add the rule "-> Go to Processing Representment Step" with the parameters (RuleCategory="OnActivity", Activity="Cancel Final Chargeback & Return (Iss)", Rule Process Condition="Always", Level="Weak", Action="Change Strategy", Strategy=<appropriate strategy>, Step="Processing Representment") in order to be able to repeat a Final Chargeback after reversing the first Final Chargeback.
  • 03.44.29.19
    • [CARDS-45551]
      • The ability to post Event chains in a user-defined order has been added. A new field, "Step N" should be filled in for the Events in the chain to specify their posting order. A new event posting mode, DEPENDENT_CHAIN has been introduced to provide proper condition checking for cases when an Event depends on the results of previous Events in the chain.
      Upgrade Note:
      A new field, "Step N", has been added to the Event setup form "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Products\Event Types -> [Event Chain]". The order for loading and posting Events in chains is set in this field. All Event chains should be checked and the appropriate order should be specified in this field. If the "Step N" field is not filled, the parent Event is loaded first and then all chain Events in the order in which they appear in the chain.
If loading of chain Events depends on the parent Event or previous Events in a chain, the DEPENDENT_CHAIN tag should be set in the "Special Parameters" field of the Event on which loading of other Events depends.
      Updated Manuals: [product_management\Events.pdf]
  • 03.44.29.16
    • [I1605234769]/[CARDS-50337]
      • The DICT message dictionary is obsolete and will be deleted in WAY4 Cards 03.46.
All forms that were using DICT have been updated to use MESS_DICT.
The menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Transaction Dictionary" now uses the form "Message Dictionary - Transactions".
      Upgrade Note:
      Due to unification of two similar mechanisms for generating messages from the DICT and MESS_DICT tables, now only MESS_DICT table is used, the DICT table is considered obsolete. 
If custom procedures use the DICT table or core functions that work with this table, change to use of the MESS_DICT table and API functions from the cards_msg package, such as: cards_msg.GET_TRANS_NAME(), cards_msg.GET_CONTR_TYPE_NAME(). All API functions that can be used in custom settings are marked with the special comment "-- @API" in PL/SQL package specifications.
      Updated Manuals: [accounting\WAY4_Accounting.pdf]
    • [CARDS-50949]
      • DCI Inward Processing: For loading Acquirer Confirmation File - changed message code S1--I--- trans type "Interchange Total" to S1-AI--- trans type "Acq Interchange Total" and code S1--F--- trans type "Reimbursement Fee Total" to S1-AF--- trans type "Acq Reimbursement Fee Total". They must be changed manually or by loading Copy Configuration file. Supported loading Interchange Issuer Detail File.
      Upgrade Note:
      Manual change is required for DCI channel message. Code "S1-I-", trans type "Interchange Total" must be changed to code "S1-AI-", trans type "Acq Interchange Total". Code "S1F-", trans type "Reimbursement Fee Total" must be changed to code "S1-AF--", trans type "Acq Reimbursement Fee Total". Changes should be made when starting to use the new version of the pipe. If changes are not made, settlement documents will not be posted (unknown message code error).
  • 03.44.29.14
    • [CARDS-50776]
      • The trf.ACNT_DOMAIN_SET function has been removed from the TRF package specification.
      Upgrade Note:
      The trf.ACNT_DOMAIN_SET function has been removed from the TRF package specification. If this function was used in custom procedures, contact the WAY4 vendor.
  • 03.44.29.12
    • [CARDS-50245]
      • 1. The "Dispute Assistant CM" menu has been renamed to "CM Dispute Assistant".
2. The "Financial Cases" sub menu has been added to the ROOT.OpenWay.CM Dispute Assistant menu item as a link to ROOT.OpenWay.CM Risk Management.
3. All operation items ("CM Dispute Assistant", "CM Card Blocking", "CM Consumer Collections", "CM Risk Management") have been moved to the end of the OpenWay menu.
      Upgrade Note:
      The "OpenWay\Dispute Assistant CM" menu branch has been renamed to "OpenWay\CM Dispute Assistant". This menu branch is only provided to customers with the corresponding license. 
This impacts user access grants for this menu - please review access to the corresponding menu branches in the "OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Users & Grants\User Groups and Users - Edit" form and provide access to this menu branch, if necessary. If you have this license, but do not see the menu branch in the system after upgrade, please contact OpenWay Support.
    • [CARDS-50898]
      • The procedure for calculating the amount and number of transactions / amount and number of  reversal transactions for a calendar year (YTD)  for service-based balance types with History Mode="BIlling Date (After)"/ "BIlling Date (Before)" configuration has been changed. Previous system behaviour was to clear the history counters on the date of closing a contract's 12th billing cycle. The new behaviour is to clear them when the new calendar year begins.
      Upgrade Note:
      The procedure for calculating the amount and number of transactions / amount and number of reversal transactions for a calendar year (YTD) for service-based balance types with History Mode="BIlling Date (After)"/ "BIlling Date (Before)" configuration has been changed. Previous system behaviour was to clear the history counters on the date of closing a contract's 12th billing cycle. This behaviour is no longer supported. The new behaviour is to clear them when the new calendar year begins.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Balance_types.pdf]
    • [CARDS-50883]
      • VISA BIN Table Import: A new pipe parameter, COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID=<product id1>,<product id2>,... has been added for splitting BIN ranges into consumer/commercial categories.
      Upgrade Note:
      VISA BIN Table Import: A new pipe parameter, COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID=<product id1>,<product id2>,... has been added. BIN ranges are split into consumer/commercial categories: if a BIN range product is in the COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID list, it is marked as commercial (CARD_PTI=2 tag in bin_table.bin_details), otherwise it is marked as consumer (CARD_PTI=1 tag in bin_table.bin_details). Default parameter value is "G,G1,G3,G4,G5,K,K1,S,S1,S2,S3,S4,S5,S6,". No manual action is required.
  • 03.44.20.07
    • [CARDS-51680]
      • New menu branches have been added: OpenWay\Web Services and OpenWay\Way4Web. The "WS Users & Grants" menu branch has been moved from OpenWay\System\DB Administrator Utilities to these new menu branches; the linked menu OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\WS Users & Grants has been removed. For more details, see the section "Client Upgrade Notes on Impact changes".
      Upgrade Note:
      The "WS Users & Grants" menu branch has been moved from OpenWay\System\DB Administrator Utilities to the new menu groups OpenWay\Web Services and OpenWay\Way4Web. The link OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\WS Users & Grants has been removed. If a custom menu item with a link to the items that have been moved or deleted is used, it must be replaced with a new one. If you have a Web Services or WAY4Web license and the OpenWay\Web Services or OpenWay\Way4Web menu do not appear after upgrade, please contact OpenWay support.
    • [CARDS-51895]
      • The ability to post Event chains in a user-defined order has been added. A new field, "Step N" should be filled in for the Events in the chain to specify their posting order. A new event posting mode, DEPENDENT_CHAIN has been introduced to provide proper condition checking for cases when an Event depends on the results of previous Events in the chain.
      Upgrade Note:
      A new field, "Step N", has been added to the Event setup form "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Products\Event Types -> [Event Chain]". The order for loading and posting Events in chains is set in this field. All Event chains should be checked and the appropriate order should be specified in this field. If the "Step N" field is not filled, the parent Event is loaded first and then all chain Events in the order in which they appear in the chain.
If loading of chain Events depends on the parent Event or previous Events in a chain, the DEPENDENT_CHAIN tag should be set in the "Special Parameters" field of the Event on which loading of other Events depends.
      Updated Manuals: [product_management\Events.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51878]
      • Upgrade Note:
      Contract Type settings will be validated on upgrade due to data changes in the "IPS Products" handbook. Process log and messages should be checked for reported errors and warnings after Contract Types validation, and the configuration should be corrected to eliminate these errors. Contact Customer Support for instructions on correcting errors.
    • [CARDS-51960]
      • Country Table: Revised record for Madagascar. Code (3 bytes) must be "MDG", Code (2 bytes) must be "MG", Code (Numeric) must be "450", Curr Name must be "MALAGASY ARIARY", Curr Code must be "MGA", N Curr Code must be "969". No impact on transaction processing.
      Upgrade Note:
      Open form "Country Table" (menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Country Table") and check that the record for Madagascar has the following values: Code (3 bytes) must be "MDG", Code (2 bytes) must be "MG", Code (Numeric) must be "450", Curr Name must be "MALAGASY ARIARY", Curr Code must be "MGA", N Curr Code must be "969".
    • [CARDS-51965]
      • Instalment fee code is now taken from an Instalment Scheme even if the fee rate is passed in document tags. Previous system behaviour was to use "FEE" as a fee code value regardless of Instalment Scheme settings.
      Upgrade Note:
      Changed the procedure for generating fee invoice records for instalment plan fees when the fee percentage or amount is passed in document tags. Earlier these records were created with the "FEE" debt code (this value corresponds to the Invoice Events - Fee Code setting). Now the debt code is taken from instalment scheme fee parameters depending on the Calc Scheme.
If an Instalment Scheme contains several fees with the same Calc Scheme, debt code will be taken from the first one. If no fees are configured in the Instalment Scheme, or debt code is not specified for the corresponding fee, the "FEE" value will be used as earlier.
      Updated Manuals: [instalment_management\WAY4_Instalments.pdf]
    • [CARDS-52022]
      • Fixed incorrect processing of usage limiters with the SingleSliding period type when the limiter's period was not defined for a particular contract with an application or manually. Without this additional determination, the limiter is not analyzed.
      Upgrade Note:
      Fixed incorrect processing of usage limiters with the SingleSliding period type when the limiter's period was not defined for a particular contract. 
It is necessary to run the following query to check if this problem ever occurred:

select count(*) from usage_templ where limit_renew_type='s' and amnd_state = 'A';

If this query returns a non-zero value, contact Customer Support for further instructions.
    • [I1611079238]/[CARDS-51706]
      • Union Pay Inward Processing: Fixed Settlement S2 level amounts. Union Pay Audit Trailer Import: Added Settlement S2 level for Reimbursement Fees. Manual Action: adding message types for S2 level Reimbursement Fees.
      Upgrade Note:
      New message types must be added (Full/Configuration Setup/Transaction Types/Message Types - All): 
Acq Reimb Fee Detail Online (Code S2-AF---0, Trans type "Acq Reimb Fee Detail"),
Acq Reimb Fee Detail Batch (Code S2-AF---1, Trans type "Acq Reimb Fee Detail"),
Acq Reimb Fee Detail Total Dispute and manual (Code S2-AF---2, Trans type "Acq Reimb Fee Detail"),
Iss Reimb Fee Detail Online (Code S2-IF---0, Trans type "Iss Reimb Fee Detail"),
Iss Reimb Fee Detail Batch (Code S2-IF---1, Trans type "Iss Reimb Fee Detail"),
Iss Reimb Fee Detail Total Dispute and manual (Code S2-IF---2.Trans type "Iss Reimb Fee Detail").
    • [I1702196631]/[CARDS-52141]
      • Fixed amount calculation for standing orders with the BY_BATCH tag; now zero amount orders are not recalculated based on account balance.
      Upgrade Note:
      Behaviour of standing orders with BY_BATCH tag has changed. Orders with "Order Type" different than "Debit Amount" and "Credit Amount" will not generate any transfers. Earlier these orders generated transfers based on account balance ignoring batch processing.
Configuration should be checked and if such orders are used, reconfiguration should be made. Either the BY_BATCH tag should be removed from the order or the Order Type should be changed to "Debit Amount" or "Credit Amount" depending on business requirements.
  • 03.44.20.05
    • [CARDS-51610]
      • Added the ability to limit the bonus points amount accrued for a client contract within a loyalty campaign. The limit amount should be set in the "Action Total Limit" field of the tariff action, the ACTION_LIMIT_MODE=LOCAL tag indicates that the action limit should be calculated for each contract. A new strict mode has been added to check the action limit, it prevents total points from exceeding the specified limit with the last transaction; ACTION_LIMIT_MODE=STRICT should be set for the tariff action.
      Upgrade Note:
      The principle has changed for calculating custom fees with contract redefinition (CONTRACT_FOR tag) and a fee amount (FEE_BASE_FROM=FROM_BALANCE or FEE_BASE_FROM=CUSTOM tag). These tags are set in the Service Details field of the "Custom Fee for..." form. The old behaviour used the original contract with the Service in which the custom fee was was defined. In the new behaviour, the balance of the redefined contract is used in calculation, like in system behaviour during authorisation.
    • [I1607269017]/[CARDS-50154]
      • DA v2: Fixed the procedure to get the last document in a chain. Supported processing reversals that were not generated in the DA interface. The activity "Accepted Presentment Reversal (Iss)" (idt DSP_ACPT_PRS_REV_SYSACT) must be registered in the acquirer strategy.
      Upgrade Note:
      Dispute Assistant R2 (acquiring): Reversal documents that were not created in the DA interface are supported. To apply this functionality, an activity with idt DSP_ACPT_PRS_REV_SYSACT should be registered in the acquirer strategy in the "Processing chargeback" step or according to client dispute workflow. Since the "Accepted Presentment Reversal (Iss)" activity is now supported on both sides (issuer and acquirer), it is recommended to rename it to "Accepted Presentment Reversal".
    • [I1611305656]/[CARDS-51348]
      • Product Inspector test script import has been modified when in the file being imported there are test scripts with codes that already exist: a UI dialog is displayed to confirm the script update. If script update is chosen, all the existing test steps will be deleted and the new one rewritten. This dialog window appears only if the pipe's SILENT mode parameter is switched off.
      Upgrade Note:
      Test script import has been modified. When the file being imported contains scripts with the same codes as those already in the database, and the user confirmed update, the old behaviour was to merge data: script steps from the file being imported whose numbers matched those already in the database were rewritten, and all other steps in the database (if any) remained unchanged. The new behaviour allows users to repeat confirmation of the need to update the script and old steps are totally deleted before writing new data from the file.
      Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]
    • [CARDS-51481]
      • JCB ISO Outward (variable): added the "EXT_CURR_EXP" parameter for changing the currency exponent on transaction export.
      Upgrade Note:
      JCB ISO Outward (variable): added the "EXT_CURR_EXP" parameter for changing the currency exponent on transaction export. Parameter format: EXT_CURR_EXP = <3_digit_currency><1_digit_exponent_to_be_used>. This parameter can be used if the currency exponent in WAY4 differs from the JCB currency exponent.
For example EXT_CURR_EXP = 7040 (use 0 exponent for VND currency).
    • [CARDS-51662]
      • [VISA REL] Apr17-341 2.2 : Added new Commercial Product ID 'X' to the default value of the 'COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID' pipe parameter.
      Upgrade Note:
      [VISA REL] Apr17-341 2.2 : The default value of the 'COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID' pipe (VISA BIN Table Import) parameter has been extended. BIN range with the new commercial product ID 'X' will be marked as a commercial category. If a custom value of the 'COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID' pipe parameter is used, it is necessary to add the new commercial product ID (code 'X') to the value.
  • 03.44.20.04
    • [CARDS-50883]
      • VISA BIN Table Import: A new pipe parameter, COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID=<product id1>,<product id2>,... has been added for splitting BIN ranges into consumer/commercial categories.
      Upgrade Note:
      VISA BIN Table Import: A new pipe parameter, COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID=<product id1>,<product id2>,... has been added. BIN ranges are split into consumer/commercial categories: if a BIN range product is in the COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID list, it is marked as commercial (CARD_PTI=2 tag in bin_table.bin_details), otherwise it is marked as consumer (CARD_PTI=1 tag in bin_table.bin_details). Default parameter value is "G,G1,G3,G4,G5,K,K1,S,S1,S2,S3,S4,S5,S6,". No manual action is required.
    • [CARDS-50949]
      • DCI Inward Processing: For loading Acquirer Confirmation File - changed message code S1--I--- trans type "Interchange Total" to S1-AI--- trans type "Acq Interchange Total" and code S1--F--- trans type "Reimbursement Fee Total" to S1-AF--- trans type "Acq Reimbursement Fee Total". They must be changed manually or by loading Copy Configuration file. Supported loading Interchange Issuer Detail File.
      Upgrade Note:
      Manual change is required for DCI channel message. Code "S1-I-", trans type "Interchange Total" must be changed to code "S1-AI-", trans type "Acq Interchange Total". Code "S1F-", trans type "Reimbursement Fee Total" must be changed to code "S1-AF--", trans type "Acq Reimbursement Fee Total". Changes should be made when starting to use the new version of the pipe. If changes are not made, settlement documents will not be posted (unknown message code error).
  • 03.44.19.41
    • [I1605234769]/[CARDS-50337]
      • The DICT message dictionary is obsolete and will be deleted in WAY4 Cards 03.46.
All forms that were using DICT have been updated to use MESS_DICT.
The menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Transaction Dictionary" now uses the form "Message Dictionary - Transactions".
      Upgrade Note:
      Due to unification of two similar mechanisms for generating messages from the DICT and MESS_DICT tables, now only MESS_DICT table is used, the DICT table is considered obsolete. 
If custom procedures use the DICT table or core functions that work with this table, change to use of the MESS_DICT table and API functions from the cards_msg package, such as: cards_msg.GET_TRANS_NAME(), cards_msg.GET_CONTR_TYPE_NAME(). All API functions that can be used in custom settings are marked with the special comment "-- @API" in PL/SQL package specifications.
      Updated Manuals: [accounting\WAY4_Accounting.pdf]
    • [CARDS-50949]
      • DCI Inward Processing: For loading Acquirer Confirmation File - changed message code S1--I--- trans type "Interchange Total" to S1-AI--- trans type "Acq Interchange Total" and code S1--F--- trans type "Reimbursement Fee Total" to S1-AF--- trans type "Acq Reimbursement Fee Total". They must be changed manually or by loading Copy Configuration file. Supported loading Interchange Issuer Detail File.
      Upgrade Note:
      Manual change is required for DCI channel message. Code "S1-I-", trans type "Interchange Total" must be changed to code "S1-AI-", trans type "Acq Interchange Total". Code "S1F-", trans type "Reimbursement Fee Total" must be changed to code "S1-AF--", trans type "Acq Reimbursement Fee Total". Changes should be made when starting to use the new version of the pipe. If changes are not made, settlement documents will not be posted (unknown message code error).
  • 03.44.19.35
    • [CARDS-50883]
      • VISA BIN Table Import: A new pipe parameter, COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID=<product id1>,<product id2>,... has been added for splitting BIN ranges into consumer/commercial categories.
      Upgrade Note:
      VISA BIN Table Import: A new pipe parameter, COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID=<product id1>,<product id2>,... has been added. BIN ranges are split into consumer/commercial categories: if a BIN range product is in the COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID list, it is marked as commercial (CARD_PTI=2 tag in bin_table.bin_details), otherwise it is marked as consumer (CARD_PTI=1 tag in bin_table.bin_details). Default parameter value is "G,G1,G3,G4,G5,K,K1,S,S1,S2,S3,S4,S5,S6,". No manual action is required.
  • 03.44.19.26
    • [CARDS-50665]
      • Additional input parameters have been added to the CUST_TRANS_CODE custom procedure. These parameters allow more precise customization of transaction codes. A transaction code generated by the custom function is not altered anymore with additions in standard code. The resulting transaction code is used in the macrotransaction and GL Trace. Entry record transaction codes can be synchronised with GL Trace records if the SYNC_ENTRY_GL_TRANS_CODE global parameter is set to "Y".

For using standard transaction codes, the function should return null value. 

Different transaction codes can be generated for base amount, base fee, additional fee and markup using logic for the EntryRole input parameter. A transaction code with the BaseAmount role is saved in a macrotransaction, other roles are used in GL Trace and Entry only. 
The previous version cust_trans code was only called for the BaseAmount role. If only customization of macrotransaction trans_code is needed (that is inherited by certain rules into gl_trace and entry) then a condition on this EntryRole should be added.
      Upgrade Note:
      Additional input parameters have been added to the CUST_TRANS_CODE custom procedure. If this procedure has been redefined (it differs from the standard one) in the client's installation, it should be updated. The new version is provided when custom procedures are delivered by Customer Support as part of the upgrade process.
      Updated Manuals: [accounting\WAY4_Accounting.pdf] [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]
  • 03.44.19.21
    • [CARDS-50570]
      • New financial matching algorithm has been implemented.
      Upgrade Note:
      The algorithm for matching financial documents to authorization requests has been improved in Document Processing procedure. Although successful testing was performed by vendor on the standard WAY4 configuration, it is highly recommended for issuers, acquirers and processing centres to perform regression testing thoroughly for the following test cases on customer-specific configurations:
- non-authorized original Financial document processing 
- single authorized original Financial document processing with single Authorization / Transit (Affiliated) Authorization document
- single authorized original Financial document processing with multiple Authorization / Transit (Affiliated) Authorization documents
- multiple authorized original Financial document processing with single Authorization / Transit (Affiliated) Authorization document
- multiple authorized original Financial document processing with multiple Authorization / Transit (Affiliated) Authorization documents
- single and multiple Adjustment and Reversal Financial document processing
- secondary Financial document chain processing
- Reposted original and secondary Financial document processing
- interbank Financial document single and chain processing (Fee Collection and Funds Disbursement) 
- other regression tests for the Financial document matching process.
    • [CARDS-50545]
      • VISA, Affiliated Base II pipes: Removed the difference between Acquirer and Issuer Fee Collections. Standard forms for Fee Collection document creation have been modified. The new forms should be used. Interchange routing settings are required for incoming Fee Collection processing targeted to an affiliated bank. See the "Upgrade Notes on Impact Changes" section for more details.
      Upgrade Note:
      Fee Collection document processing for affiliated banks has been changed. Now to accept these transactions, an additional row with the parameters category = "Account", transaction type = "Fee Collection Inc", Our Member ID = "affiliated BIN" must be added to the routing setup for the affiliated bank.
Also, Fee Collection documents can be sent through an affiliated interface. If it is not necessary to send these documents, set the "CAN_BE_ONUS;" tag in the BIN Details field of this member's BIN table.
      Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Processing_Interbank_Documents.pdf]
    • [CARDS-50553]
      • RBS number inheritance for liability contracts has been removed in Advanced Applications R2.
      Upgrade Note:
      In R2 applications, removed RBS number inheritance when creating a new Liability contract. Earlier this inheritance incorrectly took place if an RBS number was not sent for a related contract.
Inheritance remains for Sub-Main relations.
  • 03.44.19.19
    • [I1511033062]/[CARDS-49655]
      • Routing procedure for Fee Collection and other Interbank transactions (Funds Disbursement and Settlement) received by a processing centre or bank has been fixed and unified. Manual actions are required.
      Upgrade Note:
      Account to Account (Fee Collection, Funds Disbursement and Settlement) Interbank document routing and processing procedures have been unified. According to internal requirements, these operations can be processed inside the system (for example, documents for own IPS MemberIDs) or can be sent to an external system (for example, from a processing centre to an affiliated bank working on a Host to Host interface). To show an interbank document in internal entries, an IPS MemberID must be marked with the CAN_BE_ONUS; tag in the "Bin Details" field of the form OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Routing\BIN Table. Additional setup is required to record interbank documents sent to an external affiliated system. These special settings can be obtained in the scope of additional OpenWay services.
      Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Interchange_Routing.pdf]
  • 03.44.19.18
    • [I1609216346]/[CARDS-50447]
      • Fixed incorrect processing of parent usage limiter activity depending on document tags.
      Upgrade Note:
      The procedure for checking tags in the "Spc Parm field" when processing contract usage limiters has changed. In particular, the result of checking limiters with Inverse Conditions="Yes" may change. In the new behaviour, inversion is applied to the entire set of "Conditions" group parameters and tags specified in the "Spc Parm" field.
  • 03.44.19.14
    • [CARDS-50322]
      • GL traces with a date in the past are not written to the exception table that can be viewed in OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special OpenWay Utilities\GL\GL Trace Exceptions if the "Close GL" process has not been launched.
      Upgrade Note:
      GL traces created within current day, but having GL date in the past are not written to the exception table that can be viewed in OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special OpenWay Utilities\GL\GL Trace Exceptions if the "Close GL" process has not been launched. Previously, normal GL entries sometimes were erroneousely registered in GL Trace Exceptions table, for example, entries generated by "Bad Debt Reserving" standard process (OpenWay\Full\Daily Procedures\Reserves Accrual\Reserves Accrual for Contracts in Prev Day). To support this new behaviour we added creation of a consistency point of the special type in the mp_consist_point table: the first time the "Close GL" process is run during the day, a point is created with the current date. Outside the Contracts Daily Update process a check will be made that there is no "Close GL" consistency point with a date later than the posting date. If there is no such point, the entry is not registered in "GL Trace Exceptions", otherwise the entry is registered. Thereby, all entries for the previous day will not go into "GL Trace Exceptions", before running "Close GL" process.
    • [I1609202368]/[CARDS-50317]
      • VISA Affiliated Outward: Fixed "VISA_TA is not found" error for H2H channels with the "Is On Us'" = "N" property. The global parameter AFF_CH_LIST must be filled with the codes of these channels.
      Upgrade Note:
      Added the additional global parameter AFF_CH_LIST. If VISA transactions are processed through H2H channels with IsOnUs="N", these channels must be listed in this new parameter. Format for AFF_CH_LIST is <channel1><channel2>, for example AFF_CH_LIST = qwe, where "q", "w", "e" are the required channels.
  • 03.44.19.12
    • [CARDS-50023]
      • Standard calculation of statistic attributes has been moved from cust_stat_attr_value() to the STAT.STAT_ATTR_VALUE() package. See the "Upgrade Notes on Impact Changes" section for more details.
      Upgrade Note:
      Standard calculation of statistic attributes has been moved from the cust_stat_attr_value procedure to a standard package. Now the cust_stat_attr_value in the distributive does not contain any logic. For all customers who customised this procedure, the WAY4 vendor's team will prepare an update in which standard parts will be eliminated from this procedure, leaving only those that were redefined. The updated cust_stat_attr_value procedure will be provided as part of the standard process for version migration support.
    • [CARDS-50286]
      • DA v2: The "Change Trusted Amount" activity must be configured with "Amount Type Group" = "Client Amounts".
      Upgrade Note:
      Dispute Assistant R2. The "Amount Type Group" parameter for the "Change Trusted Amount (DSP_SET_TRUST_AMNT_ACT)" activity must be set to "Client Amounts" to determine the currency of the amount being specified and to eliminate a possible "Trusted currency mismatches earlier specified currency" error.
  • 03.44.19.10
    • [CARDS-50122]
      • Order by clause is added into the select for quering the contracts for the reserving functionality.
      Upgrade Note:
      Sorting when selecting contracts for the reserving process has been added. This may affect performance if:
 - The reserving processes is used and the daily procedure OpenWay\Full\Daily Procedures\Start of Day Step By Step\Requested Events Uploading is run regularly.
 - The global parameter MULTIPLE_RESERVE_SCHEME=Y is set.
 - The form OpenWay\Full\Daily Procedures\Start of Day Step By Step\Requested Event Types Check is empty.
In the aforementioned cases, check settings before upgrade and measure changes in reserving process performance after upgrade. In the event of significant changes, contact Openway Support.
    • [CARDS-49766]
      • Fixed DE0165.01 filling. NSPK Collection Only Export.
      Upgrade Note:
      Processors must set up the NSPK_BANK_ID tag in the "Special Parms" field for the financial institution (menu path "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Financial Institutions"). The tag must have a 5-digit Unique Member ID value assigned by NSPK to this financial institution("NSPK_BANK_ID=<value>;") .
    • [I1603050966]/[CARDS-48377]
      • Fixed problem with GL Entry being generated but not included in the GL Entries export file. This problem is rare and caused by incorrect GL configuration (empty HD GL Number in Interbranch account templates). Now the posting process will stop with a fatal error instead of generating incorrect GL Entries with empty debit GL account or credit GL account fields. For more details, see the "Upgrade notes on Impact changes" section.
      Upgrade Note:
      Fixed problem when GL Entries were generated but not included in the GL Entries export file. This problem is rare and caused by incorrect General Ledger configuration (empty HeadOffice GL # field for account templates in Interbranch Loro/Nostro Accounting Schemes or empty GL # field in other account templates). Now the macrotransaction posting process will stop with  a fatal error when an attempt is made to generate incorrect GL Entries with empty Debit Account Number or Credit Account Number. 

It is necessary to run the following query to check if this problem ever occurred:

select count(*) from gl_transfer where order_status = 'A' and outward_status is null and (cr_number is null or dr_number is null)

If this query returns a non-zero value, contact Customer Support for further instructions.
When the first GL entry with an empty debit account number or credit account number is found, the macrotransaction posting process will stop, so even one incorrect GL Entry may block the whole posting process. To continue the posting process for the remaining GL Entries while problematic ones are being analysed, it is recommended to set the EXCEPTION_LIMIT process parameter for the posting process (see the "Process Parameters" chapter in the document Global_Parameters.pdf for details).
  • 03.44.10.02
    • [CARDS-50545]
      • VISA, Affiliated Base II pipes: Removed the difference between Acquirer and Issuer Fee Collections. Standard forms for Fee Collection document creation have been modified. The new forms should be used. Interchange routing settings are required for incoming Fee Collection processing targeted to an affiliated bank. See the "Upgrade Notes on Impact Changes" section for more details.
      Upgrade Note:
      Fee Collection document processing for affiliated banks has been changed. Now to accept these transactions, an additional row with the parameters category = "Account", transaction type = "Fee Collection Inc", Our Member ID = "affiliated BIN" must be added to the routing setup for the affiliated bank.
Also, Fee Collection documents can be sent through an affiliated interface. If it is not necessary to send these documents, set the "CAN_BE_ONUS;" tag in the BIN Details field of this member's BIN table.
      Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Processing_Interbank_Documents.pdf]

      Upgrade Note:
      Account to Account (Fee Collection, Funds Disbursement and Settlement) Interbank document routing and processing procedures have been unified. According to internal requirements, these operations can be processed inside the system (for example, documents for own IPS MemberIDs) or can be sent to an external system (for example, from a processing centre to an affiliated bank working on a Host to Host interface). To show an interbank document in internal entries, an IPS MemberID must be marked with the CAN_BE_ONUS; tag in the "Bin Details" field of the form OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Routing\BIN Table.     • [CARDS-49766]
      • Fixed DE0165.01 filling. NSPK Collection Only Export.

  • 03.44.09.12
    • [CARDS-50064]
      • The ability to calculate the number of days past due has been added. Account schemes should be configured accordingly.
      Upgrade Note:
      The CUST_INV_SORT_CODE custom function has been changed. Now the macrotransaction date and ID will be also be used in addition to the document date and ID used earlier.
If the new method is used to calculate PD_DATE for the past due date, the CUST_INV_SORT_CODE function should be modified and macrotransaction data should be used instead of document data.
      Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf] [product_management\Functional_Dates.pdf]
    • [CARDS-50096]
      • Upgrade Note:
      Instalment functions used in instalment views have been moved from ws_instl to instl and instl_api packages. If any procedures or functions from the ws_instl package are used in custom code, they should be replaced with the same functions from the instl_api package.
    • [CARDS-50062]
      • INTEREST_WARNING event generation has been fixed. This event is executed automatically when a financial reversal document is processed if limit normalisation was performed between the registration of the original document's posting and its reversal. This event is only generated with the PATCH_REVERSE_INTEREST=Y global parameter.
      Upgrade Note:
      System behaviour on financial reversal document posting with the global parameter PATCH_REVERSE_INTEREST=Y (and DIVIDE_ITEMS=N or absent) has changed. Previously, the posting date of the reversed document was the same as the original document's posting date, even when limit normalisation took place at the time of posting the original transaction. 

Now the posting date of the reversed document will be the posting date of the original document if during the time from which the original transaction was registered to its reversal limit normalisation or due normalisation was not performed. If normalisation was performed, the posting date of the reversal document is the same as the current banking date.
      Updated Manuals: [product_management\Events.pdf]
  • 03.44.09.11
    • [CARDS-50034]
      • Evening End of Day is ready for Distributed Processing.
      Upgrade Note:
      If a custom menu item is used for Evening End of Day, the menu subitem SAVE_NEW_LDATE must be added after entering a new banking date, even if Distributed Processing is not used. See OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special OpenWay Utilities\2-phased Set Banking Date\Set Banking Date (2-phased) for an example.
  • 03.44.09.10
    • [CARDS-49702]
      • Differentiated payment schemes are supported for Instalments.
      Upgrade Note:
      As all existing instalment plans were calculated by the Annuity payment scheme, instalment schemes will be updated to have Payment Scheme = Annuity.
      Updated Manuals: [instalment_management\WAY4_Instalments.pdf]
  • 03.43.99.20
    • [CARDS-50034]
      • Evening End of Day is ready for Distributed Processing.
      Upgrade Note:
      If a custom menu item is used for Evening End of Day, the menu subitem SAVE_NEW_LDATE must be added after entering a new banking date, even if Distributed Processing is not used. See OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special OpenWay Utilities\2-phased Set Banking Date\Set Banking Date (2-phased) for an example.
  • 03.43.99.18
    • [CARDS-49357]
      • Priority for attaching tariff sub-domains has been implemented for parent domains with the tag ATTACH_SUBS. The PRIOR tag should be used in sub-domain Apply Rules.
      Upgrade Note:
      The priority in which tariff sub-domains will be attached for a parent domain with the "ATTACH_SUBS" tag in the Apply Rules field can be set in descending order of priority specified in the "PRIOR" tag of the sub-domain's "Apply Rules" field. In previous system behaviour, tariff sub-domains were attached in random order.
    • [CARDS-49566]
      • The OpenWay\WAY4 Data Warehouse Interface menu has been renamed to OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface. See the "Upgrade Notes on Impact changes" section for more details.
      Upgrade Note:
      The menu branch OpenWay\WAY4 Data Warehouse Interface menu has been renamed to OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface. This menu branch is only provided to customers with the corresponding license.
If there are custom menu items reusing standard OpenWay\WAY4 Data Warehouse Interface menu it is necessary to update link names for them.
    • [CARDS-48289]
      • MasterCard Debit Switch is supported in the XLS_MC_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf report. The P_CHANNEL parameter added. The default value is 'D', 'E', 'e'. Changes have been made to the standard version of cust_stat_attr_value. Please see Upgrade Notes on Impact changes for details.
      Upgrade Note:
      The XLS_MC_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf report has been updated: MasterCard Debit Switch transactions are now supported in the report. For these changes to be applied in statistics, do the following 
1. Merge the new standard version of the cust_stat_attr_value procedure with the one used (if it was customized)
2. Drop statistics for the whole reporting period (run the menu items OpenWay\Full\Statistics\Drop Statistics and OpenWay\Full\Statistics\Dictionaries\Purge Obsolete Statistical Groups)
3. Install the XLS_MC_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf report from this version according to doc\reportssetup.html manual.
      Updated Manuals: [core\WAY4 Statistical Reports.pdf]
    • [I1511033062]/[CARDS-49655]
      • Routing procedure for Fee Collection and other Interbank transactions (Funds Disbursement and Settlement) received by a processing centre or bank has been fixed and unified. Manual actions are required.
      Upgrade Note:
      Account to Account (Fee Collection, Funds Disbursement and Settlement) Interbank document routing and processing procedures have been unified. According to internal requirements, these operations can be processed inside the system (for example, documents for own IPS MemberIDs) or can be sent to an external system (for example, from a processing centre to an affiliated bank working on a Host to Host interface). To show an interbank document in internal entries, an IPS MemberID must be marked with the CAN_BE_ONUS; tag in the "Bin Details" field of the form OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Routing\BIN Table. Additional setup is required to record interbank documents sent to an external affiliated system. These special settings can be obtained in the scope of additional OpenWay services.
      Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Interchange_Routing.pdf]
  • 03.43.99.15
    • [CARDS-49650]
      • Fixed incorrect ageing of delinquent amounts when the MIN_DUE or MIN_DUE_AMOUNT tag is set in the "Template Details" field of an account template. A check is required. For more information, see Client Upgrade Notes.
      Upgrade Note:
      Fixed incorrect ageing of delinquent amounts when the MIN_DUE or MIN_DUE_AMOUNT tags are set in the account template. OpenWay Support provides a check script that should be run on a test environment prior to the upgrade procedure to find account templates with a possible incorrect balance. If the test script finds records with this configuration, contact OpenWay support for additional information.
  • 03.43.99.13
    • [CARDS-49531]
      • "BT_SIMPLE" mode processing has changed: Current Due Min Amount Threshold, configured as specified in the Statement Tariff or Account Scheme Min Repayment value, and Full Statement Balance Threshold, configured as a new Threshold tariff with the predefined code "MTP_FULL_BALANCE", have been introduced.
      Upgrade Note:
      The "BT_SIMPLE" method for calculating minimum payment has changed, and changes in the configuration may be required. The Min Repayment value that can be set using Statement Tariff or in an Account Scheme, is no longer used as the value of the Full Statement Balance Threshold parameter. In the new system behaviour (if the value of Repayment Percent is not equal to zero), if the current minimum due amount is less than the Min Repayment value, the current minimum amount will be increased to the Min Repayment value. A new Threshold tariff with the code "MTP_FULL_BALANCE" must be used as the Full Statement Balance Threshold parameter.
  • 03.43.99.12
    • [CARDS-49511]
      • Instalment Tariffs with the Instalment Fee and Instalment Scheme roles now can be configured to check document tags and additional properties. This makes it possible to specify "If Preference Type" for an Instalment Fee tariff, for example.
      Upgrade Note:
      Signature of trf.INSTL_FEE_PARMS and trf.INSTL_PARMS has been extended to include document records as input parameters. Custom procedures using these procedures should be corrected.
    • [CARDS-48971]
      • XLS_CB_f250_2.rdf report: 
Default values have been corrected for the following report parameters:
P_CAN_DISPENSE_CASH, P_CAN_RETAIL, P_CAN_ACCEPT_CASH, P_CAN_WORK_WO_CARD, P_IS_POS.
The P_HAS_CARDREADER parameter has been deleted.
New parameters P_IS_KIOSK and P_CAN_WORK_WITH_CARD have been added.
Columns 4-9 and 11 have been corrected.
      Upgrade Note:
      The algorithm for calculating columns 4-9 and 11 of the XLS_CB_f250_2.rdf report (this report is only for Russia) has been corrected. 
Accordingly, if the following parameters were specified in the menu item: P_CAN_DISPENSE_CASH, P_CAN_RETAIL, P_CAN_ACCEPT_CASH, P_CAN_WORK_WO_CARD, P_HAS_CARDREADER, these parameters must be reconfigured after consulting with Customer Support.
      Updated Manuals: [rf_reporting\250\Form_250.pdf]
    • [I1606172243]/[CARDS-49507]
      • Visa BIN Table Import: fixed filling BIN_TABLE.USAGE for PLUS BIN ranges.
      Upgrade Note:
      Visa BIN Table Import (pipe): BIN_TABLE.USAGE is filled with the "D"  value (was null) for PLUS BIN ranges.

To avoid creating history records in BIN_TABLE it is recommended to run a script before using the modified pipe for the first time.

UPDATE BIN_TABLE t
SET t.USAGE           = 'D'
WHERE t.CARD_BRAND    = 'PLUS'
AND t.DATA_SOURCE     = 'P'
AND t.USAGE          IS NULL
AND t.AMND_STATE      = 'A'
AND t.BIN_STATUS      = 'A'
AND t.BIN_GROUP__OID IN
  (SELECT ID
  FROM BIN_GROUP
  WHERE AMND_STATE='A'
  AND Channel     = 'V'
  AND ((CARD_ORG LIKE 'VRW%E')
  OR (CARD_ORG LIKE 'VCW%E')
  OR (CARD_ORG = 'EP')
  OR (CARD_ORG LIKE 'P%')))
  • 03.43.99.11
    • [CARDS-49075]
      • In Advanced Applications R2, application accept is downgraded to approve in secondary nodes.
      Upgrade Note:
      For Advanced Applications R2 in a Secondary node, a request to accept unapproved applications is replaced with their approval.
In NoWF mode, in this case when an application has been approved successfully, the warning "Application is approved successfully and will be processed later" is returned. To handle this situation when working according to Workflow, the following setup in the strategy must be used:
- a record with the code 2265 must be added to OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Setup\Workflow Configuration\OpenWay Settings\Activity Results (error code that this type of application cannot be processed in a Secondary node).
- register this result for the action Accept - OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Setup\Workflow Configuration\Activities.
- Add a rule to Rules, that in the event of Accept with this result, the Approve action must be performed.

As a result, an attempt to accept an application that was completed with the code 2265 is replaced with its approval and the warning "Application is approved successfully and will be processed later" will be returned to the application's sender. This warning will be saved in the application's history.
After these applications are replicated to the Primary node, they will be processed by the nearest group accept (OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Application Processing\Issuing Applications - Accept, Acquiring Applications - Accept).
Setup has been added to the standard configuration and exported to \WAY4Source\WAY4Cards\Opt\applications_r2\db\datam\StandardWFStrategies.txt.
      Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_Workflow.pdf]
    • [CARDS-49252]
      • The functionality of Balance Types with the "COUNTER_ONLY" tag in the "Posting Details" field has been fixed for multi-currency cumulation mode (when accounts in different currencies are registered for the contract).
The logic for recording COUNTER_ONLY balances has also been changed, now they are "positive" for Advices and "negative" for Reversals.
A new technical currency - "NUM" has been added for recording "COUNTER_ONLY" Balance Types.
Please see "Client Upgrade Notes" for detailed information.
      Upgrade Note:
      Changed the algorithm for calculating the number of transactions made through a Balance Type using the COUNTER_ONLY tag (in the "Posting details" field) for cases when accounts in different currencies are registered for the contract. To do so, a new technical currency has been implemented for recording the number of transactions.
Now "COUNTER_ONLY" Balance Type are recorded in the "NUM" technical currency, not in the contract currency and a letter code, not a number code is specified in the "Currency" field (for access to information about a contract's Balance Type values, click the [Additional] button in the "Balance for <…>" window of the corresponding contract.)
The logic for recording "COUNTER_ONLY" balances has also changed , now Advices are considered "positive" and Reversals as "negative". This change affects Balance Types with Direction=Debit / Debit Entry / None, whose sign will change to the opposite after system upgrade.
For example:
3 Retail transactions; 2 Reversals; 1 Credit transaction
- for a Balance Type with Direction=Debit, the balance value will be equal to 1 (+3 - 2)
- for a Balance Type with Direction=Debit Entry, the balance value will be equal to 3 (+3)
- for a Balance Type with Direction=none, the balance value will be equal to 2 (+3 - 2 +1).
These changes impact how data are shown in standard screen forms and in SOA messages that contain contract balance data. Custom export of contract balance data may also be affected. Standard batch export interfaces are not affected by this change since they do not export data from contract balance tables.
WAY4 customer support provides a separate test script that should be run in a copy of the production system before starting the procedure for upgrading to the new version.
If the test script finds the COUNTER_ONLY parameter is used in system settings, contact Support for additional instructions.
      Updated Manuals: [core\Balance_types.pdf] [tags description]
    • [CARDS-49369]
      • Upgrade Note:
      MIR statistics reports -> NSPK-Issuing report:
Parameter default values have been changed. It is necessary to run the menu item "OpenWay\NSPK\NSPK. Reports\Report Parameters Configuration(NSPK Issuing)". In addition, the statistic attribute TRN_IS_TRANSFER must be added to "OpenWay\Full\Statistics\Dictionaries\Statistic Attributes (custom)". This can be done manually or by Copy Configuration.
      Updated Manuals: [mir_statistical_reports\MIR_Statistical_Reports.pdf]
    • [CARDS-49392]
      • "SAVE_GL_N" option has been excluded from support. 
System default behaviour is the following: "GL Number" and "HeadOffice GL Number" are not copied from the parent Accounting Scheme if they are already filled in the child Accounting Scheme. Please see "Client Upgrade Notes" for detailed information.
      Upgrade Note:
      The "SAVE_GL_N" parameter in Accounting Scheme templates is no longer supported and is not processed in WAY4 (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Products\Issuing Private Products\Private Issuing Account Schemes - [Details] - "Special Parms" field). 
This means that if the "SAVE_GL_N" tag is set in a child Accounting Scheme, it is deleted from this scheme when the Accounting Scheme (parent or child) is approved. 
System default behaviour is now as follows: "GL Number" and "HeadOffice GL Number" are not copied from the Parent Scheme only when these fields are already filled in the Child Scheme. 
Therefore:
- when "GL Number" / "HeadOffice GL Number" are not filled in a Child Scheme, values are inherited from the Parent Scheme on first approval.
- when "GL Number" / "HeadOffice GL Number" change in a Child Scheme, the next time this scheme is approved, its own values are saved (not inherited from the Parent Scheme a second time).
- when "GL Number" / "HeadOffice GL Number" change in the Parent Scheme, values are not inherited by a Child Scheme.
- if the account template's "GL Number" / "HeadOffice GL Number" field is empty when reapproving a Child Scheme, values are inherited from the Parent Scheme.
WAY4 customer support provides a separate test script that should be run in a copy of the production system before starting the procedure for upgrading to the new version.
If the test script finds the "SAVE_GL_N" is used in system settings, contact Support for additional instructions.
      Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf]
  • 03.43.99.10
    • [CARDS-49144]
      • XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Issuing_Business_Prepared.rdf: default parameter values have been corrected for P_TRANS_FILTER, P_IS_TRANSFER_CREDIT_FLT, and P_IS_TRANSFER_DEBIT_FLT.
The procedure for synchronising parameter values has been corrected.
      Upgrade Note:
      Default values have been corrected for the following parameters of the XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Issuing_Business_Prepared.rdf report:  P_TRANS_FILTER, P_IS_TRANSFER_CREDIT_FLT, P_IS_TRANSFER_DEBIT_FLT.
Errors in the procedure for synchronising parameter values have also been corrected. Therefore, to synchronise parameter values, run the menu item "OpenWay\NSPK\NSPK. Reports\Report Parameters Configuration(NSPK Issuing)".
      Updated Manuals: [mir_statistical_reports\MIR_Statistical_Reports.pdf]
    • [CARDS-49206]
      • XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf: Default value of P_IS_TRANSFER_CREDIT_FLT, P_IS_CREDIT_FLT corrected.
P_IS_TRANSFER_FLT parameter deleted.
P_ATTR_TRN_IS_TRANSFER added.
Columns 4-7, 16-21 corrected.

TRN_IS_TRANSFER new statistic attribute added.
      Upgrade Note:
      To support the requirements of NSPK Operational bulletin #38.2015 of 29.12.2015 updated on 19.01.2016, it is necessary to do the following in the XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf report (per the task CARDS-48998)
1. Load statistic attributes from the configuration file or add the TRN_IS_TRANSFER statistic attribute manually in the OpenWay\Full\Statistics\Dictionaries\Statistic Attributes (custom) form.
2. If WAY4Cards version 03.43.30 is used, install the new version of the cust_stat_attr_value package. The support of this attribute is provided in standard system packages starting from version 03.44.30.
      Updated Manuals: [core\WAY4 Statistical Reports.pdf]
    • [CARDS-49298]
      • Processing of annual miscellaneous Service fees for contracts created at the end of the month (after the 28th day of the month) has been fixed. See Client Upgrade Notes for details.
      Upgrade Note:
      Changed the algorithm for calculating the date an annual miscellaneous Service fee is generated/charged. 
The error appeared in system settings: 
- recurring fee type ("Full/Configuration Setup/Transaction Types/Fee Types") has the parameter value Charge Event="Yearly". 
- Service in the Fee Day field contains a value other than -12, 0, 12, 
and only on the following conditions: 
- the number of days in the month in which the contract is registered is less than the number of days in the month in which the fee will be charged.
- the contract's opening date is later than the 28th day of the month. 

WAY4 Support provides separate test scripts that should be run on a copy of the production system before starting the procedure for upgrading to the new version. 
If the test script discovers the aforementioned settings in the system, contact Support for additional recommendations.

DB Kernel

  • 03.44.30.30
    • [DBK-2624]
      • "Upgrade the Online1 Node"  procedure now requires using Forced switch, as described in section "Emergency Mode" for HA-Switch Solution.
      Upgrade Note:
      Upgrade process for online nodes of a full HA-Switch solution has changed.
Please check HA-Switch Operation manual, section "Upgrading the Online1 Node", step 9.
      Updated Manuals: [ultimate_ha\ha_switch\HA_Switch_operation.pdf]
  • 03.44.19.26
    • [DBK-2235]
      • Upgrade Note:
      How to upgrade from 42.30 to 43.30:

1. Start upgrade on Primary/Prod.
2. Install upgrade on Primary/Prod.
3. Complete upgrade on Prod.
4. Make sure all transactions made on Secondary/StandIn are successfully synced to Primary/Prod.
5. Detach Secondary/StandIn.
6. Connect to DB Manager/WAY4 Manager on Primary/Prod using OWS Home 43.30.
7. Save information about the database link connection string into the database:
   1. Menu Item "OpenWay -> Synchronising Systems -> Configuration Setup -> System Instances", then click on the "Connections" button.
   2. Create a connection string row for every instance in Synchronising Systems. 
   3. By default this is a global database name. It can be replaced with an Oracle TNS connection string. For instance:
      (DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS_LIST =(ADDRESS = (PROTOCOL = TCP)(HOST = HATEST7)(PORT = 1521)))(CONNECT_DATA = (SID = db1)(SERVER = DEDICATED)))
8. Go back to DB Replication console.
9. Attach Secondary/StandIn.

Operation:

1. Use the menu item "Recreate database link" in DB Replication Console if it is necessary to change the database link password in the proper node.
2. Use DB Manager/WAY4 Manager in Prod and then the menu item "Recreate database link" in DB Replication Console if it is necessary to change the database link connection string.
    • [DBK-2284]
      • The data value of the "Suspended" process status in Process Log has been changed from "P" to "S".
      Upgrade Note:
      The value of the PROCESS_LOG.STATUS field has changed from "P" to "S" for the "Suspended" status.
This change must be taken into account in the "Process Log" custom form (menu item OpenWay\Full\Process Log\Process Log) or in custom queries to PROCESS_LOG, if any.

UFX Core

  • 2.2.13-0023
    • [UFX-359]
      • XML Applications Overall Response pipe behavior has been aligned with the manual: extension is padded with zeros to be exactly three digits long.
      Upgrade Note:
      XML Applications Overall Response pipe has changed the naming of output files. Now extension is padded with zeros to be exactly three digits long. Previously is was never padded. There is no way to restore previous behavior.
If there are automated processes consuming files written by XML Applications Overall Response pipe, please make sure that they can correctly handle files with new naming (with zero-padded extension).
  • 2.2.12-0022
    • [UFX-359]
      • XML Applications Overall Response pipe behavior has been aligned with the manual: extension is padded with zeros to be exactly three digits long.
      Upgrade Note:
      XML Applications Overall Response pipe has changed the naming of output files. Now extension is padded with zeros to be exactly three digits long. Previously is was never padded. There is no way to restore previous behavior.
If there are automated processes consuming files written by XML Applications Overall Response pipe, please make sure that they can correctly handle files with new naming (with zero-padded extension).
  • 2.2.11-0002
    • [UFX-313]
      • Tariff Import and Tariff Domains Import pipes have been changed to accept only tariffs with dates in the future by default.
      Upgrade Note:
      Tariff Import and Tariff Domains Import pipes have been changed to accept only tariffs with dates in the future by default. To allow loading of tariffs with dates in the past, additional configuration is needed. Contact support for details.
      Updated Manuals: Tariff Management | Tariff Data Export Import UFX
  • 2.2.10-0016
    • [I1604051762]/[UFX-305]
      • UFX backward compatibility transformation has been corrected: StmtItem/DocData/BankingDt element (added in format version 2.3.64) is no longer returned when UFX version specified in request is less than 2.3.64.
      Upgrade Note:
      If after upgrade the StmtItem/DocData/BankingDt element has disappeared from UFX response, please change UFX request version to 2.3.64 or newer.

AMEX interface

  • [CARDS-49723]

    • Statistical reports have been moved from the "AMEX GNS\AMEX. Reports\Statistics" menu to "AMEX Statistics Reports OBSOLETE".

  • [CARDS-52728]

    • Added grouping of totals by regions in the "BILLINGS & FEES" section of the XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Issuing_Business report.

    Updated Manuals: [amex_statistical_reports\AMEX_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [CARDS-53583]

    • Unnecessary grouping by MCC has been excluded for the "POS Terminal Statistics" and "ATM Statistics" sections of the XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Acquiring_Business report.

    Updated Manuals: [amex_statistical_reports\AMEX_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [I1610184582]/[CARDS-51116]

    • Added the "Response Details" field to the NMAS List IC.srd form.

  • [I1611219869]/[CARDS-51388]

    • "AMEX Statistics Issuing Business" default behaviour has changed. Now the report will group data by Internal Product Names, not by AMEX IPS Product names as before. To support this behaviour, a new parameter, P_ATTR_PS_ISS_INT_PRODUCT_NAME, has been added to the report (the default value is "PS_ISS_INT_PRODUCT_NAME"). Also, additional configuration is required and statistics gathering should be repeated for the required period to see the results in the new format. To keep the old behaviour, the P_ATTR_PS_ISS_INT_PRODUCT_NAME parameter should be set with an empty value. Please contact OpenWay Support for more details.

    Updated Manuals: [amex_statistical_reports\AMEX_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [CARDS-43882]

    • AMEX GNS Outward Processing: Fixed Chip Card (9240) ICC System Related Data field "Application PAN Sequence Number" filling. AMEX GNS Inward Processing: Fixed Chip Card (9240) ICC System Related Data fields "Application PAN Sequence Number", "Transaction Date", "Transaction Type" saving.

    • AMEX GNS Outward: Merchant Discount Rate processing.

  • [CARDS-50582]

    • AMEX GNS Inward: Fallback transaction processing is supported.

  • [CARDS-50944]

    • Fixed grouping by product name in the "AMEX Statistics Issuing Business" report.

  • [CARDS-50957]

    • Transactions for foreign devices are now shown in the "AMEX Statistics Issuing Business" report.

  • [CARDS-51293]

    • AMEX FSF Export: Fixed Approval Code field format checking.

  • [CARDS-51825]

    • AMEX FSF Export: Supported empty Approval Code and empty batches won't be exported now.

  • [CARDS-52860]

    • The "Account Balances" section in the "XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report has been corrected: - Corrected calculation of 'Credit Outstanding Balance Total' and 'Current Credit Outstanding Balance' amount when the P_MIRROR_OVD parameter value is 'Y'. - Changed row order to fit AMEX specification requirements. - Delinquency group's rows are shown with zero values if there are no corresponding data.

    • Merchant Management: Fixed processing of incomplete operations.

  • [CARDS-53211]

    • Date_Expire and Card_Expire contract dates are now considered in calculation of the "Account Balance" section of the "XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report.

    • AMEX DAF Import. Fixed totals checking.
