  • [CARDS-53990]

    • AMEX_Statistics_Acquiring report: format for new amount fields in the "Discount Business" section has been corrected.

  • [CARDS-54095]

    • AMEX GNS Demographics Processing: Removed checking rule that Merchant Id (Service Establishment Number) must be unique among Demographics messages.

  • [CARDS-54185]

    • AMEX GNS Inward: Fixed reject document fields filling.

  • [CARDS-54304]

    • AMEX GNS Inward: Fixed filling posting status for Reject File documents.

  • [CARDS-54321]

    • AMEX GNS Inward. Changed order of rejects processing in financial mode by changing the menu subitem in the menu item OpenWay\AMEX GNS\AMEX. Daily Procedures\AMEX. Inward Processing\AMEX GNS Inward Processing. Now personal rejects are processed before file reject.

  • [CARDS-54826]

    • Supported correct counting of reissued cards in the "AMEX Statistics Issuing Business (excel)" report. Reissued cards are now counted as one card.

  • [CARDS-54886]

    • AMEX GNS: Added a special member AEGN_DAF for settlement documents in the standard configuration.

    Updated Manuals: [amex_statistical_reports\AMEX_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [CARDS-55471]

    • Added a new parameter to the "XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" report: P_GROUP_CHANNELS, varchar2(255), the default value is " 'X','Y','x','y' ". The parameter is used for transaction filtering in the "Discount Business Summary" and "POS Billing Detail By Industry" sections.

    Updated Manuals: [amex_statistical_reports\AMEX_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [CARDS-56601]

    • Corrected the logic for checking contract groups for a case when an acquiring MEMBER_ID changed during the reporting period. Now transactions are split into two groups by MEMBER_ID. This may downgrade performance of statistics collecting.

  • [I1511057149]/[CARDS-47233]

    • AMEX Financial Submission File Export: Fixed TAB Record FIELD 22 POINT_OF_SERVICE_DATA_CODE POS. 7 Card Data Input Mode for e-commerce transactions.

  • [I1512104615]/[CARDS-46948]

    • AMEX GNS Inward Processing: Fixed "Settlement Amount is not specified" error for Retrieval Requests.

  • [I1601263803]/[CARDS-47605]

    • AMEX SE Demographics Export: Fixed Receiving Institution Identifier in Data Collection File Header (9844) and Data Collection File Trailer (9845).

  • [I1605197822]/[CARDS-49436]

    • AMEX/JCB Merchant Management: Changed Reason Code lists, displaying and processing.

  • [I1606296232]/[CARDS-49469]

    • AMEX GNS Inward/Outward: Chipcard Fallback transaction processing.

  • [I1608314406]/[CARDS-54562]

    • Enhanced calculation of VISA_MEMBER_ID, AMEX_MEMBER_ID, MC_MEMBER_ID statistical attributes in order to correct transactions fetching of certain IPS in XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf, XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Issuing_Business.rdf, XLS_Visa_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf, XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business.rdf, XLS_MC_Statistics_Issuing_Business.rdf, XLS_MC_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf reports.

  • [I1608314406]/[CARDS-54939]

    • Improved performance of XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Issuing_Business report.

  • [I1609159302]/[CARDS-50584]

    • DA v2: Now there is an oppotunity to configure on the activity level (for Retrieval Requests, Chargebacks, Representments, Final Chargebacks) a set of tags which should be added into doc.add_info field. For example, to provide Itemized Document Code for AMEX Representment a tag "ADD_TAG_X=REQ_IDC;" in Parm List field can be added on the activity "Create Representment (Acq)".

  • [I1610173078]/[CARDS-50879]

    • AMEX GNS Inward: FileID generation to prevent wrong file duplication error.

  • [I1705098865]/[CARDS-53158]

    • AMEX DAF Import. Fixed rare error due to checking unhandled messages.

  • [I1705098865]/[CARDS-53521]

    • AMEX DAF Import: Fixed filling counters in acknowledgement file.

  • [I1705170227]/[CARDS-53896]

    • New parameters have been added to the "XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" report: - P_ATTR_VALUE_ISONUS. The default value is "rpr.on_us_channel(cg.group_channel)" to customize the "is_on_us" flag. - P_CHAIN_TYPE_FILTER_1 and P_CHAIN_TYPE_FILTER_2 have been added for filtering transactions. The default value for P_CHAIN_TYPE_FILTER_1 is "trans.chain_type in ('U')"; for P_CHAIN_TYPE_FILTER_2 it is "1=2". - P_HIDE_REPOST. The default value is "Y". Used to hide reversal and repost operations. - P_FX_RATE. The default value is empty. - P_FX_DATE. The default value is empty. - P_FX_CURR. The default value is empty. New sections have been added to the "XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" report: - Discount Business Summary - POS Billing Detail By Industry

    Updated Manuals: [amex_statistical_reports\AMEX_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [I1705248633]/[CARDS-53731]

    • VISA Outward: "Merchant State/Province Code" field is filled with spaces for non US/CA Merchant Country transactions.

  • [I1710168639]/[CARDS-55173]

    • AMEX GNS Outward: Fixed calculation of "Message Number" field value - now suspended documents are not taken into account when calculating.

  • [I1801291030]/[CARDS-56617]

    • Now if the AMEX GNS Outward pipe parameter MERCHANT_FEE_CODE is specified but there are no special Merchant Fee tags in a document, the pipe exports this document as a document without Merchant Fee.

  • [CARDS-49718]

    • AMEX GNS Outward: Supported Zero Exponent for Uganda Shilling. Set pipe parameter EXT_CURR_EXP=8000.

    Updated Manuals: [ips_releases\AMEX\XXXX_XX_AMEX_Requirements.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49719]

    • AMEX Financial Submission File Export: Supported Zero Exponent for Uganda Shilling. Set pipe parameter EXT_CURR_EXP=8000.

    Updated Manuals: [ips_releases\AMEX\XXXX_XX_AMEX_Requirements.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52545]

    • Added the FILTER parameter (pipe:AMEX GNS Outward Processing.cpp).

  • [CARDS-53047]

    • Transaction Processing: Added checking of Service Code 701 as a chip code for AMEX.

  • [CARDS-53067]

    • AMEX GNS Inward Processing. Added Addendum Type Code to Message Code in Original Doc table to differentiate transactions with Deferred Payment Plan addendum.

  • [CARDS-53265]

    • AMEX GNS Inward. Supported empty chargeback gross settlement amount for certification.

  • [CARDS-54094]

    • AMEX GNS Demographics Export/Response Import: implemented a new response matching method with the "Transport Data" field. This method is now the default because Merchant Id (Service Establishment Number) used before as a matching key can be non-unique.

  • [CARDS-54115]

    • AMEX Inward/Outward (Release 17.2): Supported Icelandic Krona and Uganda Shilling Currency Decimalization Change by using database overrides. The additional global parameter AMEX_RELEASE must be set to 17.2.

    Updated Manuals: [ips_releases\AMEX\XXXX_XX_AMEX_Requirements.pdf]

  • [I1511020079]/[CARDS-49191]

    • AMEX: supported functionality to reverse outgoing AMEX GFSG files.

  • [ID901121006]/[CARDS-51526]

    • AMEX GNS Inward and Outward: Supported Contactless and Wallet transactions.

    ATM management

  • [CARDS-48754]

    • New state REPAIR can be switched on for not operating devices in "ATM Device Management" form to calculate correct operability metrics in ATM Statistics Analyser tool.

  • [CARDS-51865]

    • The correct value is passed in the TRN_PHASE21_V3 procedure DocTransAttr parameter.

  • [CARDS-57275]

    • Changed amout format in report ATM Dispense from NNNGNNNGNNNGNN0D00 to NNNGNNNGNNNGNN0DNN

    Accounting

  • [CARDS-40511]

    • Contract parameters (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Common Handbooks\Contract Parameters) can now have a new Value Type - Calculated Amount. Such a calculated parameter can be based on Main-Only Balance Types with the USAGE=BALANCE; BY_CURR; tags. The rules for calculation should be setup on the Product level using tags in the custom_data field. These calculated parameters can be used as Fee Base for different fee calculation and also as Base Amount Type in Service Limit tariffs.

  • [CARDS-50177]

    • For Fee Prediction tariffs to use FX conversion by channel rates from Fee Base, Fee Min, Fee Max to the account currency, a special CR-FX Type (FX Type=CR_<Buy>;<Sell>;<Middle>) should be used, and the tag CONV_CHANNEL should be defined in Service Details. The special CR-FX Type should be Internal (the field "Is Internal=Yes" in OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Accounting Setup\FX Types), even if there are no banking FX Schemes for it.

    Updated Manuals: [accounting\Currency_Conversion.pdf] [tags description]

  • [CARDS-50231]

    • A new option for adjustments with FX conversion posting has been added. In this new mode instead of posting the corrected amount, the difference between the original and corrected amount is posted. FX conversion is applied to the difference which allows big amount fluctuations to be avoided when FX rates change significantly. To implement this new mode, please contact OpenWay.

  • [CARDS-50605]

    • Implemented new procedures in the FX conversion module for calculating conversion rates.

  • [CARDS-50813]

    • For Fee Prediction tariffs to use FX conversion by channel rates from Fee Base, Fee Min, Fee Max to the account currency, a special CR-FX Type (FX Type=CR_<Buy>;<Sell>;<Middle>) should be used, and the tag CONV_CHANNEL should be defined in Service Details. The special CR-FX Type should be Internal (the field "Is Internal=Yes" in OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Accounting Setup\FX Types), even if there are no banking FX Schemes for it.

  • [CARDS-49732]

    • Full Payment Date calculation has been fixed for account schemes with DUE_DATE_MODE=A; or DUE_DATE_MODE=P; and zero balances on accounts involved in Due Date calculation.

  • [CARDS-49954]

    • Re-ageing is stopped as soon as the most delinquent bucket's balance exceeds the variance amount.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50296]

    • Fixed filling of account.on_date and on_date_balance fields for subcontracts during the MainSubRecovery process which runs on each contract billing if the global parameter MAIN_SUB_RECOVERY=Y (default behaviour).

  • [CARDS-52668]

    • Interest calculation has been enhanced for Interest Scheme -360 and interest calculation on the 31st day of the month.

  • [CARDS-52827]

    • Supported configuration of the "Cardholder_Account_Statement" and "Cardholder_Contract_Statement" reports using Date Schemes.

  • [CARDS-54687]

    • A check for empty macrotransaction currency has been added to API function api.PUT_MTR. If the currency is empty, a fatal error with the message 'Currency can not be empty' will be generated.

  • [CARDS-56432]

    • Added a new value "XF Entry" for the DDDW "Entry Type"

  • [CARDS-56433]

    • Supported the High Precision transfers in the "Full \ Documents Input & Update \ Doc - General Form \ All Docs \ [Srvc / Fees]" form.

  • [I1603050966]/[CARDS-48377]

    • Fixed problem with GL Entry being generated but not included in the GL Entries export file. This problem is rare and caused by incorrect GL configuration (empty HD GL Number in Interbranch account templates). Now the posting process will stop with a fatal error instead of generating incorrect GL Entries with empty debit GL account or credit GL account fields. For more details, see the "Upgrade notes on Impact changes" section.

  • [I1604208358]/[CARDS-49678]

    • Added macrotransaction cache reset on contract reprocessing error.

  • [I1608234331]/[CARDS-50038]

    • Fixed automatical GL renumeration triggering in case the contract's product is changed to the new one with different Tariff Domain containing Tariff Role = GL Numeration tariffs with new values.

    Updated Manuals: [accounting\WAY4_Accounting.pdf] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [I1703144988]/[CARDS-52447]

    • Modified generation of codes for Misc fees in the menu "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Generate Transaction Dictionary" when the global parameter FULL_TRANS_CODES=Y.

  • [I1704101944; I1704113625]/[CARDS-53090]

    • The menu "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Generate Message Dictionary" shows errors if TRANS_TYPE checks failed.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Common_References_Books.pdf]

  • [I1710242617]/[CARDS-55320]

    • Corrected behaviour of the global parameter TRIVIAL_GL_TRANSFER. For the default value of the additional global parameter TRIVIAL_GL_TRANSFER=N, GL_TRACE/GL_TRANSFER records are not created now when debit and credit accounts are equal. Accounts are equal when their account numbers, gl_numbers and account templates match. Previously only account numbers and account templates were compared.

    Updated Manuals: [accounting\WAY4_Accounting.pdf] [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

  • [I1711286506]/[CARDS-56011]

    • Added a new process that is started in the Process Log when the "Recalc Additional Balances" procedure (OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special Contract Utilities\Recalc Balances for Contracts -> Recalc Additional Balances) is executed.

  • [I1711290412]/[CARDS-55791]

    • Increased the number of digits (from 30 to 32) in the "Reference Number" field of the GL Transfer table to avoid uniqueness collisions.

  • [CARDS-50174]

    • Direct FX conversion rates are used first when converting by Channel Rates.

    Updated Manuals: [accounting\Currency_Conversion.pdf]

    Acquiring

  • [CARDS-50126]

    • New procedures START_DEV_OPER_V11 and END_DEV_OPER_V10 in ATM package have been added to enhance acquiring and issuing fee calculation.

  • [CARDS-49006]

    • MIR_PARTNER_ID can be set up in merchant or device contracts. A new form has been created: OpenWay/Authentication Module/Authentication for merchant.

  • [CARDS-49440]

    • An optional solution for merchant payment statement preparation has been created. The solution involves asynchronous filling of two interface tables, OPT_ACQ_PAYMENT and OPT_ACQ_PAYMENT_DATA, triggered by the posting of a merchant reimbursement (or merchant direct debit) standing payment order. Statement data can be extracted from these tables into WAY4 Datamart or another external system via dblink. If you are interested in this solution, please contact OpenWay for more details.

  • [CARDS-49628]

    • MIR_PARTNER_ID can be set up in merchant or device contracts. A new form has been created: OpenWay/Authentication Module/Authentication for merchant.

  • [CARDS-50035]

    • Additional links have been added to acquiring forms to browse contract hierarchy.

    Updated Manuals: [acquiring\user_manuals\Acquiring_Module.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50796]

    • The ability to override POS device type "Special Configuration" tags depending on transaction attributes has been implemented. A new button, "Overrides" has been added to Full/Configuration Setup/Merchant Device Setup/POS Types form. To activate this feature create a row in the OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Merchant Device Setup\Device Configurator Item Type form. Assign the Item Type Code value "DEV_TYPE_OVERRIDE" and select Item Type Category "Device Type Parameter".

  • [CARDS-51245]

    • Document tags CYCLE_CB (Credit Banknote), CYCLE_DC (Debit Coin), CYCLE_CC (Credit Coin), CYCLE_DB2 (for ATMs with 2 dispensers) have been supported to define the cycle code to group entries for batch repayment.

    Updated Manuals: [acquiring\user_manuals\Acquiring_Module.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51670]

    • Document tags CYCLE_CB (Credit Banknote), CYCLE_DC (Debit Coin), CYCLE_CC (Credit Coin), CYCLE_DB2 (for ATMs with 2 dispensers) have been supported to define the cycle code to group entries for batch repayment.

    Updated Manuals: [acquiring\user_manuals\Acquiring_Module.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52268]

    Updated Manuals: [help system - acquiring\main_lng.chm and issuing\main_lng.chm] [help system - acquiring\main_lng.chm and issuing\main_lng.chm]

  • [I1608315205]/[CARDS-50370]

    • New feature copy of ATM Retail Contracts from selected device to another one added to 'Device Contract' form.Press 'Action ...' button, select 'Copy ATM Retail' item then select target device and press 'Proceed' button.

  • [CARDS-48947]

    • For the menu "OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special OpenWay Utilities\FX Rates Import\External FX Rates Import", the history of record changes for the channel_currency table is supported.

  • [CARDS-48971]

    • XLS_CB_f250_2.rdf report: Default values have been corrected for the following report parameters: P_CAN_DISPENSE_CASH, P_CAN_RETAIL, P_CAN_ACCEPT_CASH, P_CAN_WORK_WO_CARD, P_IS_POS. The P_HAS_CARDREADER parameter has been deleted. New parameters P_IS_KIOSK and P_CAN_WORK_WITH_CARD have been added. Columns 4-9 and 11 have been corrected.

  • [CARDS-49247]

    • Fixed line alignment in "Merchant Standing Order Entry Details" report header.

  • [CARDS-49617]

  • [CARDS-49776]

  • [CARDS-50486]

  • [CARDS-50491]

    • Sorting by the ENTRY_DESCRIPTION and ENTRY_DETAILS fields for the "Entry" block in "Merchant Standing Order Entry Details", "Merchant Billing Level Standing Orders Details", "Merchant Standing Orders Details" reports has been added.

  • [CARDS-50923]

    • Default acquiring product configurations have been added to the standard configuration.

  • [CARDS-51378]

    • Documents, that are registered in the technical cycle "AllDocs", were excluded from the reports "Merchant Contract Statement", "Merchant Transactions Statement" and %TRANS_CST_CYCLE_N%, %TRANS_CST_CYCLE_CODE% variables used in notification.

  • [CARDS-51487]

    • For the "Merchant Contract Statement" report, parameter values (P_DATE_FROM; P_DATE_TO; P_ZIP_CODE; P_REPTYPE; P_SQL_TRACE; P_F_I; P_ID) can be set directly without local_constants. If these parameters are not set, values from local_constants will be used.

  • [CARDS-52023]

    • Typo in the "Device Configuration Item Type" form has been fixed.

  • [CARDS-55008]

    • Updated ATM Retail contract copy procedure ("Multiple" action button) to copy contracts only to devices belonging to the same category as the reference contract.

  • [CARDS-55139]

    • Fixed issue. A multi-currency pricing document is now declined if the conversion service is not allowed in the DCC contract or IPS contract.

  • [CARDS-55241]

    • Corrected display of adjustments in the "Merchant Contract Statement" report. Added the P_ENTRY_FILTER parameter with a default value like in the "Cardholder Contract Statement" report.

    Updated Manuals: [acquiring\user_manuals\Merchant_Statements.pdf]

  • [CARDS-55817]

    • Fixed an issue related to POS Terminal cycle reconciliation when the cycle counter was renewed.

  • [I1604180329]/[CARDS-48569]

    • If BATCH closes several times a day, the closing date is recorded once for this day.

  • [I1607273568]/[CARDS-49782]

    • Problem with posting acquirer documents using functionality of MC installments has been fixed.

  • [I1609130700]/[CARDS-50687]

    • Fixed incorrect format modifier processing for %DOC_TAG:...*<format>% variables.

  • [I1707104415]/[CARDS-54457]

    • Implemented the ability to set parameter P_DATE_FROM; P_DATE_TO; P_ZIP_CODE; P_REPTYPE; P_SQL_TRACE; P_F_I; P_ID values directly for the "Merchant Standing Orders Details" report. If these parameters are not set, values from local_constants will be used.

  • [I1708224441]/[CARDS-54464]

    • Implemented the ability to set parameter P_DATE_FROM; P_DATE_TO; P_ZIP_CODE; P_REPTYPE; P_SQL_TRACE; P_F_I; P_ID values directly for the "Merchant Billing Level Standing Orders Details" report. If these parameters are not set, values from local_constants will be used.

  • [I1801043828]/[CARDS-56349]

    • Corrected how the reversal entries of adjustment documents are shown in the "Merchant Statement Standing Order Entry Details" report when only the fee from adjustment is included in the statement. Fixed the optional ACQ_PAYMENT functionality which prepares data for external merchant statements.

    Acquiring authorisation

  • [CARDS-53899]

    • mVISA payments are supported. Merchants can receive mVISA payments for their accounts, issuer applications can read QR codes for payments and send transactions to a network.

  • [CARDS-53985]

    • Added support for mVISA QR Code generation.

  • [CARDS-54397]

    • Split Shipment functionality (for Card-Not-Present transactions) has been supported on DeviceH2H channel. Intended for use for merchants that ship purchases at different times and/or from different distribution centres after a single authorization for the whole amount.

  • [CARDS-49668]

    • A new API for searching contracts has been developed to standardize contract retrieval in the P2P package.

  • [CARDS-49764]

    • To allow acquiring finansial institution to search P2P clients data in another finansial institutions add P2P_PARTNER tag to the Special_Parms field of the head finansial institution of acquirer. The value of this tag should be the comma separated list of Branch_Code values of the head finansial institutions where acquirer can search.

  • [CARDS-49953]

    • A new API for searching contracts has been developed to standardize contract retrieval in the P2P package.

  • [CARDS-52559]

    • By default, the posting date after the cut-off time on a device is set to the next working day based on the default calendar. A new feature has been added to redefine the calendar type: the "ACQ_CLNDR_TYPE" parameter defines a special type of acquiring calendar (Full - Configuration Setup - Main Tables - Calendar Types). If the parameter "ACQ_CLNDR_TYPE" is not set, the default calendar will be used. This feature is available only if the "ENABLES_SHIFT_DAY" global parameter is set.

  • [CARDS-53267]

    • The ability to decline transactions in the second phase when CVV was not checked has been added. The CVC2R tag with the values 'N', 'P', 'U' or 'S' transferred from the controller implements this functionality. The global parameter CHECK_CVV_ON_ISS switches on this functionality. If the parameter is empty, these transactions are successful. If it contains an error number, this error is transferred to the controller and the document is rejected.

  • [CARDS-54214]

    • The acquiring processing procedure creates a new ACQ_NL tag in the doc add_info field if Card Stop List validation is passed successfully.

  • [CARDS-54432]

    • A new tag, "SEND_CHAIN_REV_ERR;", in device type configuration has been supported. This tag can be used to indicate an incorrect sequence of documents received from a merchant. If the "SEND_CHAIN_REV_ERR;" tag is specified in device_type and a Preauthorization Reversal is received after processing a Sales Completion, it will be rejected with Response Code 95.

  • [CARDS-55110]

    • Increased doc.ps_ref_number field length to 255 characters.

  • [CARDS-49635]

    • The global parameter "USE_PTID_IN_P2P" has been added to manage the PTID tag as a P2P money transfer indicator. If the parameter is set to "Y", the PTID tag is used to indicate a P2P money transfer transaction. The default value is "N".

  • [CARDS-49791]

    • The ACQ_ONLINE tag affects the entire document chain.

  • [CARDS-50577]

    • Processing transactions of our cards without using owncards.xml on TS/NS has been developed. Non-existent card from our BIN range is considered to be ours.

  • [CARDS-51883]

    • Supported P2P merchant initiated transactions (MIT).

  • [CARDS-52735]

    • Fixed an error with printing or displaying an incorrect final fee amount on transactions with the issuer's or acquirer's fees.

  • [CARDS-52871]

    • Fixed an error with matching recurring transactions

  • [CARDS-52899]

    • Optimized the query to select the main document for processing post authorization operations for P2P transactions.

  • [CARDS-53412]

    • ORA-01403: fixed no data found exception that occurred during MoneySend Reversal Request.

  • [CARDS-53741]

    • Error in P2P check operation has been fixed.

  • [CARDS-53948]

    • Fixed error in VISA OCT reversal document processing. Added a new check on VISA SMS channel when OCT reversal occurs. Previously, a check of the VISA SMS channel was not performed.

  • [CARDS-54139]

    • Multiple Capture mode checking for devices has been added.

  • [CARDS-55152]

    • Fixed error when macrotransactions were duplicated for acquiring documents. The error occurred when a "PostAuth" document was processed simultaneously with the posting procedure.

  • [CARDS-55511]

    • Corrected processing of financial online messages. They are now received without restriction by category.

  • [I1606288749]/[CARDS-50596]

    • Now in a partial reversal, field 4 contains the total amount authorised.

  • [I1609088862]/[CARDS-50497]

    • MATCH_REVERSE_ONLINE parameter limits the period from sales completion to the reversal transaction excluding the preauthorisation transaction.

  • [I1610170004]/[CARDS-50818]

    • TagValue length up to 4000 chars supported in sy_convert.MERGE_TAGXX procedures.

  • [I1610184194]/[CARDS-50727]

    • Problem with losing some data in input field 26 when core P2P is on has been fixed.

  • [I1702139241]/[CARDS-52045]

    • The error "Incoming TransCondition does not correspond to TransAttributes" is interpreted as a warning in acquiring.

  • [I1703076703]/[CARDS-52318]

    • Truncated address city field to 32 symbols when filling device parameters.

  • [I1703241228]/[CARDS-53397]

    • Fixed the error "Not a current doc" when sorting P2P documents.

  • [I1703276453]/[CARDS-52630]

    • Fixed an error which prevented posting of original and reversal transactions occurring in different batches.

  • [I1704041647]/[CARDS-52697]

    • Replaced incompatible Oracle JDBC driver library (used for Voice Authorisation) with WAY4 Cards bundled JDBC driver.

  • [I1704134961]/[CARDS-52826]

    • Downgraded transaction MasterCard attributes in a financial confirmation are inherited from the preauthorization document.

  • [I1705221109]/[CARDS-53488]

    • Fixed COMS_LOG parsing in database. Fixed error "ERROR in Buffer Packed Data. Field Request Failed. 3 4" occurring when parsing pay_gate messages (using the "Cr.Log Flds" button in the form opened with the menu item "Online Log Not Safe" OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special OpenWay Utilities\Emergency Reports\Online Log - Not Safe).

  • [I1706209234]/[CARDS-54014]

    • Corrected behaviour: now the DEV tag value will only affect PBT Status if defined on the Device Type override level.

  • [I1707026518]/[CARDS-54877]

    • Transaction Management: now POS Key Entry transactions are not treated as Card and Cardholder present transactions by default.

  • [I1707036602]/[CARDS-54874]

    • Added normalization for the CAT7 transaction condition attribute. Now by default, CAT7 transactions are treated as NO_AUTH transactions and CAT7 is treated as Unattended Terminal.

  • [I1708046078]/[CARDS-54637]

    • Updated ATM Retail contract copy procedure ("Multiple" action button) to copy ATM Retail links for both ATM and POS device categories.

  • [I1710116985]/[CARDS-55265]

    • Fixed macrotransactions duplication error in acquiring documents. The error occurs if a reversal document was processed simultaneously with the posting procedure.

  • [I1711241438]/[CARDS-55804]

    • Endless loop while iterating contracts tree has been fixed

  • [CARDS-51898]

    • Application dependent advanced routing (AID 84/4F based) is supported.

  • [CARDS-51159]

    • Support for incoming DEV/MPD/VPD/UPD/APD/JPD tags on TRN_PHASE1 has been added.

  • [CARDS-51456]

    • Merchant initiated transactions (MIT) have been aligned.

  • [CARDS-51852]

  • [CARDS-51892]

    • Voice Authorization Screen application is compatible with Oracle 12c.

    • Voice Authorization Screen is functional.

    • New tag ORIG_ISS_AMNT_R containing original settlement amount has been added to reversal DOC.ADD_INFO.

    Application management

  • [CARDS-50524]

    • Advanced Applications R2 supports now applications to create instalments by transaction or contract balance. These applications can be loaded from files, Way4Gate, Web Services and are available in monitoring forms in the OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2 menu.

    Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_R2_Module.pdf]

  • [UFX-293]

    • XML Applications Import R2 pipe now supports applications for instalment management.

    Updated Manuals: Application Managment | XML Applications R2 Application Managment | xml_appl_schema.chm

  • [CARDS-49075]

    • In Advanced Applications R2, application accept is downgraded to approve in secondary nodes.

    Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_Workflow.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49328]

    • The "Insert more" button has been added to the Adv.Appl Instl Limit form.

    Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_R2_Module.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50141]

    • Supported an option to return a newly created PAN for a Card Update application in the XML Applications Response, XML Applications Overall Response and online UFX interfaces. Added a new global parameter APPL_NEW_CARD_IN_RESPONSE. When the parameter value is "Y", Application/DataRs/ContractRs for a Card Update application contains information about the newly created contract including the new PAN. The default value is "N" -- the old behaviour with the old PAN in the response.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50350]

    • Advanced Applications R2 supports setting contract Instalment Limits with an activity period.

    Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_R2_Module.pdf] [application_management\r2\CBS_XML_Applications_R2.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50703]

    • Advanced Applications R2 supports now applications to close or update instalment plans, to order early repayment or payment holidays for plans. These applications can be loaded from files, Way4Gate, Web Services and are available in monitoring forms in the OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2 menu.

    Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_R2_Module.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50713]

    • A new button "Accept" has been added to "OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Cardholder Input & Update by Applications", "OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Merchant Input & Update by Applications", "OpenWay\SEPA\Mandate Input & Update" to allow a single application to be accepted.

    Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_R2_Module.pdf] [sepa_interface\SEPA_Interface_operation.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50994]

    • "Social Security #" for clients is supported now in Advanced Application R2 forms.

    Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_R2_Module.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51311]

    • Advanced Application R2 Accept has been adopted for Distributed Processing.

    Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_R2_Module.pdf] [application_management\r2\CBS_XML_Applications_R2.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51887]

    • Supported creation of COMBO_Cards by applications.

  • [CARDS-52342]

    • In Advanced Applications R2, application accept has been downgraded to approve in secondary nodes for NoWorkflow mode if such behaviour is not refused by the global parameter APPL_NON_SAFE_ON_SECONDARY=DECLINE.

    Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_R2_Module.pdf] [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52698]

    • "Device Parm Ctrl" and "Merchant Management" additional info types are now supported in Advanced Applications R2 for contract additional information.

  • [CARDS-53817]

    • Advanced Applications R2 can skip Product status verification during contract application approval if the new global parameter APPL_ALLOW_NOT_READY is set to "Y". Application accept will check this status anyway.

    Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_R2_Module.pdf] [application_management\r2\CBS_XML_Applications_R2.pdf] [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

  • [CARDS-54361]

    • "OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Setup\Appl Type" now allows the TARIFF_CODE_EXT tag to be used in Tariff sections for setting a tariff code.

    Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_Workflow.pdf]

  • [CARDS-54362]

    • The "Custom Parms" new button has been added to the "Contract Preferred" form (OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Cardholder Input & Update by Applications) to pack/unpack the "Custom Parms" tagged field. A section with the "Preferred" object type is supported for applications created manually according to the application types.

    Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_R2_Module.pdf] [application_management\r2\Advanced_Applications_Workflow.pdf]

  • [UFX-225]

    • Added Application/ApplicationSource that sets the code of the component/system from which the application originated. Application/ApplicationSource will be present in a UFX response only when UFXMsg/@version is greater than or equal to 2.3.71. XML Application Response, XML Application Overall Response and XML Adv Application Export pipes now have the UFX_VERSION parameter that can be used to put Application/ApplicationSource into a UFX export/response file.

    Updated Manuals: Application Managment | XML Applications R2 Application Managment | xml_appl_schema.chm

  • [UFX-296]

    • Advanced Applications R2 now supports loading of the "Used As MK" field, which indicates whether the key is the master key.

  • [UFX-306]

    • XML Application Response and XML Application Overall Response pipes now support card applet export.

    Updated Manuals: Application Managment | XML Applications R2

  • [UFX-312]

    • Now RegNumber field for applications is limited to 64 characters. Message format error occures instead of General error in case of invalid value.

    Updated Manuals: Application Managment | xml_appl_schema.chm

  • [UFX-502]

    • Supported Preferred fields TimeInterval, WeekDays, WorkDay for Application and Contract Information requests.

  • [I1602165295]/[CARDS-49059]

    • Deadlock during Advanced Application R2 accepting doesn't change application workflow stage.

  • [CARDS-49221]

    • Deferred response file for unsuccessful application in Advanced Applications R2 always contains the original error message.

  • [CARDS-49348]

    • A deferred response file for an unsuccessful application in Advanced Applications R2 always contains the original error message even when it's from custom processing.

  • [CARDS-49370]

    • When an Advanced Application R2 application to set a credit limit contains a comment that is more than 255 characters, the corresponding message will be returned instead of 'Internal error'.

    Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\CBS_XML_Applications_R2.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49374]

    • PAN in response file for advanced application is masked.

  • [CARDS-49575]

    • Advanced Application R2: error message from custom procesdure cust_adv_exception_handler is returned as application response.

  • [CARDS-49670]

    • Adv Applications R2 declined due to not unique registration number are ignored during application search by registration number and its uniqueness check.

  • [CARDS-49951]

    • Link "Classifier" on application form links to the form with filtered list of classifiers depending on the selected Object type=Contract Classifier/Client Classifier.

  • [CARDS-50077]

    • A new Product tag, STOCK; has been introduced. This tag should be set in the Custom Data field of Products used to register large numbers of stock "Instant Issuing" cards within the same hierarchy. This tag disables refresh of data in a contract hierarchy during contract approval, so the tag may not be set in issuing or acquiring products used for ordinary customer contracts. Use of this tag makes it possible to avoid performance problems seen in Applications inward interfaces (batch or SOA) when an Instant Issuing card is sold to a customer as the contract approval process is always called during application processing.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [tags description] [product_management\Preferred_Counterparties.pdf] [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf] [product_management\Standing_Orders.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50326]

    • Fixed the context of the "CAppInfo" input parameter for CUST_ADV_CHECK_APPL_INFO.

  • [CARDS-50544]

    • Advanced Application R2: the problem when XML applications with missing mandatory elements in sub-applications were successfully accepted has been fixed. The problem could be observed when using OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Application Processing\Issuing XML Application Import or OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Application Processing\Acquiring XML Application Import pipes or in WAY4Gate.

  • [CARDS-50553]

    • RBS number inheritance for liability contracts has been removed in Advanced Applications R2.

  • [CARDS-50835]

    • Advanced Applications R2 now fills contract product defined by codes in an XML application so the application is shown correctly in monitoring forms.

  • [CARDS-51093]

    • The problem with empty AMND_PREV fields in new device records created by Advanced Applications has been resolved.

  • [CARDS-51257]

    • Advanced applications for contract update now call the contract approve process if the contract was changed even if the last sub-application in the tree is for contract status update and no changes were made to contract status.

  • [CARDS-51364]

    • The APPROVAL_STAGE parameter has been removed from menu items for launching Advanced Applications R2 pipes. This parameter had no effect and was unused.

    Updated Manuals: [application_management\r2\CBS_XML_Applications_R2.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51429]

    • Unhandled exception when an XML advanced application for a client doesn't have a client identifier has been changed to return an error message.

  • [CARDS-52774]

    • Client AddOrUpdate Application R2 checks the existence of a client in accordance with the additional global parameters UNIQUENESS_CLIENT_NUMBER and UNIQUENESS_CLIENT_REG_NUMBER.

  • [CARDS-54005]

    • Fixed issue: now an empty record in the Contract/Client Extra Info application section is not processed and doesn't cause an error if this section is defined as Not Mandatory.

  • [CARDS-54341]

    • Changed how the "RBS Number" and "MemberID" fields are filled in Advanced Application R2 for contract modification. Field values are now inherited from the parent contract if they are empty.

  • [CARDS-55711]

    • Added the possibility to create ContractAddInfo or ClientAddInfo application section with the ActionType defined in the application type.

  • [CARDS-56644]

    • Improved the ClientAdditionalInfo and ContractAdditionalInfo applications in the Advanced Applications R2 module. Now tags in the "AddInfoXX" fields can be processed separately.

  • [UFX-298]

    • XML Applications R2 pipes can now import and export Threshold tariffs.

  • [UFX-338]

    • The length of Application/Data/Address/PhoneList/Phone/PhoneNumber now is 32 chars.

  • [UFX-359]

    • XML Applications Overall Response pipe behavior has been aligned with the manual: extension is padded with zeros to be exactly three digits long.

  • [UFX-407]

    • Fixed length of Application RegNumber and OrigAppNumber in UFX schema. They now have the same maximum length of 64 characters.

  • [I1608300685]/[CARDS-50093]

    • Advanced Application R1 supports special *#N symbols in the <PlasticInfoTitle> tag to clear this field in a client or contract record.

  • [I1609290484]/[UFX-343]

    • UFX XML Application Response pipe now writes response file correctly after rename file exception.

  • [I1610184150]/[CARDS-50827]

    • Advanced Applications R2 for ClientAddress or ClientAuthMethod now support client identification through <ObjectFor><ContractIDT> format as in R1 applications. But this format for client identification is not correct and a warning message will be saved in process_mess.

  • [I1610275964]/[CARDS-51126]

    • Advanced Application R1 can be succesfully accepted even if it's blocked by the same officer who starts the accept process.

  • [I1611018583]/[CARDS-51190]

    • Exception handling has been added into usage limiter redefinition procedure

  • [I1703249728]/[CARDS-52849]

    • Resolved issue with missing base relation for a new non-product based related contract during accept of an advanced application R2.

  • [I1704247540]/[UFX-401]

    • Fixed processing of special *#N value for clearing the client base address fields in UFX Applications.

  • [I1707259086]/[UFX-424]

    • Fixed an issue that could lead to removal of the "Last Name" field instead of the "Company Name" field while importing advanced application R2.

    Authentication management

  • [CARDS-49254]

    • Support for merchant token management has been added.

  • [CARDS-50002]

    • 3DS support package errors are now compliant with PA DSS rules.

  • [CARDS-51372]

    • Allow the "SINGLE" option for identification schemes.

  • [CARDS-51427]

    • Allow the "SINGLE" option for identification schemes.

  • [CARDS-53422]

    • Authentication domain option added: ACCESS_LOG=N to suppress unwanted process log messages on authentication result. NB: audit log records will be present anyway.

  • [CARDS-50668]

    • Fixed: System cannot find 'TERMINAL' authentication scheme.

  • [CARDS-51299]

    • TAGS_GET_NODE procedure not updating CLIENT/CONSUMER references during UID resolving process.

  • [CARDS-51780]

    • Fixed incorrect processing of long values for parameters of the procedure used by Authentication Server when the High Availability solution is not used.

  • [CARDS-52093]

    • Fixed "Failed to calculate DP routing, use default routing" warning for Authentication Server Context operations.

  • [CARDS-52154]

    • User must change password if it was reset by admin and parameter DEF_PW_CHANGE is set to Y.

  • [CARDS-52915]

    • The "OFFICER" scope has been added to validation conditions for an authentication scheme linked to a consumer record.

  • [CARDS-53936]

    • Authentication services domain parameters are now read through the cache now to avoid performance issues.

  • [CARDS-54512]

    • Fixed error in processing of prefix "##" for authentication method parameter pattern which can lead to empty result value.

  • [CARDS-54619]

    • Fixed error which can lead to "ORA-06502: PL/SQL: numeric or value error: NULL index table key value" exception in authentication message processing.

  • [I1610259005]/[CARDS-50820]

    • High Availability deferred apply can now process authentications log.

    Automated routines

  • [I1601131604]/[CARDS-49775]

    • Now the menu item "OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special OpenWay Utilities\FX Rates Import\RBS FX Rates Copy To Internal" shows an error at the end of the process if some rates were not found and errors are saved to the process log.

    Updated Manuals: [accounting\Currency_Conversion.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49298]

    • Processing of annual miscellaneous Service fees for contracts created at the end of the month (after the 28th day of the month) has been fixed. See Client Upgrade Notes for details.

  • [CARDS-50755]

    • FX rates activation has been added for Set Time Zone Banking Date (2-phased).

  • [CARDS-51057]

    • Fixed unstable execution plan for searching for a previous document in Accept Documents.

  • [CARDS-55142]

    • Fixed the error message ORA-06502 "Numeric or value error: character string buffer too small" for ageing account templates, when the "Template Details" field contains more than 255 symbols.

  • [I1608183148]/[CARDS-49933]

    • Fixed Start of the day procedure problem during date shifting where multiple Time zones are configured in the system

  • [I1610075561]/[CARDS-50595]

    • Fixed grants for 'OWS.Apply Buffered Balance' menu item

  • [I1702225223]/[CARDS-52304]

    • The Approve procedure can be be called for sub-products. If the main product is not ready, Approve will be executed for the entire hierarchy; if the main product is ready, only the sub-product will be approved. A new form has been added, OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Products\Product Definition\Products (No Hierarchy), for viewing all products without hierarchy.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf]

    Bill payments

  • [CARDS-51119]

    • Added support for loading billers and payment types from external systems to WAY4.

  • [CARDS-51850]

    • It is now possible to clear the ServiceComment and License fields of a PaymentType using mBilling request.

  • [CARDS-52015]

    • Biller Management: ATM Retail contracts are now created with consideration of the requested channel.

  • [CARDS-53696]

    • Supported OTP_SMS templates per CP service.

  • [CARDS-52492]

    • Corrected visibility of payment type properties. Payment type properties created via mBilling request are now visible.

  • [I1712227712]/[CARDS-56335]

    • Added creation of a historical record in sy_handbook table when IssFeeCode is updated with a ProvidePaymentReceiverDetailsRequest.

    CB Gate

  • [CARDS-48459]

    • The LOG_FILE_NAME parameter has been added for the cb_gate_balance_load pipe. Possible values are Y/N. If LOG_FILE_NAME=Y, the "FILE=<FileName>;" tag will will be added to TD_Doc.posting_details.

  • [CARDS-50561]

    • The STIP balance loading procedure has been improved by checking the fact of sending (and delivering) an operation to the CBS and matching it with information from the loading file. Added the ability to use last operation time instead of last operation reference number in STIP balance data files.

  • [CARDS-50891]

    • The STIP balance loading procedure has been improved by checking the fact of sending (and delivering) an operation to the CBS and matching it with information from the loading file. Added the ability to use last operation time instead of last operation reference number in STIP balance data files.

  • [CARDS-50885]

    • The SUPPRESS_NEGATIVE_ADVICE; tag should be added to the "Domain Data" field of the "OpenWay\CB Gate\Configuration\Domains" form to suppress IRouter sending negative advices to the core banking system.

  • [CARDS-51067]

    • Corrected processing of timeout on core banking system when special rule in "OpenWay\CB Gate\Configuration\Routing Rules" for current mesage is not defined

  • [CARDS-51676]

    • Utility Payment message routing to bank system rule selection algorithm has been corrected.

  • [CARDS-51859]

    • Fixed reversal message routing to core banking system for utility payments.

  • [CARDS-52762]

    • Fixed BerTLV buffers parsing in Application Interface.

  • [CARDS-52821]

    • Fixed incorrect document posting status when the fee is waived by the CBS.

  • [CARDS-53154]

    • Corrected issue in sending reversals to the CBS by IRouter.

  • [CARDS-55279]

    • Corrected the algorithm for determining the need to redirect an advice message to the core banking system when its processing finished with rejection.

  • [I1705099074]/[CARDS-53246]

    • Fixed incorrect processing of CBGate balance loading when the last transaction linked to the balance was delivered to CBS by SAF.

  • [I1706274643]/[CARDS-53891]

    • Fixed balance update algorithm to not update a balance if the account is closed.

  • [I1711090861]/[CARDS-56412]

    • Fixed exception "com.openwaygroup.pkgj.cliint.IStnd is undefined in the context" in cb_gate_balance_load pipe.

  • [I1803204099]/[CARDS-57166]

    • Corrected inability to run cb_gate_balance_load by clerk with password which contains xml-forbidden characters

  • [CARDS-53597]

    • Added a default value (1000) for the commit_interval parameter of the cb_gate_balance_load pipe.

    Updated Manuals: [core_banking_interface\cb_gate\CB_Gate_Setup.pdf]

    Case management

  • [CARDS-45602]

    • Formatting styles have been applied for all case management substitution variables using in case mangement messages and letters.

    Updated Manuals: [case_management\Case_Management_Configuration.pdf]

  • [CARDS-45703]

    • "ROOT.OpenWay.Case Management.Configuration Setup.General Configuration.Activity Groups" has been extended by new links: "Activities In Group" which shows all Step Activities from the group, and "Not Grouped Activities" to show all not grouped Step Activities by the domain category.

    Updated Manuals: [case_management\Case_Management_Configuration.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49406]

    • A new restriction is supported for Case Management activities for many objects: the number of objects may not be more than 100.

  • [CARDS-49452]

    • Product Inspector test step "Case Management: Set User" is extended: now it allows to create Case Management User if it doesn't exists in the current domain.

    Updated Manuals: [product_inspector\WAY4_Product_Inspector_Manual.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49949]

    • Case Management activity processing has been improved to prevent duplicate activities performed by rules.

  • [CARDS-50030]

    • Case Management users which are not connected with any client record can be exported as system configuration from one scheme to another.

  • [CARDS-50245]

    • 1. The "Dispute Assistant CM" menu has been renamed to "CM Dispute Assistant". 2. The "Financial Cases" sub menu has been added to the ROOT.OpenWay.CM Dispute Assistant menu item as a link to ROOT.OpenWay.CM Risk Management. 3. All operation items ("CM Dispute Assistant", "CM Card Blocking", "CM Consumer Collections", "CM Risk Management") have been moved to the end of the OpenWay menu.

  • [CARDS-50361]

    • Case Management activity reason selection in "New Activity" screen populates the whole activity reason tree. It's enough to configurate only main reason for the activity, all sub-reasons will be available for it during the activity processing.

  • [CARDS-50518]

    • In Case Management it is now possible to send a case to a supervisor and set the supervisor as the case owner in one activity. The same ability is available for returning the case from the supervisor to the previous owner after review.

    Updated Manuals: [case_management\Case_Management_Configuration.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50525]

    • Case Management operation screens support "Capture Case" activity just from Supervisor Worklists.

  • [CARDS-50715]

    • The Case Management activity "Create sub case" stores an activity comment as a new case description.

    Updated Manuals: [case_management\Case_Management_Configuration.pdf]

  • [CARDS-56169]

    • Excluded use of a bank account contract as a case contract when a new case for a document is created in a domain with the "Acquiring" category.

  • [I1411073978]/[CARDS-50000]

    • Case Management Strategy/Step activity configuration screen - ROOT.OpenWay.Case Management.Configuration Setup.Domain Configuration.Strategy Schemes - is extended by a new field "Parm List". Activity processing will merge parameters from this field with the original activity parameters from "ROOT.OpenWay.Case Management.Configuration Setup.Domain Configuration.Activities" and process them all together. This makes it possible to set some general activity parameters on the CM Activity level and create some step activities with different parameters - additional or overwritten.

    Updated Manuals: [case_management\Case_Management_Configuration.pdf]

  • [I1609227206]/[CARDS-50869]

    • A new activity parameter INHERIT_REASON; allows the reason of a sub-case that has been moved to be changed to a new one corresponding to the new parent case.

    Updated Manuals: [case_management\Case_Management_Configuration.pdf]

  • [I1610118287]/[CARDS-50762]

    • Financial and disputes case screens in Case Management have been improved by the links to additional case transactions information.

  • [CARDS-49151]

    • Repeated editing of documents created during a dispute cycle is now possible in Case Management dispute screens.

  • [CARDS-49212]

    • Problem with case status when a group activity wasn't successful for some cases has been resolved.

  • [CARDS-49805]

    • Problem with "Last Work" date for a case when a group activity wasn't successful for some cases has been resolved.

  • [CARDS-50167]

    • Case Management group activities keep the officer who performed the activity for failed case activities.

  • [CARDS-50269]

    • Changes in User Management for Case Management: only active users can be assigned to the case and perform any acitivity.

    Updated Manuals: [case_management\Case_Management_Configuration.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50973]

    • If a Case Management domain contains the USE_CURRENT_USER='Y' parameter, but the current officer is not registered as a domain user, the case owner will be determined automatically.

    Updated Manuals: [case_management\Case_Management_Configuration.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52540]

    • The activity to move an object from one case to another has been extended to work with case files. A new object role, "File" ("F") has been added to the system's standard configuration for all domain categories (OpenWay/Case Management/OpenWay Settings/Case Object Roles).

    Updated Manuals: [case_management\Case_Management_Configuration.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52556]

    • The Case Management activity "Create sub case" also stores an activity comment as a new case description when an application sub-case is created.

  • [CARDS-52729]

    • Issue when a document was not added to an existing Financial case for the same contract has been fixed.

  • [CARDS-53794]

    • It is no longer necessary to register the "Case Management" menu for the clerk user group to allow clerk users to perform an activity in "Dispute Assistant CM" and other Case Management operation screens.

  • [CARDS-54043]

    • Changed how the activity checks user competence. For dispute cases, an activity for which a document is not specified checks user competence against the maximum absolute amount among the active financial documents attached to the case, not against the summary of document amounts as for financial cases. This amount is calculated by the entries for the case contract accounts, not for the document target contract.

    Updated Manuals: [case_management\Case_Management_Configuration.pdf]

  • [I1605272744]/[CARDS-49346]

    • Problem with CommStr has been resolved, activity comments are limited to 4000 characters.

  • [I1609198831]/[CARDS-51029]

    • The amnd-history record was not created when the document was released for housekeeping

  • [I1610119034]/[CARDS-50735]

    • Trace stack overflow in CM document processing has been fixed for DEBUG_LEVEL=TRACE.

  • [I1610314143]/[CARDS-52065]

    • Optimized "Contract" tab performance in the Case Details screen.

  • [I1707171415]/[CARDS-54190]

    • Resolved issue with empty case status when two "New Activity" windows are opened and processed.

  • [I1709019529]/[CARDS-54579]

    • Fixed trace messages processing issue in Case Management.

  • [I1712183916]/[CARDS-56115]

    • Changed sub-case creation when moving a document from one financial case to another. Now it calls the activity to create a new sub-case for the document for the target case if there is no such sub-case for the source case. Otherwise, the sub-case will be re-subordinated for the target case.

    Changes export

  • [UFX-317]

    • AmndInfo/AmndDate UFX element now contains date with time. Old behavior can be restored if needed, contact support for details.

  • [I1611170980]/[UFX-339]

    • Changes Export pipe now correctly creates output files when CREATE_EMPTY_FILES parameters is set to "N".

    Configuration inspector

  • [DBK-2424]

    • Fixed importing records with default column values. Buffered messages mode is used for the import process to preserve the import log in the case of a fatal exception.

  • [DBK-2429]

    • Fixed long value trimming on configuration export.

  • [DBK-2461]

    • Added the ability to transfer Sy. Configuration mapping for Datamart dimension tables.

  • [DBK-2650]

    • Import of merged data has been optimized. A record is updated in a single expression, not by one field at a time. For unchanged parent records, "Is Ready" status update is done once when loading subordinate records.

  • [DBK-2785]

    • Corrected merging of MP_ETL_PARM table records using Configuration Inspector.

  • [DBK-3131]

    • Excluded personal tariffs from Configuration Inspector export in ALL and ALL_BY_DATE modes. Personal tariffs are already skipped if collected as child objects of tariff domains.

  • [DBK-3132]

    • Skipped INSTITUTION parameter value and no error is shown during export of Datamart configuration by Configuration Inspector

  • [DBK-3569]

    • Optimized standard data creation during configuration export.

  • [I1702039456]/[DBK-2558]

    • Fixed error during export of FX Scheme configuration by Configuration Inspector.

    Consumer debt collections

  • [CARDS-50537]

    • CM Consumer Collections menu in Way4Managet has been extended by new items: "Operations.Supervisor Worklist.Waiting Cases" and "Operations.All Issuing Contracts". Menu "Operations.My WorklistOpen Cases for User Group" has been removed to "Operations.Team Worklist.Team Open Cases".

  • [CARDS-50526]

    • The action list on "New Activity" and "Promises" tabs for the closed case are synchronized.

  • [CARDS-51085]

    • When the collection case closed automatically all open promise-to-pay are canceled without current officer checking.

    Core

  • [CARDS-49256]

    • Product Tariff Campaigns have been implemented.

    Updated Manuals: Loyalty | Tariff Campaign

  • [CARDS-49257]

    • The tariff domain contract parameter is checked after the Product has been changed.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49783]

    • Several IF_CS and IF_PARM checks has been implemented.

    Updated Manuals: Core | Collect Doc Statistics [product_management\Events.pdf] [product_management\Preferred_Counterparties.pdf] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf] [product_management\Standing_Orders.pdf] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-40111]

    • The BASE_DATE tag can be used in balance types with the SERV_TURNOVER usage limiter and History Mode = Yearly.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Balance_types.pdf] [tags description]

  • [CARDS-44735]

    • Custom fee interbranch routing is supported. A fee can only be routed to a financial institution used in the main transaction interbranch route.To turn on fee interbranch routing, set the FEE_INTERBRANCH tag in the fee Service. This setup allows FEE_CONTRACT=DOC_TARGET; to be used safely in custom fee Services when the device and card are in different institutions.

  • [CARDS-45551]

    • The ability to post Event chains in a user-defined order has been added. A new field, "Step N" should be filled in for the Events in the chain to specify their posting order. A new event posting mode, DEPENDENT_CHAIN has been introduced to provide proper condition checking for cases when an Event depends on the results of previous Events in the chain.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Events.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49028]

    • Fixed issue with account representation for fields DR_ANALYTIC/CR_ANALYTIC in GL_MACRO view after the account number was updated in the Items table.

  • [CARDS-49139]

    • Added checking workstation number when sending a Stop List request

    Updated Manuals: [risk_management\stop_list.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49261]

    • Automatic creation of classifier values has been implemented for new Tariff Plan approval in a Tariff Book (for contract parameters with location in Classifier or with Mirror To the classifier configuration).

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49405]

    • Reports have been updated. Now each time a report is executed, the name will be logged in process log parameters in the REPORT tag, and the menu item name will be logged in the TITLE tag.

  • [CARDS-49418]

    • Performance of interest calculation for end of month has been improved.

  • [CARDS-49504]

    • Now "COUNTER_ONLY balances" are not shown in the "Balances for..." form. A new form, "Counters", has been added to show "COUNTER_ONLY balances". The "Entry N" field has been replaced by "Trx count" in the "Totals for..." form.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Balance_types.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49531]

    • "BT_SIMPLE" mode processing has changed: Current Due Min Amount Threshold, configured as specified in the Statement Tariff or Account Scheme Min Repayment value, and Full Statement Balance Threshold, configured as a new Threshold tariff with the predefined code "MTP_FULL_BALANCE", have been introduced.

  • [CARDS-49597]

    • Classifier validation has been enhanced: Standard classifier values are refilled on validation. An additional check is made that the Standard classifier has the corresponding Role configuration.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Contract_and_Client_Classifiers.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49845]

    • A luhn digit is no longer generated for accounts and devices for the "random" numeration type. To restore the old behaviour, use the global parameter GENERATE_LUHN=Y.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50023]

    • Standard calculation of statistic attributes has been moved from cust_stat_attr_value() to the STAT.STAT_ATTR_VALUE() package. See the "Upgrade Notes on Impact Changes" section for more details.

  • [CARDS-50037]

    • Additional trace messages for standing order check have been added.

  • [CARDS-50122]

    • Order by clause is added into the select for quering the contracts for the reserving functionality.

  • [CARDS-50140]

    • The additional global parameter APPROVE_IMMEDIATE is set to N (No) in the standard configuration for new installations. The default value is still Y (Yes), so there is no impact on current installations.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50189]

    • Custom fee with SAVE_FEE tag creates tags into the Document even if the calculated amount equals zero. SAVE_TFEE tag does not generate tags only in case when the custom fee does not pass the service details check.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50190]

    • A new trace message "<CALC> fee is skipped" was added for <CALC> custom fees replacing the "Not allowed custom fee" message

  • [CARDS-50194]

    • If Counterparty for "Standing Order with Payment Type" is not found under the contract, the system will try to find it under the client.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Standing_Orders.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50322]

    • GL traces with a date in the past are not written to the exception table that can be viewed in OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special OpenWay Utilities\GL\GL Trace Exceptions if the "Close GL" process has not been launched.

  • [CARDS-50336]

    • Additional validation for the Payment Priority field of an account has been introduced. If the account is used as the Upper / Lower limit template for normalization, the value in the Payment Priority field cannot be set to "0".

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50341]

    • Trace messages added to the fx conversion module (possibility to view which FX rate is used and what FX type)

  • [CARDS-50451]

    • Added "Quarterly" value option in "Charge Event" list box under Fee Types

    Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50483]

    • Warning message that "Payment receiver is not found for client and payment type" during order document processing is created only for SEPA documents.

  • [CARDS-50535]

    • Local Russian numeric format is now set before report execution for the "NSPK Statistics Acquiring Business", "NSPK Statistics Acquiring Devices", "NSPK Statistics Issuing Business Prepared" reports.

  • [CARDS-50639]

    • For name generation by the menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Generate Transaction Dictionary" added the CUST_TRANS_DICT() procedure to customise generation of names in MESS_DICT.

  • [CARDS-50665]

    • Additional input parameters have been added to the CUST_TRANS_CODE custom procedure. These parameters allow more precise customization of transaction codes. A transaction code generated by the custom function is not altered anymore with additions in standard code. The resulting transaction code is used in the macrotransaction and GL Trace. Entry record transaction codes can be synchronised with GL Trace records if the SYNC_ENTRY_GL_TRANS_CODE global parameter is set to "Y". For using standard transaction codes, the function should return null value. Different transaction codes can be generated for base amount, base fee, additional fee and markup using logic for the EntryRole input parameter. A transaction code with the BaseAmount role is saved in a macrotransaction, other roles are used in GL Trace and Entry only. The previous version cust_trans code was only called for the BaseAmount role. If only customization of macrotransaction trans_code is needed (that is inherited by certain rules into gl_trace and entry) then a condition on this EntryRole should be added.

    Updated Manuals: [accounting\WAY4_Accounting.pdf] [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50685]

    • For name generation by the menu item "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Generate Transaction Dictionary" added the CUST_TRANS_DICT() procedure to customise generation of names in MESS_DICT.

  • [CARDS-50776]

    • The trf.ACNT_DOMAIN_SET function has been removed from the TRF package specification.

  • [CARDS-50784]

    • Warning message that "Payment receiver is not found for client and payment type" during order document processing is created only for SEPA documents.

  • [CARDS-50872]

    • A new field, "Social Security Number" has been added to the CLIENT table.

    Updated Manuals: [issuing\user_manuals\Issuing_Module.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50888]

    • Value 'Skip' is added into the drop down list for "Correction action" field into Contract Parameters.srd form

    Updated Manuals: [core\Contract_and_Client_Classifiers.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50896]

    • Pending totals (amount and number of transactions) will be showed in the Acnt Balance.srd form

    Updated Manuals: [core\Balance_types.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50897]

    • Balance history for declined authorisations is now saved (Life, Year, Billing total entry amounts and quantity).

    Updated Manuals: [core\Balance_types.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50898]

    • The procedure for calculating the amount and number of transactions / amount and number of reversal transactions for a calendar year (YTD) for service-based balance types with History Mode="BIlling Date (After)"/ "BIlling Date (Before)" configuration has been changed. Previous system behaviour was to clear the history counters on the date of closing a contract's 12th billing cycle. The new behaviour is to clear them when the new calendar year begins.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Balance_types.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50899]

    • Support of maximum and minimum balance history has been added The SAVE_LIMITS balance type tag is now supported. If this tag is set, the history of current balance(trg_amount), max balance (trg_amount_2), max balance date(trg_date_2) min balance (trg_amount_3), min balance date(trg_date_3) is saved for each billing period into ACNT_LOG(msg_code=BAL_LIM, msg_group_code balance code).

    Updated Manuals: [core\Balance_types.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50926]

    • Additional information about contract activity can now be shown in Financials -> Balance List ->[History] and [Totals] screen forms under OpenWay\Customer Service\Customer Service (and the same form is available in OpenWay\Issuing\Customer Support\OLD Contract Info): Counter of pending and declined authorizations for turnover balance types and maximum balance over contract life-to-date and year-to-date turnover balance types (requires special configuration in Balance Types screen form). Also for turnover balances with History Mode = Billing (After Close), history records after each billing will be saved in acnt_balance_history and will be available for viewing via the screen forms mentioned above.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Balance_types.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50940]

    • Balance type validation error messages are changed

    Updated Manuals: [core\Balance_types.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51045]

    • Added the ability to skip special events posting for a secondary document (repost, reversal or adjustment). The SKIP_ON_SECONDARY_DOC tag should be set in an event type if it should not be created when the secondary document is posted.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Events.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51152]

    • New columns VALUE_TYPE, PARM_ROLE have been added to the CONTRACT_PARAMETER view. The CLIENT_PARAMETER view has been added with an additional filter, Current Value Location in (Client, Classifier).

  • [CARDS-51381]

    • A new value, FEE_CURR, can now be used for the REDEF_FEE_ACC_CURR tag.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51386]

    • A new value, FEE_CURR, can now be used for the REDEF_FEE_ACC_CURR tag.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51402]

    • Added standard dictionary of payment systems supported by WAY4 (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Common Handbooks\Standard Handbooks - records with PAYMENT_SYSTEM Handbook Type). The form OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Routing\IPS Product Definition is based on the new handbook.

  • [CARDS-51895]

    • The ability to post Event chains in a user-defined order has been added. A new field, "Step N" should be filled in for the Events in the chain to specify their posting order. A new event posting mode, DEPENDENT_CHAIN has been introduced to provide proper condition checking for cases when an Event depends on the results of previous Events in the chain.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Events.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52250]

    • The KEEP_CONTRACT_ID tag is set in a Misc Service (Service Details) or transaction subtype (Fee Algorithm). When a Misc document is created, the contract identifier is specified in add_info.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description]

  • [CARDS-52349]

    • The "Active Tariffs" form in OpenWay\Tariffs\Tariff for Contracts (Edit Personal) - Active Trf has been enhanced. Tariffs specified in the account scheme, account templates, services, standing orders and date schemes are shown with the "Yes" value in the "Used In Cfg" field of the form.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52531]

    • New actions to recalculate contract functional dates have been added to the CSS screen OpenWay\Customer Service\Customer Service -> [Contr.Dates] form.

    Updated Manuals: [] [product_management\Functional_Dates.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52720]

    • Extended IF_CS_TYPE_FOR, IF_PARM_FOR to check source/target contracts for a document.

  • [CARDS-53468]

    • A new work mode has been added to acnt_api.PREPARE_ENTRY_DATA0() - with the parameters ObjToCache => acnt_api.CollScopeFinAndAuth and AuthFilterMode => acnt_api.afAllNonFin. The API returns authorization and financial documents with balance changes, and records from credit_history that did not change balances and/or account Amount Available. - with the parameters ObjToCache => acnt_api.CollScopeAllCreditHistory and AuthFilterMode => acnt_api.afAllNonFin. The API returns only records from credit_history that did not change balances and/or account Amount Available.

  • [CARDS-53469]

    • In API acnt_api.PREPARE_ENTRY_DATA0() with call mode AuthFilterMode => acnt_api.afAllNonFin added a filter: API returns records from credit_history with service_class from list: Balance Inquiry, Top Up, Online Payment, External Payment, Online Statement, Verification, Additional Online Service.

  • [CARDS-53474]

    • A new work mode has been added to acnt_api.PREPARE_ENTRY_DATA0() with the parameters ObjToCache => acnt_api.CollScopeFinAndAuth, AuthFilterMode => acnt_api.afAllWithNonFin. The API returns authorization and financial documents with balance changes, and records from credit_history which did not change balances and/or an account's Amount Available.

  • [CARDS-54440]

    • Contract balance refreshing functionality called from the menu item "OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special Contract Utilities\Recalc Balances for Contracts" has been optimized.

  • [CARDS-54474]

    • Implemented flexible redefinition of Effective Contract for Balance Type posting.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Balance_types.pdf] [tags description]

  • [CARDS-54551]

    • A new parameter "P_LIAB_TOP_SQL" has been added to the "Cardholder_Contract_Statement.rdf" report. The length is varchar2(4096). The default value for this parameter is "select a.id from client c, acnt_contract a where c.amnd_state = 'A' and a.client__id = c.id and a.amnd_state = 'A' and a.liab_contract is null and a.acnt_contract__oid is null". The new parameter allows the report to be run in batch mode together with the P_LIAB_CAT_LIST parameter.

    Updated Manuals: [issuing\user_manuals\Cardholder_Statements.pdf]

  • [CARDS-54662]

    • Added a new parameter, "P_USE_LOCAL_CONSTANTS", to "Cardholder_Account_Statement", "Merchant Standing Orders Details", and "Merchant Billing Level Standing Orders Details" reports. The length is varchar2(3). The default value is "Y". This is an internal technical parameter for DB Manager/WAY4 Manager/WAY4 Web client. Added a new parameter, "P_READ_LOCAL_CONSTANTS", to "Cardholder_Account_Statement", "Cardholder_Contract_Statement", "Merchant Contract Statement", "Merchant Standing Orders Details", "Merchant Standing Order Entry Details", and "Merchant Billing Level Standing Orders Details" reports. The length is varchar2(1). The default value is "Y". The parameter makes it possible to change the ability to read report parameter values from the LOCAL_CONSTANTS table . The "P_USE_LOCAL_CONSTANTS" and "P_READ_LOCAL_CONSTANTS" parameters work as a pair. Only if both parameters are "Y" and the "P_CONNID" parameter is not null, report parameter values will be read from the LOCAL_CONSTANTS table.

    Updated Manuals: [acquiring\user_manuals\Merchant_Statements.pdf] [issuing\user_manuals\Cardholder_Statements.pdf]

  • [CARDS-54959]

    • Supported FROM_AUTH=FEE_AMOUNT mode for custom fees. Other values of the FROM_AUTH tag are not supported. If the blocked Fee Amount currency differs from the posting Fee Amount currency, conversion is made according to custom fee Service rules.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf]

  • [CARDS-55120]

    • New actions for balance recalculation, that can be initiated using the menu item "OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special Contract Utilities\Recalc Balances for Contracts" have been added: Balance Turnover Initialization for Contract and Balance Turnover Initialization for Product.

  • [I1409309010]/[CARDS-50033]

    • The ability to recalculate the balances for all contracts of a specific Account Scheme has been added.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Balance_types.pdf]

  • [I205285470]/[CARDS-31666]

    • The ability to launch collection of CMS Statistics (OpenWay\Full\CMS Stat\Create Statistics) in parallel mode has been added. To launch the "DB statistics" process in parallel, the "PARALLEL" parameter and global additional parameter "PROCESS_WAIT_INTERVAL" should be configured with the required level of parallelism.

  • [CARDS-48495]

    • Additional validation has been added to the "Statistics Issuing Business" report for parameters in "Configuration Groups", "Payment Scheme Identification", "Financial Institutions", "Statistic Attributes".

  • [CARDS-49050]

    • Validation of balance types with the COUNTER_ONLY tag in the "Posting Details" field has been added. When this tag is set, an additional check is made that the USAGE tag has the "SERV_TURNOVER" value.

  • [CARDS-49088]

    • XLS_NSPK_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf: P_CHANNEL parameter added. The default value is "W".

    Updated Manuals: [mir_statistical_reports\MIR_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49148]

    • When an Additional Credit Limit is set, the value of the AUTH_LIM_DF tag in acnt_log.msg_details now changes.

  • [CARDS-49235]

    • Doc.Trans_Country, Doc.Merchant_Id, Doc.Sic_Code, Doc.Add_Info.'POSTAL_CODE', Doc.Add_Info.'TRANS_LOCATION' are defined in the document before to start services search.

  • [CARDS-49252]

    • The functionality of Balance Types with the "COUNTER_ONLY" tag in the "Posting Details" field has been fixed for multi-currency cumulation mode (when accounts in different currencies are registered for the contract). The logic for recording COUNTER_ONLY balances has also been changed, now they are "positive" for Advices and "negative" for Reversals. A new technical currency - "NUM" has been added for recording "COUNTER_ONLY" Balance Types. Please see "Client Upgrade Notes" for detailed information.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Balance_types.pdf] [tags description]

  • [CARDS-49392]

    • "SAVE_GL_N" option has been excluded from support. System default behaviour is the following: "GL Number" and "HeadOffice GL Number" are not copied from the parent Accounting Scheme if they are already filled in the child Accounting Scheme. Please see "Client Upgrade Notes" for detailed information.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Client_Messages.pdf]

    • New indexes START_LOCAL_DATE and END_LOCAL_DATE have been added to the CS_DECISION_LOG and CS_DECISION_LOG tables.

  • [CARDS-49563]

  • [CARDS-49569]

    • When an Additional Credit Limit is set, the value of the AUTH_LIM_DT, TMP_LIM_DF,TMP_LIM_DT tags in acnt_log.msg_details now also changes.

  • [CARDS-49633]

    • Fixed an error when an active item was not closed during account renumeration if the account had a zero balance.

  • [CARDS-49698]

    • A new field, "History Mode", has been added to the "Balance Type Desc" form.

  • [CARDS-49701]

    • Fixed incorrect ageing of delinquency amount if the MIN_DUE or MIN_DUE_AMOUNT tag is set in the "Template Details" field of an account template with Due Types: "Payment Due", "Fixed Day Due", "Sliding" and without FROM_NEXT_BILLING; instruction.

  • [CARDS-49708]

    • Inheritance of tariff domain contract parameters has been fixed for parameters without locations.

  • [CARDS-49710]

    • Event chain posting has been enhanced: events in a chain are posted in fixed order by usage_action.id. This sorting applies to immediate posting as well as delayed posting (when Post Immediate = Post Later). The OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Products\Event Types -> [Event Chain] form has been updated - the "Step N" field has been temporarily removed.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Events.pdf]

    • Fixed incorrect ageing of delinquent amounts when the MIN_DUE or MIN_DUE_AMOUNT tag is set for Due Type = "Fix Due Date" in an account template's "Template Details" field.

    • Now we notify both source and target issuing contract by standard posting events (MTR_DEBIT, FIN_REVERSE ...)

  • [CARDS-49912]

    • Overdraft cards are counted as credit cards for calculations in the "Form 250, part 1" report.
