  • [I1608029106]/[CARDS-50076]

    • Fix standing order processing in case when order's currency exponent differs from the account currency exponent.

  • [I1608181057]/[CARDS-50001]

    • Added additional conditions for selecting inherited orders to synchronise "Reason details" with the template order during the MIGRATE_INHERITED procedure on upgrade.

  • [I1608182549]/[CARDS-50069]

    • Processing of product copy (Product template support and Copy branch) has been fixed. 1- Products which are not present in the template are not removed (Previous behaviour: removed with errors), 2- Product template integrity on product approval is now checked, 3- Warnings for product template references for whole tree are provided (Previous behavior - for top level only) 4- Product unlink procedure has been fixed

  • [I1608246647]/[CARDS-50065]

    • Fixed Fee Account search for child Service pack (case when Financial Institution numeration scheme was changed).

  • [I1608298862]/[CARDS-50521]

    • For standing orders, skip reason has been added to the Process mess when the target account not found.

  • [I1608314913]/[CARDS-50066]

    • balance_type.amnd_date and balance_type.amnd_officer DB table columns now are updated for historical records during Balance Type validation process.

  • [I1609216346]/[CARDS-50447]

    • Fixed incorrect processing of parent usage limiter activity depending on document tags.

  • [I1609271918]/[CARDS-50760]

    • Regular fees are now calculated in OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special Contract Utilities\Issuing Contracts - Balance Prediction.

  • [I1610046470]/[CARDS-50530]

    • The method of applying changes for the account templates has been changed during the Apply Scheme Changes process. Now it is done according to payment priority.

  • [I1610157706]/[CARDS-50699]

    • During Apply Scheme Changes incorrect removal of Not Amount Available accounts for subcontracts with a See Main hierarchy has been fixed.

  • [I1611084649]/[CARDS-51053]

    • Contract activity date processing has been fixed for Fin Requests.

  • [I1612133268]/[CARDS-51818]

    • Fixed approval of a child service pack if it was copied from another financial institution's pack and contains additional packs.

  • [I1702196631]/[CARDS-52141]

    • Fixed amount calculation for standing orders with the BY_BATCH tag; now zero amount orders are not recalculated based on account balance.

  • [I1703174475]/[CARDS-52501]

    • Unnecessary generation of "Invalid product changes" error message during Contracts Daily Update procedure has been fixed for contracts that do not have a product.

  • [I1704187095]/[CARDS-53269]

    • Usage limiter's end date calculation has been enhanced for usage limiters with Period Type = Billing for sub-contracts.

  • [I1705235303]/[CARDS-53377]

    • Selection of Bank Date and Local Date for CS Status Log has been changed when a classifier value is restored by a Classifier Action. This is relevant only for those customers who use Reversal Management or/and Datamart.

  • [I1706068798]/[CARDS-53661]

    • When searching for a Source Service for interbranch macrotransactions, processing of the global parameter "IBR_CHECK_COUNTRY" has been added. If the parameter value is "Y", the country will be analyzed on the Target side. The default value of the global parameter "IBR_CHECK_COUNTRY" is "N".

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

  • [I1708081991]/[CARDS-55285]

    • Corrected filling number of documents for an item when posting a zero entry (e.g. when the total amount of all documents is 0). Zero documents number led to closing of zero due instead of creating a due transfer even if the ALLOW_ZERO_DUE tag was configured.

  • [I1801224994]/[CARDS-56482]

    • Corrected inheritance of custom fee amount from authorisation document if amount calculated on authorisation was zero.

    QR Payments

  • [CARDS-56298]

    • Implemented import of Alipay clearing files.

  • [CARDS-55312]

    • Changed constant data for the mVisa request according to VISA requirements.

  • [CARDS-56990]

    • Supported currency overrides.

  • [CARDS-55784]

    • Added the P2P_ONUS tag to money transfer documents if both the Payer's and Recipient's cards in a transaction are OnUs.

  • [CARDS-56441]

    • Added the menu "OpenWay\Alipay".

    Remote access

  • [WM-3037]

    • Fixed error "Neither 'reports_directory' nor 'reports_home_directory' has been declared" in Remote Access client.

    Reversal management

  • [CARDS-53000]

    • Liability contract hierarchy is supported in reversal management. To allow intelligent backdated processing for a contract with liability subcontracts, the STORNO_LIAB tag should be set in its product; in this case, the whole liability tree will be recalculated.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf] [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49255]

    • The USE_AUTO_STORNO parameter may be redefined for a financial institution, Product, or Service Package. USE_AUTO_STORNO=N should be set to prohibit automatic corrections for a financial institution or Product / Service Package.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49412]

    • The word "Storno" has been changed to "Correction" in Reversal Management module forms.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49843]

    • Classifier history is no longer deleted during the correction process. Corrected classifier values are marked with a special status is_active=Z for correct synchronisation with Datamart.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50301]

    • Correction of the current billing cycle are hidden in the "Storno Correction" form (not required).

  • [CARDS-52941]

    • The ability has been added to properly recalculate contract state with correction documents for fees and interest in intelligent backdated processing. Correction transaction types should be marked using the STORNO_DELAY tag with the "Y" value if a fee is posted in Contracts Daily Update with the preceding date and "N" if a fee is posted in Contracts Daily Update with the current date.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-55144]

    • Added the ability to keep properties (e.g. amount) of an event-based fee in backdated processing. The STORNO_FEE_ACTION=REAPPLY tag should be configured in the special parameters field of the event type.

  • [CARDS-55567]

    • Implemented extended logging of backdated processing results. Classifier and balance differences after backdated processing can be logged based on the STORNO_LOG_OBJECTS global parameter. The parameter value is a list of required object types delimited by commas: C - classifiers (default value), B - balances. To log both classifiers and balances C,B should be set as the parameter value.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-48999]

    • Supplementary account transfers are recalculated on correction processing.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49353]

    • Conditions have been added to show only those actions that can be called for a document.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49935]

    • Fixed recalculation of the DLQ_LEVEL, DLQ_LEVEL_INSTL, BEH_TYPE and other "balance type" related classifiers during the correction process.

  • [CARDS-51007]

    • Service-based balances and liability tree balances are now recalculated during the correction process initiated by the Reversal Management module.

  • [CARDS-51829]

    • Corrected filling history of latest operations in backdated processing.

  • [CARDS-52475]

    • In the Reversal Management module, correction of "Behavior Type" changes has been fixed when changes were done at correction start date.

  • [CARDS-52675]

    • Fixed changing of the "Is Ready" contract attribute when performing manual reversal management actions using DB Manager.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52732]

    • Due tolerance configuration is now supported in backdated payment processing in the Reversal Management module. Maximum tolerance supported period is 10 days. In common cases it is recommended to use backdated payments instead of due tolerance setup.

  • [CARDS-53226]

    • Generation of corrections in intelligent backdated processing has been improved. When a liability tree is processed, corrections will be generated for transfers between Main/Sub trees in the liability hierarchy. Additionally corrections can now be generated for transfers to not amount available accounts, this feature can be enabled by setting the STORNO_NOT_AMAV_CORRECTIONS global parameter to "Y".

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-53481]

    • Intelligent Backdated Processing functionality has been improved to correct balance history entry amounts for advice and reversal transactions when a balance type is specified in a custom fee service with an empty Fee Type reference.

  • [CARDS-53866]

    • Intelligent backdated processing now supports instalment event fees recalculation during the correction process.

  • [CARDS-54116]

    • Backdated processing has been corrected so that contract state is not automatically recalculated for financial advice documents with the current date created in SMS mode.

  • [CARDS-54437]

    • When every day including holidays is opened in WAY4 and documents are posted on holidays, backdated processing should not skip holidays when contract state is recalculated. To ensure this, the global parameter STORNO_SKIP_HOLIDAYS=N should be set (can be set for a financial institution). When the parameter's value is 'Y' (default value), backdated processing skips holidays and does not perform CDU or any other actions with contracts on holidays.

    Updated Manuals: [reversal_management\Reversal_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-54678]

    • Due normalization in backdated processing has been corrected.

  • [CARDS-54688]

    • Backdated processing start date is now always shifted to the previous working day before a holiday, according to the business calendar, even if the global parameter STORNO_SKIP_HOLIDAYS=N is set.

  • [CARDS-54707]

    • Due normalization during Intelligent Backdated Processing has been corrected for cases when Item Due was closed after loan repayment.

  • [CARDS-54739]

    • Backdated processing of liability contract hierarchy has been corrected when some contracts are opened on the processing date and others were opened earlier. Now the "Contract Billing not found" message does not occur in such cases.

  • [CARDS-54792]

    • Order of reapplying events with duration type = "Billing" has been corrected in backdated payment processing.

  • [CARDS-55011]

    • Corrected re-ageing due normalization recalculation on payment reversal using backdated processing.

  • [CARDS-55115]

    • Resolved performance issue on due processing during backdated processing.

  • [CARDS-55722]

    • Corrected "For Export" field filling in GL Traces created during backdated processing if the original GL trace was also created by backdated processing.

  • [CARDS-55749]

    • Added clearing of internal state for backdated processing on fatal error. Prevented incorrect processing of successive documents when automatic backdated processing of one of them resulted in a fatal error during mass document processing.

  • [CARDS-55825]

    • Fixed issue. Now generation of GL corrections for misc fee macrotransactions in backdated processing is based on target fee amount. If the correction macrotransaction has the same fee amount and equal GL traces, no GL corrections will be generated even if transaction amounts are different.

  • [CARDS-55864]

    • Eliminated the possibility of deadlocks in bank contract accounts when backdated processing is done in parallel. Parallel-safe structures are used when reversing transactions for bank contracts.

  • [CARDS-56429]

    • Corrected export of GL corrections when backdated processing is performed several times for the same period and the global parameter STORNO_AUTO_HIDE_GL_CORRECTION=Y is set.

  • [CARDS-56493]

    • Fixed instalment plan recalculation for billing day change in backdated processing if an instalment has no interest-based fees.

  • [CARDS-56535]

    • Fixed calculation of previous billing date in Reversal Management when "Apply Account Scheme Changes" was applied during the same billing cycle.

  • [CARDS-56588]

    • Corrected handling of suspended events created in current billing cycle in backdated processing.

  • [CARDS-56749]

    • Corrected handling of events with Duration Type = "Billing" in backdated processing.

  • [CARDS-56868]

    • Corrected item intersection if backdated processing done after account scheme changes apply.

  • [I1607194746; I1608110367]/[CARDS-49881]

    • Fixed restoring classifier values during the correction process.

  • [I1703235650]/[CARDS-53980]

    • Recalculation of due amounts in Intelligent Backdated Processing is corrected when REFRESH_DUE configuration is used.

    Risk management

  • [CARDS-49969]

    • Added possibility to change status for all selected documents at once in forms for risk monitoring by documents: - OpenWay\Risk Management Acquiring\Monitoring\by Documents - OpenWay\Risk Management Issuing\Monitoring\by Documents - OpenWay\Risk Management\Monitoring\by Documents The "Status" button can be used in two modes now: - 'Change Current' to change status for current document, - 'Change All' to change status for all selected documents.

  • [CARDS-50146]

    • The list of Response Codes for the Block action in the OpenWay\Full\Stop List\Block/Release Client menu item no longer contains STATUS_VALUE_CODE = "0" (Release).

    Updated Manuals: [risk_management\stop_list.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49852]

    • Fixed incorrect restriction for usage operations in DDDW on form "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Alerting Setup\Usage Operation Request"

  • [CARDS-50551]

    • Negative Response Code (RC) usage call for not authorized presentment has been updated. it is no longer checked for processing of financial advice for which there was no authorization.

  • [CARDS-51938]

    • Excluded technical operations from risk usage limiter processing. Technical operations are operations where transaction type and service class are not filled.

  • [CARDS-52022]

    • Fixed incorrect processing of usage limiters with the SingleSliding period type when the limiter's period was not defined for a particular contract with an application or manually. Without this additional determination, the limiter is not analyzed.

  • [CARDS-52824]

    • Restored the ability to recalculate usage limiter counters for acquiring. Testing - Usage Recalculation.

  • [CARDS-53763]

    • Corrected the algorithm for calculating the amount to check limits on online standing order processing: the transaction currency is used instead of contract currency.

  • [I1606172131]/[CARDS-50886]

    • Technical operations have been excluded from usage processing except operational usages. Technical operations are operations where transaction type and service class are not filled.

  • [I1606280305]/[CARDS-50040]

    • Form "Usage Recalculation Result" show only records for recalculation processes now.

  • [I1610063157]/[CARDS-50788]

    • Fixed incorrect processing of predefined BIN values in merchant stop-list for risk monitiring

  • [I1610127544]/[CARDS-50701]

    • Offline usage limiter amount calculation has been corrected to avoid errors when contract identifier is absent in document for example in "technical" documents

  • [I1611184862]/[CARDS-51289]

    • Corrected calculation of the amount sign for a parent usage limiter when the transaction direction and FOR_WHOM property both are opposite to the corresponding properties of the child limiter.

  • [I1702106547]/[CARDS-52437]

    • Fixed incorrect validation of merchant stop list conditions for the predefined condition "Suspicious Contra Party" in usage limiters.

  • [I1703038675]/[CARDS-52383]

    • Incorrect processing of several usage limiters with the same limiter type for one transaction is no longer possible.

  • [I1710057271]/[CARDS-55095]

    • Corrected calculation of the date range for display in standard forms when limiter parameters are modified by a tariff.

  • [CARDS-51856]

    • Created a new risk report, "Exceeded Total Credit/Refund Transact. Nmbr to Total Purchase Transact. Nmbr Ratio" (OpenWay\Acquiring\Merchant Risk Management\Risk Reports - Acquiring Single). It is necessary to set the TOTCRDRTRANSNUMRATIO risk scheme parameter (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Products\Acquiring Products\Device Risk Schemes) - Total Credit/Refund Transact. Nmbr to Total Purchase Transact. Nmbr Ratio. Only device contracts for which the ratio of Credit/Refund transactions to the total number of purchase transactions in a period exceeds the value of the TOTCRDRTRANSNUMRATIO parameter set in the risk scheme will be included in the report. Only Credit(Trans Type IDT=0616) and Retail (Trans Type IDT=0515) transactions will be analysed when building the report.

  • [CARDS-51857]

    • Created a new report, Credits_Issued_By_Merchant.rdf. The report is run from OpenWay\MC Statistics Reports\Risk Reports\Credits Issued By Merchant.

    Updated Manuals: MC Interface | MC Credits Issued By Merchant Report

  • [CARDS-51864]

    • Added a new report, MC_Acquiring_Fraud_Basis_Points.rdf, and statistic attributes (OpenWay\Full\Statistics\Dictionaries\Statistic Attributes (custom)) for its support: Trans classifier: Device Type Transaction (PS_TRN_DEVICE_TYPE) Trans classifier: Fraud Type (PS_TRN_FRAUD_TYPE) Trans classifier: Card Present (PS_TRN_IS_CARD_PRESENT), Trans classifier: Mastercard MO/TO/Ecomm Transaction (PS_TRN_MC_MOTOECOMM)

    Updated Manuals: [mastercard_statistical_reports\Quarterly_MasterCard_Reporting\MC_Acquiring_Fraud_Basis_Points_Report.pdf]

    SEPA interface

  • [CARDS-49043]

    • List of payment types is filtered in the Mandate edit form. Only SEPA-related payment types are shown.

  • [CARDS-50479]

    • SEPA mandate activity periods are checked now for start and end date consistency and possible overlap with other active contract mandates.

    Updated Manuals: [sepa_interface\SEPA_Interface_operation.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51294]

    • The "Change Log" link in the OpenWay\SEPA\Mandate Input & Update forms open SEPA mandate changes history, not SEPA mandate application history.

    Updated Manuals: [sepa_interface\SEPA_Interface_operation.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50430]

    • Subitem Security Grants "SEPA Mandate" added to the menu items in SEPA\Issuing Mandate Input & Update menu. It allows access to clerks working with client and contract SEPA mandates

  • [CARDS-50915]

    • The AmdmntInd tag in a SEPA Direct Debit document is set only when changes in the mandate are of any concern for the Creditor Bank or for the Debtor Bank (when any of OrnglMndtId, OrgnlCdtrSchmeId, OrgnlDbtrAcct, OrgnlDbtrAgt tags are filled).

  • [CARDS-53101]

    • Fixed Ultimate Creditor / Ultimate Debtor data export for sepa_customer_to_bank_export pipe.

  • [CARDS-53556]

    • SEPA Customer-To-Bank export: creditor address data is exported for SEPA Credit Transfer.

  • [CARDS-56118]

    • Added check for SOURCE MEMBER ID and TARGET CODE to SEPA Customer to bank export. If these fields are null, an error message is written in the process log and the document is skipped.

  • [I1608299563]/[CARDS-50275]

    • SEPA Customer to Bank Import: Now the posting status is "Waiting" for all reject documents.

  • [CARDS-53351]

    • SEPA. Added the menu item OpenWay\SEPA\SEPA. File Management\SEPA Outgoing Pending Files

    SOA

  • [UFX-311]

    • Add new type of additional statement which provides information about instalments for contract.

  • [UFX-299]

    • UFX Additional Statement now supports send-to-friend transfer data.

  • [UFX-301]

    • Transaction details for P2P authorisation documents is no longer filled with the hardcoded value "WAY4U REQUEST".

  • [UFX-340]

    • Amounts for reversal and adjustment operations in UFX Additional Statement response have now been changed: amounts of these operations are similar to the amounts of Cardholder Contract Statement report (except signs).

  • [UFX-349]

    • UsageRs/Info/CurrentAmount in UFX usage limiter inquiry response is now returned even in cases when CurrentAmount is zero.

  • [UFX-353]

    • UFX Additional Statement now returns Transaction Type Extension for a single bonus operation.

  • [UFX-322]

    • EMVData is now removed from acquiring operation response when it is not present in the issuer response.

  • [UFX-330]

    • Chip addendums for P2P operations are now saved based on chip data from a request.

  • [UFX-344]

    • Performance of UFX AuthMethod request has been improved.

  • [UFX-348]

    • An incompatible change in UFX additional statement response format has been reverted: transaction amount for reversals is positive again.

  • [I1604051762]/[UFX-305]

    • UFX backward compatibility transformation has been corrected: StmtItem/DocData/BankingDt element (added in format version 2.3.64) is no longer returned when UFX version specified in request is less than 2.3.64.

  • [I1612128483]/[UFX-350]

    • Fixed UFX additional statement ordering problem occurring on Oracle 12.

    Scheduler

  • [DBK-3078]

    • Removed restriction which prevents assigning a Scheduler Job to a day of month greater than 28.

  • [DBK-3115]

    • Removed restriction which prevents assigning a Scheduler Job to a day of month greater than 28.

  • [DBK-2208]

    • Reports Engine R2 (batch mode) didn't fill P_CONNID parameter if it was launched from Scheduler.

    Security & key management

  • [CARDS-52807]

    • "PA DSS Implementation Guide" has been updated. The section "Encryption and Protected Protocols for Data Transmission" has been changed. Added a warning that when the TLS 1.2 protocol is used, encryption using the RC4 algorithm must be disabled.

  • [CARDS-52884]

    • Updated "PA DSS Implementation Guide". Full review for PA DSS 3.2 compliance (03.42.3.x, 03.43.3.x, 03.44.3.x).

  • [CARDS-53005]

    • Interactive channels API: a requirement for the value of the csrf_protection parameter has been added. The parameter must be set to "true" in accordance with PA-DSS.

  • [CARDS-53006]

    • Messenger banking: a requirement to not disclose private IP addresses has been added in accordance with PA-DSS.

  • [CARDS-53007]

    • Messenger banking: a requirement for the value of the session_expiry_sec parameter has been added. The parameter must be set to "300" in accordance with PA-DSS.

  • [I1703036213]/[CARDS-52262]

    • Changed incorrect reference to nscipher.exe to the correct <APP_SERVER>\appserver\bin\tools\nscipher.exe in "PA DSS Implementation Guide".

    Statistical Reports

  • [CARDS-56958]

    • Added directory with configuration data file for filter "MIR Statistics Reports"

  • [CARDS-56135]

    • Excluded balance duplicates in the "Account Balances" section of the "XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report.

    Updated Manuals: [amex_statistical_reports\AMEX_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [CARDS-56158]

    • Corrected calculation of "Interest Rates" section in the "XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report.

    Updated Manuals: [amex_statistical_reports\AMEX_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [CARDS-56747]

    • Changed default P_TITLE parameter value for reports GL_Trial_Balance.rdf - into "Account Trial GL Balance" Trial Balance.rdf - into "Account Trial Balance" Trial_Balance.rdf - into "Trial Account Balance"

    Tariff management

  • [CARDS-49357]

    • Priority for attaching tariff sub-domains has been implemented for parent domains with the tag ATTACH_SUBS. The PRIOR tag should be used in sub-domain Apply Rules.

  • [CARDS-51882]

    • Calculation of service fees depending on different tariffs for portions of one transaction amount has been implemented.

  • [CARDS-40140]

    • Extra ITEMS for GL tariff renumeration has been fixed.

  • [CARDS-49116]

    • Now tariff data loading by applications is declined only when there are tariff data records that have not been approved: if there is a tariff record with no tariff data specified that has not been approved or if a tariff record has tariff data and both are approved, tariff data can be loaded via an application.

  • [CARDS-49589]

    • Template Tariff Domain is now shown in the Tariff Domains form.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49591]

    • Added the ability to create and approve top level template domains. Added validation for domain category change if tariff data is not set.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49658]

    • The "Apply Mode" field in Tariff Data input forms now has the "From Tariff" default value. The possible "Apply Mode" field values have been renamed to "From Tariff", "Skip", and "Inactive". For more information see tariff management documentation.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49904]

    • The "Active Tariffs" form, that could be found in OpenWay\Tariffs\Tariff for Contracts (Edit Personal) - Active Trf has been enhanced. When verifying tariff apply rules for a contract, contract conditions are checked.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50144]

    • The ability to set Usage Role tariffs from the current date has been implemented.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50256]

    • The ability to use a discount for a tariff value has been added. Tag DISCOUNT_CODE should be added to tariff "Apply Rules" with the contract parameter code that stores the discount value as a percentage.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50538]

    • A new form that can be opened from Child Product.srd for Tariff Book and Tariff Plans view and edit has been added.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50563]

    • A new button, "Tariff Books" has been added to the "Contract Support - M No Edit" form. For the button to be shown, the contract product must have the "ATTACH_BY_CODE_LIST" tag.

  • [CARDS-51021]

    • PL/SQL cache for Contracts and Tariff Domains has been improved.

  • [CARDS-51097]

    • Tariff personalization forms have been enhanced. A separate form, "Tariff By Contract" that can be viewed at OpenWay\Tariffs\Tariff for Contracts (Edit Personal) - Active Trf shows contract tariffs that are available for personalization and makes it possible to personalize the product/template tariff or to restore the default value. Personalization can be performed by defining new tariff values, all other data is copied from the template/global tariff with the same "Tariff Code Ext" value.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51110]

    • Supported automatic inheritance of a tariff domain contract parameter value from a sub to a main contract according to linked classifier value priority.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51415]

    • Supported automatic inheritance of a tariff domain contract parameter value from a sub to a main contract according to linked classifier value priority.

  • [CARDS-53603]

    • Forms and actions for managing Product Tariff Campaigns have been implemented. A separate license is required. A manual for Product Tariff Campaigns has been created: [loyalty\loyalty_discounts\Tariff_Campaign.pdf].

  • [CARDS-56465]

    • Implemented the ability to set the "BASE_TARIFF" tag for tariffs that are Base Tariffs themselves.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [UFX-289]

    • The UFX schema for tariffs has been changed: some ApplyMode element values have been renamed. On tariff import we still support old and new values. On tariff export we produce new values by default. There is a backward compatibility parameter to enable the old values.

    Updated Manuals: Application Managment | xml_appl_schema.chm Changes Export | CBS Changes Export Changes Export | xml_ch_exp_schema.chm Tariff Management | Tariff Data Export Import UFX [tariff_management\export_import\xml_tariff_schema.chm]

  • [UFX-300]

    • Tariffs with the Technical role are now supported in tariff import/export pipes.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\export_import\xml_tariff_schema.chm]

  • [UFX-313]

    • Tariff Import and Tariff Domains Import pipes have been changed to accept only tariffs with dates in the future by default.

    Updated Manuals: Tariff Management | Tariff Data Export Import UFX

  • [UFX-364]

    • The Tariff Import pipe now supports importing a subdomain without its parent domain.

  • [I1610049471]/[CARDS-50875]

    • Added synchronization between Template Tariffs and Personal Tariffs on tariff approve.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [I1612147610]/[CARDS-51483]

    • The "Duplicate with Data" activity is now available for tariff subdomains. The result of "Duplicate with Data" is that all "Is Ready" status tariff data values are duplicated in the same "Is Ready" status.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-49115]

    • Tariff domain contract parameter inheritance has been fixed.

    Updated Manuals: [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50921]

    • Tariff domain contract parameter initialisation error has been fixed for card creation application in check mode.

  • [CARDS-51486]

    • Additional validation for global tariff data input has been added. When "Start Date" is not specified, the ability to set the tariff from the current banking date will be validated. When it is prohibited, the error message "Tariff Start Date Missing" will be returned.

  • [CARDS-51674]

    • Contract parameters with "Location of Current Value = TARIFF" configuration can be used now in Standing Orders and Event Types as tag values to redefine fixed amounts/counters with tariff data values.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Contract_and_Client_Classifiers.pdf]

  • [CARDS-51836]

    • Optimized load of personal tariffs for large contract hierarchies.

  • [CARDS-52302]

    • Corrected loyalty action limit restriction if bonus service is configured for another contract using the CONTRACT_FOR tag.

  • [CARDS-53170]

    • Service limit tariffs with preference based on Issuer country (Area) can now be used for source services.

  • [CARDS-54126]

    • When approving a personal tariff, Tariff Start Date will be checked by the date of the contract's financial institution.

  • [CARDS-54287]

    • Ageing reclassification behaviour has been enhanced. Threshold amount "WAIVED_PD" can now be compared according to the following rule: account balance less than or equal to "WAIVED_PD" amount. By default, account balance should be less than "WAIVED_PD". To use the comparison rule "less than or equal to", set the parameter "WAIVED_PD_MODE" to "<=" on the financial institution level, or in additional Global Parameters.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [core\multiple_financial_institutions\Financial_Institutions.pdf] [tags description] [tariff_management\Tariff_Management.pdf]

  • [UFX-341]

    • Tariff Domains Export pipe now uses the correct xsd element length for validation of GL_NUMBER.

  • [UFX-370]

    • Corrected UFX schema for tariffs to allow simultaneous presence of TariffTypeExt with TariffCode or TariffCodeExt elements.

  • [I1611102688]/[CARDS-52306]

    • Added check of "Value Days" field length for "Service Value Days" tariff.

  • [I1611186375]/[CARDS-51136]

    • Fixed tariff duplication when a personal tariff domain was copied from another card contract during card replacement.

  • [I1701271032]/[CARDS-51919]

    • Changing Interest Tariff Apply Mode without changing interest rates has been enhanced.

  • [I1704245840]/[CARDS-52943]

    • The "No data found" exception error has been fixed during Advanced Application R1 file processing for Personal Usage Activation, in case of Limit Tariff in usage template.

    Third-party batch interface

  • [I1701316576]/[CARDS-52274]

    • RBS. Outward Processing: Added logging amounts: Total Amount from DB, Total File Amount, Total Source Amount.

  • [CARDS-48153]

    • RBS. Base24 Transactions Export: For AmEx/JCB/MIR/UPI NSPK transactions, CRD_FIID is filled with "NSPA"/"NSPJ/NSPK/NSPU" values.

    Transaction management

  • [CARDS-50570]

    • New financial matching algorithm has been implemented.

  • [CARDS-47584]

    • Corrected limit type selection for source contract in off-line usage limiter processing

  • [CARDS-49391]

    • Tag AUTH_TYPE=TdAuthSchCode in doc.add_info has been added. It can be used for example for tokenization transactions to define special service/usage.

  • [CARDS-50058]

    • "Sec Condition Details" field has been added to the "Primary Doc - Full" form.

    Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50731]

    • Links to authorization documents from Doc - Grid.srd and Card Support - M ByID.srd have been enhanced to show all the authorizations for a financial document.

  • [CARDS-51186]

    • Duplicate TRANS_CODES ("RBS Code") for some Transaction Types have been fixed in the system standard configuration (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types\Transactions - All).

  • [CARDS-54573]

    • Global parameters AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT and AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT_RETAIL which specify allowed difference percentage between authorization and financial presentment can now be set on Transaction Subtype (highest priority) and Financial Institution level. The parameter values could be set in two ways: as a number or tag name. If the parameter value is set with a tag name, percentage value should be set with this tag in the target contract product.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [core\multiple_financial_institutions\Financial_Institutions.pdf] [tags description] [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

  • [I1606172446]/[CARDS-49253]

    • The DECLINE_NON_AUTHORIZED global parameter can be redefined for a financial institution or for a particular document.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf] [tags description]

  • [CARDS-49430]

    • Now we mark a transaction with NE% transaction condition without STAN as authorised.

  • [CARDS-49686]

    • The WAY4Manager form "GL Transfer No Edit.dataform.xml" now displays the "Extracted" value instead of the code "E" for the GL Entry status field.

  • [CARDS-49874]

    • Transit fee collection acceptance has been fixed

  • [CARDS-50268]

    • Document processing in FROM_AUTH=SERVICE mode has been fixed (account selection for main and custom fee is fixed)

  • [CARDS-50545]

    • VISA, Affiliated Base II pipes: Removed the difference between Acquirer and Issuer Fee Collections. Standard forms for Fee Collection document creation have been modified. The new forms should be used. Interchange routing settings are required for incoming Fee Collection processing targeted to an affiliated bank. See the "Upgrade Notes on Impact Changes" section for more details.

    Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Processing_Interbank_Documents.pdf]

  • [CARDS-50688]

    • Transaction Processing: Changed priorities for Transaction Conditions with Token.

  • [CARDS-50826]

    • IPS Inward Processing: Changed inward file rollback processing.

  • [CARDS-50907]

    • Transaction Processing: fixed document status set to to Reject twice during reject item processing.

  • [CARDS-51035]

    • Conditions for the "Message" link in the Mess To Mbr Incoming.srd form and the "Errors" link in the Doc - Grid.srd form have been changed: filtering by the Object Type field has been added.

  • [CARDS-51300]

    • Import of historic acquiring transactions has been fixed to support source contract custom search by Merchant ID (if the terminal ID is not present in WAY4). This functionality is only used during migration from legacy platforms to WAY4.

  • [CARDS-51347]

    • Transaction Conditions: Added default TC for POS Chip PBT/SBT Token and Contactless Transaction Conditions.

  • [CARDS-51496]

    • Now we collect multiple authorizations for one presentment only if ps_ref_number (TREF) are equal.

  • [CARDS-51569]

    • Non tariff-dependent conditions for usage limiters with tariffs are checked before tariff search to minimize database load.

  • [CARDS-51646]

    • Non tariff-dependent conditions for usage limiters with tariffs are checked before tariff search to minimize database load.

  • [CARDS-51783]

    • Matching procedure for Transit (Affiliated) Authorization and Financial documents has been fixed in cases when a transaction from an Affiliated Acquirer is addressed to an Issuer located on the same WAY4 host as the Affiliated Acquirer through connection to Payment Systems because there is no direct settlement (no interbranch routing setup) between such Affiliated Acquirer and Issuer Institutions. In such configuration WAY4 system logs two pairs of authorization and financial documents (from Affiliated Acquirer to Payment System and from Payment System to own Issuer).

  • [CARDS-51960]

    • Country Table: Revised record for Madagascar. Code (3 bytes) must be "MDG", Code (2 bytes) must be "MG", Code (Numeric) must be "450", Curr Name must be "MALAGASY ARIARY", Curr Code must be "MGA", N Curr Code must be "969". No impact on transaction processing.

  • [CARDS-52027]

    • A financial document will not be matched with an authorization that has a different "PS Reference Number".

  • [CARDS-52229]

    • Conditions for the "Message" link in the ROOT\OpenWay\MasterCard\MC\ File Management\MC Message To Member form and the "Errors" link in the OpenWay\Full\Documents Input & Update\Doc - General Form\All Docs form have been changed: filtering by the Object Type field has been added.

  • [CARDS-52395]

    • Functionality missing in 03.44 for linking a financial document to a matched preauthorization document has been restored. If a financial document received in back-office from an OnUs source, is matched with a preauthorization document during the document processing procedure, the preauthorization document's identifier is stored in the financial document's add_info field as the value of the "PREAUTH_ID" tag. System identifiers that a document was received from an OnUs source when at least one of the following conditions is met: 1. A document Source Channel is indicated with the parameter IsOnUs=Yes or IsOnUs=null in the form "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Message Channels". 2. A document Source Member Id value is null or is marked in the BIN Table with the "CAN_BE_ONUS;" tag or the value is registered as "Acq BIN" in the form "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Bank Acquiring Parameters" used for own acquiring configuration, or a financial institution is registered for this Member ID value in the form "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Financial Institutions".

  • [CARDS-52692]

    • Document processing behaviour when secondary documents had a higher priority in the financial documents matching procedure than original documents has been fixed.

  • [CARDS-52768]

    • Document Processing has been fixed to support matching between Financial and Auhtorization/Transit Authorization documents received from different sources.

  • [CARDS-52803]

    • A new global parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT_RETAIL has been added. The new parameter is used for all transactions except those with hotel, car rental or airline MCC codes, for which the existing parameter AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT is used. This parameter can set the maximum difference between authorization and financial presentment amounts as a percentage. If the difference is below this value, the whole blocked amount will be unblocked, otherwise only the financial amount will be unblocked.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52809]

    • Fixed funds unblocking when multiple presentments for one authorization are posted in an order different from accept order.

  • [CARDS-52833]

    • Fixed definition of terminal category to search for target dispute contract in posting history documents.

  • [CARDS-52868]

    • Fixed funds unblocking in the case of multiple authorizations with multiple presentments.

  • [CARDS-52934]

    • Fixed error on adjustment document posting if the original authorization was deleted by the Housekeeping process.

  • [CARDS-53023]

    • Fixed matching of a transit authorization with a financial presentment from an external channel on the sponsor side.

  • [CARDS-53193]

    • Correct funds unblocking is supported for multiple financial presentments and multiple authorizations in different currencies for one transaction chain. In this case, the new pending amount is calculated as the difference between all authorizations pending (without fees) and the financial presentment settlement amount converted into the contract currency. Then it is accumulated under the first matched authorization. The pending value for the initial authorization is stored in the document add_info tags BLK_BASE, BLK_FEE, BLK_CURR.

  • [CARDS-53214]

    • Fixed incorrect filling of source and target number fields for chargeback documents if the message contains EMV cryptogram data.

  • [CARDS-53373]

    • Transaction conditions and attributes inheritance from authorization document is supported for tokenized transactions.

  • [CARDS-53572]

    • Filling of merchant information for Batch Header documents added on document accept.

  • [CARDS-54066]

    • Now the system does not search for transit authorization documents during financial document processing if the document was created in SMS mode (the initial authorization document was converted to financial during issuing authorization processing). If no transit authorizations are created at all due to system configuration, the global parameter SKIP_TRANSIT_AUTH_SEARCH with the "Y" value can be set to omit transit authorization search.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

  • [CARDS-54426]

    • When a financial presentment is created by online processes and the PREAUTH_ID tag is present, a check for duplicate presentments is skipped on this document accept. For partial shipments, documents created by the online module are not checked for duplication.

  • [CARDS-54429]

    • Added new API in trans_api package: GET_MTR_ACC_CURR_EXT() - returns account currency for transaction GET_MTR_DUE_STATUS_EXT() - returns due status from item_due for transaction GET_MTR_DUE_DATE_EXT() - returns due date from item_due for transaction

  • [CARDS-54469]

    • Transaction Conditions: Changed defaults for tokenized base TC to corresponding non-tokenized TC.

  • [CARDS-54501]

    • Fixed the algorithm for custom non-group transaction condition code processing. Previously the code had been trimmed to 4 digits.

  • [CARDS-54720]

    • Transaction Processing. Now the attributes CARD (if no NO_CARD attribute) and CARDHOLDER (if no NO_CARDHOLDER attribute) are added to the transaction attribute list if the MPOS attribute is present .

  • [CARDS-55666]

    • Changed usage change amount definition on financial document posting when USE_TRANS_AMOUNT=F. If no account for the contract exists in the transaction currency, the settlement amount will be used for usage.

  • [CARDS-55708]

    • Added additional check of amnd_state in document accept process to prevent situations when documents selected for processing have been deleted in a parallel session.

  • [CARDS-56047]

    • Optimized financial document check if authorization was not found. No checks are performed if a document was created by the acquiring authorization procedure and processed for an external target. In other cases, search for a presentment with the same authorization code is limited to 10 days from the transaction date.

  • [CARDS-56309]

    • Added the ability for documents from "Hotel", "Airline" and "Car rental" SIC groups to be excluded from consideration as multi-clearing/multi-authorisation transactions by setting the global parameter MULTI_AUTH_STRICT=Y (default value is "N"). In this case, if a transaction is not specified as multi-clearing it will be considered as a normal transaction, with no additional processing for multi-capture/multi-authorisations. The AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT_RETAIL parameter will be used to define the possible difference between an authorisation and financial presentment for total funds unblocking instead of the AUTH_AMOUNT_DIFF_PCNT parameter used for multiple mode transactions.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

  • [CARDS-56672]

    • Fixed interchange routing search on repost of an incoming document when routing by forwarding member is used.

  • [I1511033062]/[CARDS-49655]

    • Routing procedure for Fee Collection and other Interbank transactions (Funds Disbursement and Settlement) received by a processing centre or bank has been fixed and unified. Manual actions are required.

    Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Interchange_Routing.pdf]

  • [I1603021958]/[CARDS-48397]

    • Processing of Reversal/Adjustment transactions with the "Y" or "L" value of the POST_REVERSED_MTR global parameter has been fixed in cases when CDU was unsuccessful and after processing no GL traces were generated.

  • [I1603095080]/[CARDS-54062]

    • Added transaction type category check when matching secondary financial documents. Only documents with the same category will be matched in the chain.

  • [I1604123861]/[CARDS-48810]

    • Now an inward adjustment transaction with a currency that doesn't match that of the original document is converted into Advice and posted on a Dispute account.

    Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

  • [I1605165595]/[CARDS-49314]

    • Now we do not inherit trans condition, MCC, clearing data for secondary inward (OnUs=N) documents.

    Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

  • [I1609055348, I1609055989, I1609215995]/[CARDS-50306]

    • Nonauthorised document processing has been fixed for configurations when the Fee Direction value of a card's main service is "None" but the service has custom fees with a Fee Direction value that is not "None".

  • [I1609232372]/[CARDS-50421]

    • Transaction processing: Removed "Transaction attributes or transaction condition are reset" warning messages. Message is now displayed during transaction processing as information

  • [I1609245184]/[CARDS-50404]

    • Acquiring usages processing on doc acceptance with external device controller has been fixed. (in previous version device auth usages were not applied).

  • [I1610077363]/[CARDS-50572]

    • Max transaction date for multiple authorisations has been fixed, allowing not only the authorisation date to be considered, but the time as well.

  • [I1610077363,I1702062338]/[CARDS-54159]

    • Enhanced the "Lost Authorizations" form to show authorizations with the "Inactive" posting status that remain active due to partial financial clearing. The currently blocked amount is now shown as a separate column.

    Updated Manuals: Core | Special Contract Utilities

  • [I1610103123]/[CARDS-50758]

    • Transaction Processing: Set the additional global parameter TRANS_ATTR_CHECK=N to stop checking transaction attribute integrity when posting a document. Check transaction attribute integrity manually with OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special OpenWay Utilities\Interchange\All Docs Not Safe.

  • [I1610112429]/[CARDS-50641]

    • Now trans condition, card expire, and ps_ref_number are only inherited for FromOnUs documents.

  • [I1610191437]/[CARDS-50757]

    • Improved slow performance of accept documents.

  • [I1610204501]/[CARDS-50960]

    • Fixed redefinition of the DECLINE_NON_AUTHORIZED global parameter for a financial institution or for a particular document when the global parameter DECLINE_NON_AUTHORIZED=Y, but its value is overridden by "N".

  • [I1611072019]/[CARDS-51228]

    • The USE_AUTH_FX parameter is now checked on the global and financial institution level.

    Updated Manuals: [core\Global_Parameters.pdf]

  • [I1611117990]/[CARDS-51595]

    • Fixed fee collection processing if both source and target BINs have the CAN_BE_ONUS tag.

  • [I1611140592]/[CARDS-51760]

    • Fixed saving of customized transaction details for misc documents.

  • [I1612227997]/[CARDS-51672]

    • Fixed usage limiter counter calculation for partial reversals.

  • [I1701227932]/[CARDS-52611]

    • The algorithm for matching Retrieval Request and First Presentment documents has been improved for cases when a secondary document had been already processed and had changed the First Presentment posting status to "InActive".

  • [I1701241115]/[CARDS-52853]

    • Optimized search for authorization documents when multiple authorizations are allowed.

  • [I1701242974]/[CARDS-51980]

    • Corrected contract status check - no reversals are allowed for a closed contract even if there is a valid contract status with code 14.

  • [I1702157314]/[CARDS-52313]

    • When validating a contract subtype, the BIN record is checked even if it is already filled.

    Updated Manuals: [product_management\Products_and_Subtypes.pdf]

  • [I1702208476]/[CARDS-52312]

    • Added a new response type, "Transaction Confirmed", to "Safe Doc" forms.

  • [I1702284309]/[CARDS-52248]

    • Now we trust the PREAUTH_ID document tag for preauthorisation search on accept and do not save duplicate PREAUTH tags.

  • [I1703275173]/[CARDS-52555]

    • Performance of the procedure for matching financial and authorization documents during the document accept process has been optimized for the following cases: 1. Matching a financial document from an external (Off-Us) Acquirer and multiple authorization documents. 2. Matching a financial document and an authorization document according to RRN.

  • [I1704088231]/[CARDS-52726]

    • Fixed matching of authorization and financial documents when they have different source channels or source members.

  • [I1704121217, I1704192844]/[CARDS-52867]

    • Optimised posting procedure performance for macrotransaction processing of Reversal and Adjustment documents if the value of the additional global parameter PATCH_REVERSE_INTEREST is set to "Y".

  • [I1704135142]/[CARDS-52903]

    • A financial document will not be matched with an authorization of a different transaction type even if the reference numbers are the same.

    Updated Manuals: [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

  • [I1704174163]/[CARDS-52971]

    • Fixed reversed advice macrotransaction status if reversal is processed for a transaction that has not been posted and the value of the global parameter POST_REVERSED_MTR is 'N'.

  • [I1704188903]/[CARDS-52865]

    • Fixed incorrect matching between Authorization and Financial documents that have the same Transaction Amount and no PS Ref Number reference specified, from merchants who support multiple authorization processing.

  • [I1704211939]/[CARDS-53054]

    • PS Ref Number equality is no longer mandatory for matching an authorization with a financial presentment, it is only used to define priority if several authorizations are found.

  • [I1704264344]/[CARDS-52981]

    • When searching for an authorization document for a financial presentment by RRN, no time period limitations are applied. In other search cases, the period is extended to 10 days.

  • [I1705030725]/[CARDS-53058]

    • When an authorization and financial presentment have different transaction types, the transaction direction is additionally checked. If the direction differs, documents are not matched.

  • [I1706056360]/[CARDS-53789]

    • Added new modes, SERVICE_TGT and SERVICE_SRC that allow services to be inherited for source or target only, unlike the SERVICE mode which can be configured in the FROM_AUTH tag to inherit services from an authorization document for both source and target.

    Updated Manuals: [tags description] [product_management\Service_Packages.pdf] [transaction_management\Documents.pdf]

  • [I1706057036]/[CARDS-53523]

    • Generation of the "Trace stack overflow" error message during the document processing procedure has been fixed for transactions processed in WAY4 Cards by Interchange Payment System exchange rates (for example, Dynamic Currency Conversion transactions) if Trace message logging was switched on.

  • [I1706133880]/[CARDS-54098]

    • Fixed issue. Now the posting process doesn't recalculate document parameters like ARN for rejected secondary documents that have been sent again.

  • [I1706238241]/[CARDS-54542]

    • Extended PAN mask format with Card Category [:C] for variables (like %CONTRACT_NUMBER[:NXM]%): %CONTRACT_NUMBER:NXM[:K][:C]%, where: <N> - number of visible digits at the beginning of the number. <X> - filler symbol for the hidden part of the number. <M> - number of visible digits at the end of the number. <K> - number of filler symbols; this parameter is not mandatory. <C> - contract category code; only contract numbers belonging to this category will be masked. By default, these are card contracts. The possible values are: "C" - card contracts; "B" - bank contracts; "A" - account contracts and "M" - device contracts; this is not a mandatory parameter, "C" is the default value. Contract Number for card contracts (with PAN) will always be masked, even if "contract category code" does not contain "C".

    Updated Manuals: [notifications\transaction_notifications\Transaction_Notifications.pdf]

  • [I1707121917]/[CARDS-54188]

    • Corrected matching of a financial document with a transit authorization when WAY4 is used as the sponsor for both acquirer and issuer.

  • [I1708033522]/[CARDS-54471]

    • Now "When Available" and "When Credit" transactions for bank accounting contracts are processed without funds blocking. Consequently, if a target contract is closed and as a result redefined by a dispute contract, funds will not be blocked.

  • [I1709135528]/[CARDS-54734]

    • When a transit authorization and financial presentment have different transaction types, the transaction direction is additionally checked. Documents are not matched if the direction differs. The funds unblock procedure is no longer called for a transit authorization document if direction is the same.

  • [I1710194662]/[CARDS-55224]

    • Corrected incorrect routing search for incoming documents if ROUTE_BY_FORWARDING_MEMBER_FOR_CHANNELS global parameter is set.

  • [CARDS-54454]

  • [CARDS-49797]

    • Transaction Conditions: Added procedure to recalculate convolution for transaction attributes. To recalculate, run OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special OpenWay Utilities\Interchange\Recalc TC Convolution.

  • [CARDS-49800]

    • Added basic E-Commerce Transaction Conditions TEV2,TEV,TEU2,TEU,TET,TES as analog of Transaction Conditions NEV2,NEV,NEU2,NEU,PET,PES for tokenized transactions.

  • [CARDS-50996]

    • The "TOKEN" transaction attribute has been set for acquiring transactions according to bin_table settings.

  • [CARDS-54329]

    • Transaction Attributes. Added the SBT_EMV attribute (Signature by CVM Results).

  • [CARDS-55082]

    • Now during the document processing procedure on the acquiring side, the error message "Invalid capture currency" is generated for Dynamic Currency Conversion (DCC) transactions only if DCC Financial document POI Currency differs from preauthorization transaction currency.

  • [I1605303307]/[CARDS-49156]

    • A document's "Trans Cond Attr" field that is filled on document Accept for on-us device documents now contains device attributes.

  • [I1706018366]/[CARDS-53473]

    • VISA SMS: Fixed case when Transaction Switch sends duplicate Reversals.

  • [CARDS-47378]

    • CUP Outward Processing: Fixed filling TC100 'Amount, transaction' field to match its value with Authorization Field 4 when an Acquirer fee is present.

  • [CARDS-47542]

    • CUP Outward Processing: Added the pipe parameter WITHOUT_ONLINE (values: Y/N, Default: N) to fill fields "transmission date and time" and "system trace audit number" from document tags and not from coms_log. WITHOUT_ONLINE=Y should be used when CUP transactions were received from H2H with the required tags and we don't have coms_log records for them (online is not in WAY4).

    Updated Manuals: [tags description]

  • [CARDS-51380]

    • UPI Audit Trailer File Import: Loading Fund Disbursement from FCP files.

  • [CARDS-51392]

  • [CARDS-51419]

    • UnionPay Outward Processing: Supported filling the "System Trace Audit Number" and "Transmission Date and Time" fields from the authorization document if one of them isn't present in the financial document.

  • [CARDS-51827]

    • UPI Audit Trailer Import: Fixed outgoing transaction processing and CHANGE_CURR pipe parameter processing.

  • [CARDS-51873]

    • UPI Audit Trailer Import: Now we don't set the settlement amount for outgoing-like documents.

  • [CARDS-51926]

    • UPI Audit Trailer Import: Fixed file name processing.

  • [CARDS-52208]

    • UPI Audit Trailer Import: Fixed filling Send Member Id field in Funds Disbursement Outward transactions.

  • [CARDS-53270]

    • UPI Audit Trailer Import. Supported creating settlement documents for Fee Collection/ Funds Disbursements (FCP file).

  • [CARDS-53768]

    • UPI Fee Prediction. Fixed determination of processing code.

  • [CARDS-53777]

    • UnionPay Interface: Added the OUT_ST=Y; tag to the "CH Payment" and "CH Payment Rev" message types.

  • [CARDS-54798]

    • UPI Audit Trailer Import. Fixed signs of secondary settlement document amounts.

  • [CARDS-55009]

    • CUP Audit Trailer Import. added the ability to disable creation of settlement documents for Fee Collections (FCP file) by setting the third position of the LOAD_STL parameter to "N".

    Updated Manuals: UnionPay | UPI Interface

  • [I1411267508]/[CARDS-49470]

    • CUP Inward: Now the pipe doesn't load Settlement Fee as Source Fee Amount in the document. CUP Audit Trailer Import: Now the pipe always loads Settlement Fee documents.

  • [I1606160105]/[CARDS-49908]

    • Fixed error in usage limiter validation procedure which lead to reject of authorisation message processing when the message does not contains transaction amount in cardholder billing currency.

  • [I1610275892]/[CARDS-51102]

    • When a card channel is included in the global parameter CHANNEL_FOR_BU_WAIT and the WAIT_BATCH_UPLOAD parameter is set to "N" or "R", adjustment and reversal documents are posted simultaneously with the primary document.

  • [I1611079238]/[CARDS-51706]

    • Union Pay Inward Processing: Fixed Settlement S2 level amounts. Union Pay Audit Trailer Import: Added Settlement S2 level for Reimbursement Fees. Manual Action: adding message types for S2 level Reimbursement Fees.

  • [CARDS-50385]

    VISA interface

  • [CARDS-42503]

    • VISA Enhanced TC33 Acquirer Capture File support has been added.

  • [CARDS-46333]

    • BIN TABLE IMPORT: improved inheritance of manual tags for updated BIN records. No manual action required, they are inherited automatically.

  • [CARDS-47199]

    • VISA Inward: removed BUSN_ADDENDUM tag processing.

  • [CARDS-49183]

    • Now Supporting Licensed Product ID filling in BIN Table for all IPS. For all IPS except MPE bin_table.licensed_product_id = bin_table.product_id.

  • [CARDS-49456]

    • VISA SMS: Now Adjustment message codes contain the EN_CREDIT_ADJUSTMNT=Y; tag by default to allow credit adjustments.

  • [CARDS-49717]

    • VISA Inward Pipes: Now the pipe uses a DB procedure to insert documents.

  • [CARDS-51897]

    • VISA BII Outward: supported grouping multiple clearing messages: such messages with the same transaction identifier are in sequence and in the same batch.

  • [CARDS-52265]

    • XLS_Visa_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf report "Member and Merchant Data" report section now supports Liability hierarchy of merchant acquiring contracts. Calculation of the following rows has been updated: Number of Merchants: of which are acquiring MOTO transactions of which are acquiring E-Commerce transactions

    Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [CARDS-53201]

    • VISA VCF Export (pipe): added the ability to redefine card numbers for some accounts on export for mixed company structure. The prefixes of these accounts must be listed in the "ACCOUNT_PREFIX" pipe parameter value, separated by commas. The new pipe parameter, "CUST_GET_CARD_NUMBER" must contain an SQL expression which returns the redefined card number value.

  • [I1511028927]/[CARDS-49842]

    • Menu item "OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Special OpenWay Utilities\Interchange\VISA SMS ATM Transactions" now gives acquirers the opportunity to create back-office Adjustments when a processing error has been identified during or after reconciliation of any SMS transactions.

  • [I1606289613]/[CARDS-51412]

    • FRS Inward: the original notification code from a message is stored in an FRS document (safe_doc.details).

  • [I1608222937]/[CARDS-50769]

    • The logic has been changed for calculating total active cards and total cards in the following QMR Issuing reports: "AMEX Statistics Issuing", "MC Statistics Issuing", "Visa Statistics Issuing". A card that has been reissued (when the contract with old card number hasn't been closed) is taken into account only once for "number of total cards in circulation" and "number of active cards".

    Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52411]

  • [CARDS-52434]

  • [CARDS-52471]

    • VISA VCF Export (pipe): fixed "status was changed from Close to Open" error when using custom card status (F333 in ADD_FIELDS_T3 pipe parameter).

  • [CARDS-52489]

    • The default value of the P_CEMEA parameter in the "Visa_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" report has been changed, the new value is "Y".

    Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52508]

    • Fixed card_brand condition in the "Visa_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" report.

  • [CARDS-52538]

    • For the "DWH_CONF" configuration group (OpenWay\WAY4 Datamart Interface\Configuration Groups), a new value has been added for the "DWD_CARD_CATEGORY" classifier - "Deferred Debit" (DEFERRED_DEBIT) for a separate card category.

  • [CARDS-52609]

    • In the "XLS_Visa_Statistics_Acquiring_Business.rdf" report: 1. Changed the default value of the P_V_PAY_BRAND_NAME parameter from "V PAY" to "V_V". 2. Supported the ability to configure additional groups in SIC_GROUP table to arrange data groups in the "Merchant Category Group Data" and "Contactless" sections. 3. Added new parameter P_SIC_GROUP_CNTCLS_CLASS_TYPE for configuring data groups in the "Contactless" section. 3. Excluded "V PAY" transactions from the "Merchant Category Group Data" section when P_CEMEA = 'N'.

    Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52656]

    • In the "XLS_Visa_Statistics_Acquiring_Business" report for Visa Europe region (P_CEMEA=N) supported split of transactions into groups: "Immediate Debit" and "Credit & deferred Debit". Please refer to Chapter 1 "General Settings", "Card Category Classification" paragraph of the OW_HOME\manuals\language\VISA_statistical_reports\Quarterly_Operating_Certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf manual for configuration details.

    Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [CARDS-52800]

    • Optimized getCardHolderVerificationMethodsReq query for VDEP.

    • Interchange tariffs have been modified for the CEMEA region.

    • VISA VCR: Removed Reason Codes 10.X and 11.X for Representment.

  • [CARDS-54336]

    • VISA VCF Export (pipe): fixed duplicating erroneous second export of T4 record when a cardholder belongs to more than one company.

  • [CARDS-54425]

    • VISA BASE II Outward Processing: fixed filling reserved "Interface Trace Number" field (TCR1 pos. 118-123).

  • [CARDS-54463]

    • VISA RA configuration has been fixed for Slovakia. MCC qualification criteria has been changed for VISA domestic (intra-Slovakian transactions) manual cash transactions.

  • [CARDS-54559]

    • Visa BASEII Outward Processing (pipe): additional format check for "Authorization Code" field has been implemented.

  • [CARDS-54609]

    • VISA BIN Table Import (pipe) : fixed performance issue.

  • [CARDS-54613]

    • VISA VCR: Added VCR Reason Codes to VISA SMS channel.

  • [CARDS-54698]

    • Changed processing of POS Environment field (TCR1 pos 168): for recurring transactions the value is "R", for installments - "I".

  • [CARDS-54704]

    • The label for the ADD_INFO field has been changed to "Add Info" in the "Reply Doc Part" form opened by the buttons "Doc-Brief ->Pt Cbk/Rpr".

  • [CARDS-55114]

    • Modified the XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business.rdf report. Now "Number of Statements Mailed" and "Number of Statements Mailed with Finance Charges" are gathered only for card categories with the parent value of card programme = "CREDIT" (DWD_CARD_CATEGORY classifier values with the "Parent value"="CREDIT") and multiplied on billing cycles number. Added new parameters: - P_FILTER_11 - P_FILTER_12

    Updated Manuals: [visa_statistical_reports\quarterly_operating_certificates\VISA_Statistical_Reports.pdf]

  • [CARDS-55177]

    • Visa Base II Outward: fixed "Authorization Code contains wrong characters in doc" error when exporting documents with an authorization code that contains the "q" character.

  • [CARDS-55534]

    • XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business: fixed amount balance available calculation algorithm in the "Prepaid cards" section, line "Balance available/remaining at end of quarter". Now: if there are several Prepaid cards related to the same accounting contract in a main-sub hierarchy, its account balance will be included in the report only once. Before: it used to be multiplied by the number of cards.

  • [CARDS-55569]

    • Fixed issue in the XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business report. Now the value "Of which are only Contact" in the "Card Issuance" block is calculated as "Number of issued Chip cards" minus "Of which are only Contactless" and "Of which are Contact and Contactless".

  • [CARDS-55967]

    • Corrected currency conversion when calculating the "Payments Received" field value in the "XLS_Visa_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report and the "Interest Rates" field value in the "XLS_AMEX_Statistics_Issuing_Business" report.

  • [CARDS-55968]

    • VISA VCF Export 1) Modified period ID calculation: if the PERIOD_ID_FORMAT pipe parameter is set to "L", current period ID equals the last day of the previous period for all record types. 2) Added the new pipe parameter DISABLE_CHECK_CLIENT with the default value "N". If this parameter is set to "Y", verify that duplicate T4 Cardholder records are disabled.

  • [CARDS-56558]

    • Supported saving of the Settlement Flag from TC 33 into the SFLG tag in a document. Pipes: Affiliated BASEII Inward Processing, VISA BASEII Inward Processing.

  • [CARDS-56688]

    • Fixed VCR Dispute Condition field processing in inward BASE II TCx5-x7 messages. VCR Dispute Condition is trimmed now.

  • [I1710136911]/[CARDS-55432]

Now DE65 (SRN) for 2Prs is inherited from Chbk by default. For legacy behaviour, the new SRN_FROM_PRS = Y pipe parameter must be set.

    • To implement the latest requirements for Visa Operating Certificates (QMR) Reports issued 9 June 2016: Issuing Report: In the Card Issuance portion of the operating certificates, Visa has removed metrics previously attributed to the "Number of Active Cards" and added a section called "Number of Issued Chip Cards." Acquiring Report: In the Merchant Data portion, Visa has removed / clarified metrics under "Number of Merchant Outlets" and added sections called "Number of Terminals Installed at Merchants" and "Number of mPOS Terminals Installed at Merchants."

    • [VISA REL] Apr17-376 4.5: supported new "Payment Account Reference" field in BASE II Draft Data Transactions. If this field has a meaningful value in an incoming transaction it is stored in the "PAR" tag in the document.

    • [VISA REL] Apr17-364 3.9 : supported Enhanced TC33 Acquirer Capture file format changes.

  • [CARDS-51649]

    • For the "Visa Statistics Acquiring Business" report: - added a new block "MERCHANT ACQUIRING TOTAL" with sums of regional volumes. - calculation of "Sales - of which Electron" subsection in the transaction section has been supported. - the sections "No. of terminals installed at merchants" and "Number of mPOS terminals installed at merchants" have been renamed to "No. of terminals active at merchants" and "Number of mPOS terminals active at merchants". These sections contain information about terminals on which at least one transaction was made during the report period.

  • [CARDS-51660]

    • VISA Interface: added support of Merchant Initiated Transactions.

  • [CARDS-51662]

    • [VISA REL] Apr17-341 2.2 : Added new Commercial Product ID 'X' to the default value of the 'COMMERCIAL_PRODUCT_ID' pipe parameter.

  • [CARDS-51693]

    • VISA Enhanced Acquirer Capture File Import (pipe): the value of the "Purchase Identifier" field (TC33 CP01 TCR1 pos 45-69) is stored in the document's "PURCH_ID" tag instead of in the "CS_PURCH_ID" tag used earlier. VISA BASE II Outward pipe: supported export of the "Purchase Identifier" field (TC05 TCR1 pos 133-157) from the "PURCH_ID" tag.

  • [CARDS-51776]

    • VISA Stop List: Added action codes (request codes) 14 and 54 to the Standard Handbook.

  • [CARDS-51784]

    • VISA BII ONUS Outward Processing: added new "PAN_FROM_TKN" parameter, if set to 'Y' and the "D_TKN" tag is not null, the "D_TKN" tag value will be exported in TCR0 pos 05-23 Account Number field instead of the "doc.TARGET_NUMBER" value.

  • [CARDS-51808]

    • [VISA REL] Apr17-390 2.14 : supported new "Token Requestor ID" field in "TCR4 - Supplemental Financial Data" in BASE II Draft Data Transactions. If this field has a meaningful value in the incoming transaction it is stored in the "WSP_REQ_ID" tag of the document.

  • [CARDS-51831]

    • VISA Outward: export of TCR3 record for AFT transactions is supported.

  • [CARDS-51869]

    • TKN_ACTIVATION and TKN_VERIFICATION requests are connected with Lifecycle identifier. TKN_VERIFICATION and TKN_ACTIVATION_CODE requests are connected with Token reference identifier.

    • Card metadata element in Check Eligibility Response has been set for Visa tokenization transactions.

    • VISA Enhanced TC33 Acquirer Capture import pipe: "Total Authorization Amount" field is stored in the document for further export.

  • [CARDS-52188]

    • VISA VCF Export: additional customization points have been added.

  • [CARDS-52189]

    • VISA VCF Export: added the "ACCOUNT_PREFIX" parameter to define the first symbols of accounts for special processing. Default value is "CH".

  • [CARDS-52190]

    • VISA VCF Export: added "REPORT_TO_LINK_T10" and "PARENT_LINK_T10" parameters which make it possible to override "REPORT_TO_LINK" and "PARENT_LINK" parameters for T10 records. Added "TWO_LEVEL_STRUCTURE"="Y"/"N"(default) parameter. If "Y" it is allowed to set the parent link for card directly to a corporate contract.

    • VISA VCF Export (pipe) : added the "FIN_TRANS_SPLIT" parameter which allows a fee transaction to be exported separately from the main transaction. Added the "ADD_FIELDS_T5_FEE" parameter to redefine T5 record fields for fee transactions. Added the "FIN_ADD_FIELD" parameter for customizing transactions select.

  • [CARDS-52344]

    • VISA VCF Export (pipe) : added "PAN_LENGTH_19" pipe parameter which allows account number fields with a length of 19 digits to be exported. Leading zeroes are added if necessary.

  • [CARDS-52345]

    • VISA VCF Export (pipe): added "T1_FOR_T5" = Y/N(default) pipe parameter which allows export of T1 records when T5 records exist even if the billing period is not being closed.

  • [CARDS-52346]

    • VISA VCF Export (pipe): additional customization points for T1 Last Payment Amount ( F292 ) and T1 Last Payment Date (F308 ) have been added.

  • [CARDS-52373]

    • VISA Prepare Outward Files (procedure): added the "COMMIT_BY" parameter to control intermediate commits. Possible values: BATCH/FILE/PROCESS(default).

  • [CARDS-52394]

    • [VISA REL] Apr17-340 2.1 Processing Requirements for Staged Digital Wallet Transactions. TCR3 record type "CR" is exported for SDWO transactions if this transaction doesn't contain industry specific TCR3.

    • VISA VCF Export (pipe) : added customization points.

  • [CARDS-52431]

    • VISA VCF Export (pipe) : improved export of transactions which do not have a document.

    • [VISA REL] Oct17-510: supported outward (in "client-financials" mode) and inward VCR dispute financials.
